Text

ï»¿Howards End

E. M. Forster

Chapter 1

One may as well begin with [Helen]257-helen 's letters to [[her]257-helen sister]566-her sister .

[HOWARDS END]257-helen , TUESDAY .

[Dearest Meg]278-margaret ,

It is n't going to be what [we]567-we expected . [It]568-it is old and little , and altogether delightful - red brick . [We]567-we can scarcely pack in as it is , and [the dear]569-the dear knows what will happen when [Paul]259-paul [younger son]570-younger son arrives tomorrow . From [hall]571-hall [you]572-you go right or left into [dining - room]573-dining - room or [drawing - room]574-drawing - room . [Hall]571-hall [itself]571-hall is practically [a room]576-a room . [You]572-you open another door in [it]571-hall , and there are the stairs going up in a sort of tunnel to the first - floor . [Three bedrooms in a row there]577-three bedrooms in a row there , and three attics in a row above . That is n't all [the house]578-the house really , but it 's all that one notices - nine windows as [you]572-you look up from [the front garden]579-the front garden .

Then there 's a very big wych - elm - to the left as [you]572-you look up - leaning a little over [the house]578-the house , and standing on the boundary between [the garden]581-the garden and [meadow]582-meadow . [I]0-i quite love that tree already . Also ordinary elms , oaks - no nastier than ordinary oaks - pear - trees , apple - trees , and a vine . No silver birches , though . However , [I]0-i must get on to [[my]0-i host]583-my host and [hostess]584-hostess . [I]0-i only wanted to show that it is n't the least what [we]585-we expected . Why did [we]585-we settle that [[their]586-their house]587-their house would be all gables and wiggles , and [[their]586-their garden]588-their garden all gamboge - coloured paths ? [I]0-i believe simply because [we]585-we associate [them]586-their with [expensive hotels]589-expensive hotels - [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox trailing in beautiful dresses down [long corridors]590-long corridors , [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox bullying [porters]591-porters , etc . [We]585-we females are that unjust .

[I]0-i shall be back Saturday ; will let [you]592-you know train later . [They]586-their are as angry as [I]0-i am that [you]592-you did not come too ; really [Tibby]262-tibby is too tiresome , [he]262-tibby starts a new mortal disease every month . How could [he]262-tibby have got hay fever in [London]2-london ? and even if [he]262-tibby could , it seems hard that [you]592-you should give up a visit to hear [a schoolboy]593-a schoolboy sneeze . Tell [him]262-tibby that [Charles Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox [the son who is here]594-the son who is here has hay fever too , but [he]261-mr. wilcox 's brave , and gets quite cross when [we]585-we inquire after it . [Men like [the Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes]595-men like the wilcoxes would do [Tibby]262-tibby a power of good . But [you]592-you wo n't agree , and [I]0-i 'd better change the subject .

This long letter is because [I]0-i 'm writing before breakfast . Oh , the beautiful vine leaves ! [The house]578-the house is covered with a vine . [I]0-i looked out earlier , and [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox was already in [the garden]581-the garden . [She]528-mrs. wilcox evidently loves it . No wonder [she]528-mrs. wilcox sometimes looks tired . [She]528-mrs. wilcox was watching the large red poppies come out . Then [she]528-mrs. wilcox walked off [the lawn]598-the lawn to [the meadow]599-the meadow , whose corner to the right [I]0-i can just see . [Trail]264-trail , trail , went [her]528-mrs. wilcox long dress over the sopping grass , and [she]528-mrs. wilcox came back with [her]528-mrs. wilcox hands full of the hay that was cut yesterday - [I]0-i suppose for rabbits or something , as [she]528-mrs. wilcox kept on smelling it . The air here is delicious . Later on [I]0-i heard the noise of croquet balls , and looked out again , and it was [Charles Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox practising ; [they]600-they are keen on all games . Presently [he]261-mr. wilcox started sneezing and had to stop . Then [I]0-i hear more clicketing , and it is [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox practising , and then , ' a - tissue , a - tissue ' : [he]261-mr. wilcox has to stop too . Then [Evie]265-evie comes out , and does some calisthenic exercises on a machine that is tacked on to a greengage - tree - [they]600-they put everything to use - and then [she]265-evie says ' a - tissue , ' and in [she]265-evie goes . And finally [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox reappears , trail , trail , still smelling hay and looking at the flowers . [I]0-i inflict all this on [you]601-you because once [you]601-you said that life is sometimes life and sometimes only a drama , and [one]602-one must learn to distinguish t'other from which , and up to now [I]0-i have always put that down as ' [Meg]278-margaret 's clever nonsense . ' But this morning , it really does seem not life but a play , and it did amuse [me]0-i enormously to watch the W 's . Now [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox has come in .

[I]0-i am going to wear omission . Last night [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox wore an omission , and Evie omission . So it is n't exactly a go - as - [you]601-you - please place , and if [you]601-you shut [your]601-you eyes it still seems the wiggly hotel that [we]603-we expected . Not if [you]601-you open them . The dog - roses are too sweet . There is a great hedge of them over [the lawn]598-the lawn - magnificently tall , so that they fall down in garlands , and nice and thin at the bottom , so that [you]601-you can see ducks through it and a cow . These belong to [the farm]605-the farm , which is [the only house near [us]603-we]606-the only house near us . There goes the breakfast gong . Much love . [Modified]266-modified love to [Tibby]262-tibby . Love to [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley ; how good of [her]267-aunt juley to come and keep [you]601-you company , but what a bore . Burn this . Will write again Thursday .

[Helen

HOWARDS END]257-helen , FRIDAY .

[Dearest Meg]278-margaret ,

[I]0-i am having a glorious time . [I]0-i like [them]607-them all . [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox , if quieter than in [Germany]3-germany , is sweeter than ever , and [I]0-i never saw anything like [her]528-mrs. wilcox steady unselfishness , and the best of it is that [the others]608-the others do not take advantage of [her]528-mrs. wilcox . [They]607-them are [the very happiest , jolliest family that [you]601-you can imagine]609-the very happiest , jolliest family that you can imagine . [I]0-i do really feel that [we]610-we are making [friends]611-friends . The fun of it is that [they]612-they think [me]0-i [a noodle]613-a noodle , and say so - at least [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox does - and when that happens , and [one]602-one does n't mind , it 's a pretty sure test , is n't it ? [He]261-mr. wilcox says the most horrid things about [women]615-women 's suffrage so nicely , and when [I]0-i said [I]0-i believed in equality [he]261-mr. wilcox just folded [his]261-mr. wilcox arms and gave [me]0-i such a setting down as [I]0-i 've never had . [Meg]278-margaret , shall [we]610-we ever learn to talk less ? [I]0-i never felt so ashamed of [myself]0-i in [my]0-i life . [I]0-i could n't point to a time when [men]616-men had been equal , nor even to a time when the wish to be equal had made [them]616-men happier in other ways . [I]0-i could n't say a word . [I]0-i had just picked up the notion that equality is good from some book - probably from poetry , or [you]617-you . Anyhow , it 's been knocked into pieces , and , like [all people who are really strong]618-all people who are really strong , [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox did it without hurting [me]0-i . On the other hand , [I]0-i laugh at [them]616-men for catching hay fever . [We]610-we live like [fighting - cocks]619-fighting - cocks , and [Charles]261-mr. wilcox takes [us]610-we out every day in [the motor]620-the motor - [a tomb with trees in [it]621-a tomb with trees in it]621-a tomb with trees in it , [[a hermit]622-a hermit 's house]623-a hermit 's house , [a wonderful road]624-a wonderful road that was made by [the Kings of [Mercia]4-mercia]625-the kings of mercia - tennis - a cricket match - bridge - and at night [we]610-we squeeze up in [this lovely house]626-this lovely house . [The whole clan]627-the whole clan 's here now - it 's like [a rabbit warren]628-a rabbit warren . [Evie]265-evie is [a dear]629-a dear . [They]616-men want [me]0-i to stop over Sunday - [I]0-i suppose it wo n't matter if [I]0-i do . Marvellous weather and the view 's marvellous - views westward to [the high ground]630-the high ground . Thank [you]631-you for [your]631-you letter . Burn this .

[Your]631-you affectionate [Helen

HOWARDS]257-helen END , SUNDAY .

Dearest , dearest [Meg]278-margaret , - [I]0-i do not know what [you]631-you will say : [Paul]259-paul and [I]0-i are in love - [the younger son who only came [here Wednesday]633-here wednesday]632-the younger son who only came here wednesday .

Chapter 2

[Margaret]278-margaret glanced at [[her]278-margaret sister]566-her sister 's note and pushed it over the breakfast - table to [[her]278-margaret aunt]635-her aunt . There was a moment 's hush , and then the flood - gates opened .

" [I]278-margaret can tell [you]635-her aunt nothing , [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley . [I]278-margaret know no more than [you]635-her aunt do . [We]3876-we met - [we]3876-we only met [the father]3877-the father and [mother]3878-mother abroad last spring . [I]278-margaret know so little that [I]278-margaret did n't even know [[their]3876-we son]3879-their son 's name . It 's all so - "[278-margaret] [She]278-margaret waved [her]278-margaret hand and laughed a little .

" In that case it is far too sudden . "[278-margaret]

" Who knows , [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley , who knows ? "[278-margaret]

" But , [Margaret]278-margaret dear , [I]278-margaret mean [we]3876-we must n't be unpractical now that [we]3876-we 've come to facts . It is too sudden , surely . "[278-margaret]

" Who knows ! "[278-margaret]

" But [Margaret]278-margaret dear - "[278-margaret]

" [I]278-margaret 'll go for [her]267-aunt juley other letters , "[278-margaret] said [Margaret]278-margaret . " No , [I]278-margaret wo n't , [I]278-margaret 'll finish [my]278-margaret breakfast . In fact , [I]278-margaret have n't them . [We]3876-we met [the Wilcoxes]3880-the wilcoxes on an awful expedition that [we]3876-we made from [Heidelberg]5-heidelberg to [Speyer]6-speyer . [Helen]257-helen and [I]278-margaret had got it into [our]3876-we heads that there was [a grand old cathedral at [Speyer]6-speyer]3881-a grand old cathedral at speyer - [the Archbishop of [Speyer]6-speyer]3882-the archbishop of speyer was one of the seven electors - [you]278-margaret know - ' [Speyer]6-speyer , [Maintz]7-maintz , and [Koln]8-koln . ' [Those three sees]3883-those three sees once commanded [the Rhine Valley]9-the rhine valley and got it the name of [Priest Street]10-priest street . "[278-margaret]

" [I]278-margaret still feel quite uneasy about this business , [Margaret]278-margaret . "[278-margaret]

" [The train]3884-the train crossed by [a bridge of boats]3885-a bridge of boats , and at first sight [it]3885-a bridge of boats looked quite fine . But oh , in five minutes [we]3876-we had seen the whole thing . [The cathedral]3886-the cathedral had been ruined , absolutely ruined , by restoration ; not an inch left of [the original structure]3887-the original structure . [We]3876-we wasted a whole day , and came across [the Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes as [we]3876-we were eating [our]3876-we sandwiches in [the public gardens]3888-the public gardens . [They]263-the wilcoxes too , poor things , had been taken in - [they]263-the wilcoxes were actually stopping at [Speyer]6-speyer - and [they]263-the wilcoxes rather liked [Helen]257-helen insisting that [they]263-the wilcoxes must fly with [us]3876-we to [Heidelberg]5-heidelberg . As a matter of fact , [they]263-the wilcoxes did come on next day . [We]3876-we all took some drives together . [They]263-the wilcoxes knew [us]3876-we well enough to ask [Helen]257-helen to come and see [them]263-the wilcoxes - at least , [I]278-margaret was asked too , but [Tibby]262-tibby 's illness prevented [me]278-margaret , so last Monday [she]636-she went alone . That 's all . [You]3889-you know as much as [I]278-margaret do now . It 's [a young man out the unknown]3890-a young man out the unknown . [She]636-she was to have come back Saturday , but put off till Monday , perhaps on account of - [I]278-margaret do n't know .[278-margaret]

[She]636-she broke off , and listened to the sounds of a [London]2-london morning . [[Their]637-their house]587-their house was in [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , and fairly quiet , for [a lofty promontory of [buildings]640-buildings]639-a lofty promontory of buildings separated [it]587-their house from [the main thoroughfare]641-the main thoroughfare . [One]602-one had the sense of [a backwater]643-a backwater , or rather of [an estuary]644-an estuary , whose waters flowed in from [the invisible sea]645-the invisible sea , and ebbed into a profound silence while the waves without were still beating . Though [the promontory]646-the promontory consisted of [flats]647-flats - expensive , with [cavernous entrance halls , full of [concierges and palms]649-concierges and palms]648-cavernous entrance halls , full of concierges and palms - it fulfilled [its]646-the promontory purpose , and gained for [the older houses]650-the older houses opposite a certain measure of peace . These , too , would be swept away in time , and [another promontory]651-another promontory would rise upon [[their]637-their site]652-their site , as humanity piled itself higher and higher on [the precious soil of [London]2-london]653-the precious soil of london .

[Mrs. Munt]268-helen had [her]268-helen own method of interpreting [[her]268-helen nieces]654-her nieces . [She]268-helen decided that [Margaret]278-margaret was a little hysterical , and was trying to gain time by a torrent of talk . Feeling very diplomatic , [she]268-helen lamented the fate of [Speyer]6-speyer , and declared that never , never should [she]268-helen be so misguided as to visit [it]6-speyer , and added of [her]268-helen own accord that the principles of restoration were ill understood in [Germany]3-germany . " [The Germans]269-germans , "[268-helen] [she]268-helen said , " are too thorough , and this is all very well sometimes , but at other times it does not do . "[268-helen]

" Exactly , "[278-margaret] said [Margaret]278-margaret ; " [Germans]269-germans are too thorough . "[278-margaret] And [her]278-margaret eyes began to shine .

" Of course [I]268-helen regard [you]654-her nieces [Schlegels]270-the schlegels as English , "[268-helen] said [Mrs. Munt]268-helen hastily - " English to the backbone . "[268-helen]

[Margaret]278-margaret leaned forward and stroked [her]278-margaret hand .

[He]665-her brother was not so well .

It was rather difficult . Something must be done about [Helen]268-helen . [She]268-helen must be assured that it is not a criminal offence to love at first sight . " Because - "[268-helen] But it was no moment to expound the personal nature of love . Like [many others who have lived long in [a great capital]674-a great capital]673-many others who have lived long in a great capital , [she]278-margaret had strong feelings about the various [railway termini]675-railway termini . Chapter 3

Most complacently did [Mrs. Munt]268-helen rehearse [her]268-helen mission . [[Her]268-helen nieces]654-her nieces were [independent young women]703-independent young women , and it was not often that [she]268-helen was able to help [them]654-her nieces . [[Emily]275-emily 's daughters]704-emily 's daughters had never been quite like [other girls]705-other girls . [They]704-emily 's daughters had been left motherless when [Tibby]262-tibby was born , when [Helen]268-helen was five and [Margaret]278-margaret [herself]278-margaret but thirteen . It was before the passing of [the Deceased Wife]706-the deceased wife 's Sister Bill , so [Mrs. Munt]268-helen could without impropriety offer to go and keep house at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place . But [[her]268-helen brother - in - law]707-her brother - in - law , who was peculiar and [a German]708-a german , had referred the question to [Margaret]278-margaret , who with the crudity of youth had answered , " No , [they]3917-they could manage much better alone . "[278-margaret] Five years later [Mr. Schlegel]276-mr. schlegel had died too , and [Mrs. Munt]268-helen had repeated [her]268-helen offer . " [I]268-helen must not interfere a third time , "[268-helen] thought [Mrs. Munt]268-helen . However , of course [she]268-helen did . [She]268-helen learnt , to [her]268-helen horror , that [Margaret]278-margaret , now of age , was taking [her]278-margaret money out of the old safe investments and putting it into Foreign Things , which always smash . [Silence]277-silence would have been criminal . [Her]278-margaret own fortune was invested in [Home Rails]709-home rails , and most ardently did [she]268-helen beg [[her]268-helen niece]710-her niece to imitate [her]278-margaret . " Then [we]3918-we should be together , [dear]3903-dear . "[278-margaret] [Margaret]278-margaret , out of politeness , invested a few hundreds in [the Nottingham and Derby Railway]711-the nottingham and derby railway , and though the Foreign Things did admirably and the [Nottingham]27-nottingham and [Derby]28-derby declined with the steady dignity of which only [Home Rails]709-home rails are capable , [Mrs. Munt]268-helen never ceased to rejoice , and to say , " [I]268-helen did manage that , at all events . "[268-helen] This year [Helen]268-helen came of age , and exactly the same thing happened in [Helen]268-helen 's case ; [she]268-helen also would shift [her]268-helen money out of Consols , but [she]268-helen , too , almost without being pressed , consecrated a fraction of it to [the [Nottingham]27-nottingham and [Derby Railway]29-derby railway]711-the nottingham and derby railway . [They]716-the girls saw [too many people at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place]717-too many people at wickham place - [unshaven musicians]718-unshaven musicians , [an actress]719-an actress even , [German cousins]720-german cousins [one]602-one knows what [foreigners]722-foreigners are , [acquaintances]723-acquaintances picked up at Continental hotels one knows what [they]722-foreigners are too . It was interesting , and down at [Swanage]12-swanage [no one]700-no one appreciated culture more than [Mrs. Munt]268-helen ; but it was dangerous , and disaster was bound to come . How right [she]268-helen was , and how lucky to be on the spot when the disaster came !

[The train]3884-the train sped northward , under [innumerable tunnels]726-innumerable tunnels . It was only an hour 's journey , but [Mrs. Munt]268-helen had to raise and lower the window again and again . [She]268-helen passed through [the South Welwyn Tunnel]30-the south welwyn tunnel , saw light for a moment , and entered [the North Welwyn Tunnel]31-the north welwyn tunnel , of tragic fame . [She]268-helen traversed [the immense viaduct]727-the immense viaduct , whose arches span [untroubled meadows]728-untroubled meadows and the dreamy flow of [Tewin Water]32-tewin water . [She]268-helen skirted [the parks of [politicians]730-politicians]729-the parks of politicians . At times [the Great North Road]731-the great north road accompanied [her]268-helen , more suggestive of infinity than [any railway]732-any railway , awakening , after a nap of a hundred years , to such life as is conferred by the stench of [motor - cars]733-motor - cars , and to such culture as is implied by the advertisements of antibilious pills . To history , to tragedy , to the past , to the future , [Mrs. Munt]268-helen remained equally indifferent ; [hers]268-helen but to concentrate on the end of [her]268-helen journey , and to rescue poor [Helen]268-helen from this dreadful mess .

[The station for Howards End]734-the station for howards end was at [Hilton]33-hilton , [one of [the large villages that are strung so frequently along [the North Road]34-the north road]736-the large villages that are strung so frequently along the north road , and that owe [their]736-the large villages that are strung so frequently along the north road size to the traffic of coaching and pre - coaching days]735-one of the large villages that are strung so frequently along the north road , and that owe their size to the traffic of coaching and pre - coaching days . Beyond [these tumuli habitations]744-these tumuli habitations thickened , and [the train]3884-the train came to a standstill in a tangle that was almost [a town]746-a town .

[The station]671-the station , like the scenery , like [Helen]268-helen 's letters , struck an indeterminate note . Into which country will it lead , [England]35-england or [Suburbia]748-suburbia ? " [I]268-helen should like to come UP , "[268-helen] said [Mrs. Munt]268-helen , not committing [herself]268-helen to nourishment until [she]268-helen had studied [[Helen]268-helen 's lover]759-helen 's lover a little more . " In front or behind ? Which do [you]268-helen prefer ? It may be windy in front . "[759-helen 's lover]

Chapter 4

[Helen]268-helen and [[her]268-helen aunt]635-her aunt returned to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place in a state of collapse , and for a little time [Margaret]278-margaret had [three invalids]828-three invalids on [her]278-margaret hands . [Mrs. Munt]268-helen soon recovered . [She]268-helen possessed to a remarkable degree the power of distorting the past , and before many days were over [she]268-helen had forgotten the part played by [her]268-helen own imprudence in the catastrophe . Even at the crisis [she]268-helen had cried , " Thank goodness , poor [Margaret]278-margaret is saved this ! "[268-helen] which during the journey to [London]2-london evolved into , " It had to be gone through by [someone]3985-someone , "[268-helen] which in its turn ripened into the permanent form of " The one time [I]268-helen really did help [[Emily]275-emily 's girls]3986-emily 's girls was over the Wilcox business . "[268-helen] But [Helen]268-helen was [a more serious patient]829-a more serious patient . New ideas had burst upon [her]268-helen like a thunder clap , and by [them]830-them and by [her]268-helen reverberations [she]268-helen had been stunned .

The truth was that [she]268-helen had fallen in love , not with [an individual]831-an individual , but with [a family]832-a family .

Before [Paul]259-paul arrived [she]268-helen had , as it were , been tuned up into [his]259-paul key . The energy of [the Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes had fascinated [her]268-helen , had created new images of beauty in [her]268-helen responsive mind . To be all day with [them]263-the wilcoxes in the open air , to sleep at night under [their]263-the wilcoxes roof , had seemed the supreme joy of life , and had led to that abandonment of personality that is a possible prelude to love . [She]268-helen had liked giving in to [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox , or [Evie]265-evie , or [Charles]261-mr. wilcox ; [she]268-helen had liked being told that [her]268-helen notions of life were sheltered or academic ; that Equality was nonsense , Votes for [Women]615-women nonsense , Socialism nonsense , Art and Literature , except when conducive to strengthening the character , nonsense . One by one [the Schlegel fetiches]834-the schlegel fetiches had been overthrown , and , though professing to defend [them]834-the schlegel fetiches , [she]268-helen had rejoiced . When [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox said that [one sound man of business]835-one sound man of business did more good to [the world]836-the world than [a dozen of [[your]838-your social reformers]839-your social reformers]837-a dozen of your social reformers , [she]268-helen had swallowed the curious assertion without a gasp , and had leant back luxuriously among the cushions of [[his]261-mr. wilcox motor - car]840-his motor - car . When [Charles]261-mr. wilcox said , " Why be so polite to [servants]3987-servants ? [they]3987-servants do n't understand it , "[261-mr. wilcox] [she]268-helen had not given the [Schlegel]278-margaret retort of , " If [they]3987-servants do n't understand it , [I]268-helen do . "[268-helen] No ; [she]268-helen had vowed to be less polite to [servants]3987-servants in the future . " [I]268-helen am swathed in ca nt , "[268-helen] [she]268-helen thought , " and it is good for [me]268-helen to be stripped of it . "[268-helen] And all that [she]268-helen thought or did or breathed was a quiet preparation for [Paul]259-paul . [Paul]259-paul was inevitable . [Charles]261-mr. wilcox was taken up with [another girl]842-another girl , [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox was so old , [Evie]265-evie so young , [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox so different . Round [the absent brother]843-the absent brother [she]268-helen began to throw the halo of Romance , to irradiate [him]843-the absent brother with all the splendour of those happy days , to feel that in [him]843-the absent brother [she]268-helen should draw nearest to the robust ideal . [He]843-the absent brother and [she]268-helen were about the same age , [Evie]265-evie said . [Most people]844-most people thought [Paul]259-paul handsomer than [[his]259-paul brother]845-his brother . [He]259-paul was certainly [a better shot]846-a better shot , though not so good at golf . And when [Paul]259-paul appeared , flushed with the triumph of getting through an examination , and ready to flirt with [any pretty girl]847-any pretty girl , [Helen]268-helen met [him]259-paul halfway , or more than halfway , and turned towards [him]259-paul on the Sunday evening .

[He]259-paul had been talking of [his]259-paul approaching exile in [Nigeria]38-nigeria , and [he]259-paul should have continued to talk of it , and allowed [[their]848-their guest]849-their guest to recover . But the heave of [her]849-their guest bosom flattered [him]259-paul . Passion was possible , and [he]259-paul became passionate . Deep down in [him]259-paul something whispered , " [This girl]3988-this girl would let [you]259-paul kiss [her]3988-this girl ; [you]259-paul might not have such a chance again . "[259-paul]

That was " how it happened , "[259-paul] or , rather , how [Helen]268-helen described it to [[her]268-helen sister]566-her sister , using words even more unsympathetic than [my]0-i own . But the poetry of that kiss , the wonder of it , the magic that there was in life for hours after it - who can describe that ? It is so easy for [an Englishman]851-an englishman to sneer at these chance collisions of [human beings]852-human beings . To [the insular cynic]853-the insular cynic and [the insular moralist]854-the insular moralist [they]855-they offer an equal opportunity . It is so easy to talk of " passing emotion , "[854-the insular moralist] and how to forget how vivid the emotion was ere it passed . [Our]856-we impulse to sneer , to forget , is at root a good one . [We]856-we recognize that emotion is not enough , and that [men]616-men and [women]615-women are personalities capable of sustained relations , not mere opportunities for an electrical discharge . Yet [we]856-we rate the impulse too highly . [We]856-we do not admit that by collisions of this trivial sort the doors of heaven may be shaken open . To [Helen]268-helen , at all events , [her]268-helen life was to bring nothing more intense than the embrace of [this boy who played no part in it]859-this boy who played no part in it . [He]859-this boy who played no part in it had drawn [her]268-helen out of [the house]578-the house , where there was danger of surprise and light ; [he]859-this boy who played no part in it had led [her]268-helen by a path [he]859-this boy who played no part in it knew , until [they]861-they stood under the column of [the vast wych - elm]862-the vast wych - elm . [A man in the darkness]863-a man in the darkness , [he]859-this boy who played no part in it had whispered " [I]859-this boy who played no part in it love [you]268-helen "[859-this boy who played no part in it] when [she]268-helen was desiring love . In time [his]859-this boy who played no part in it slender personality faded , the scene that [he]859-this boy who played no part in it had evoked endured . In all the variable years that followed [she]268-helen never saw the like of it again .

" [I]278-margaret understand , "[278-margaret] said [Margaret]278-margaret - " at least , [I]278-margaret understand as much as ever is understood of these things . Tell [me]278-margaret now what happened on the Monday morning . "[278-margaret]

" It was over at once . "[859-this boy who played no part in it]

By slight indications [the sisters]864-the sisters could convey much to each other . [Margaret]278-margaret saw horror latent in the scene , and [Helen]268-helen 's next remark did not surprise [her]278-margaret .

" Somehow , when [that kind of man]3991-that kind of man looks frightened it is too awful . It was the most terrible morning . [Paul]259-paul disliked [me]278-margaret more and more , and [Evie]265-evie talked cricket averages till [I]278-margaret nearly screamed . " To think that because [you]268-helen and [a young man]4012-a young man meet for a moment , there must be all these telegrams and anger , "[278-margaret] supplied [Margaret]278-margaret .

[Helen]268-helen nodded .

" [I]268-helen 've often thought about it , [Helen]268-helen . It 's one of the most interesting things in [the world]836-the world . " Amen ! "[268-helen]

So [the Wilcox episode]866-the wilcox episode fell into the background , leaving behind it memories of sweetness and horror that mingled , and [the sisters]864-the sisters pursued the life that [Helen]268-helen had commended . [They]864-the sisters talked to [each other]3977-each other and to [other people]869-other people , [they]864-the sisters filled [the tall thin house at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place]870-the tall thin house at wickham place with [those whom [they]864-the sisters liked or could befriend]871-those whom they liked or could befriend . [They]864-the sisters even attended public meetings . In [their]864-the sisters own fashion [they]864-the sisters cared deeply about politics , though not as [politicians]730-politicians would have [us]873-us care ; [they]864-the sisters desired that public life should mirror whatever is good in the life within . Temperance , tolerance , and sexual equality were intelligible cries to [them]864-the sisters ; whereas [they]864-the sisters did not follow [our]873-us Forward Policy in [Thibet]39-thibet with the keen attention that it merits , and would at times dismiss [the whole British Empire]874-the whole british empire with a puzzled , if reverent , sigh . Not out of [them]864-the sisters are the shows of history erected : [the world]836-the world would be [a grey , bloodless place]876-a grey , bloodless place were it entirely composed of [Miss Schlegels]270-the schlegels . But [the world]836-the world being what it is , perhaps [they]864-the sisters shine out in it like stars .

A word on [their]864-the sisters origin . [They]864-the sisters were not " English to the backbone , "[864-the sisters] as [[their]864-the sisters aunt]715-their aunt had piously asserted . But , on the other band , [they]864-the sisters were not " [Germans of the dreadful sort]4016-germans of the dreadful sort . "[864-the sisters] [[Their]864-the sisters father]879-their father had belonged to a type that was more prominent in [Germany]3-germany fifty years ago than now . [He]879-their father was not [the aggressive German]880-the aggressive german , so dear to [the English journalist]881-the english journalist , nor the domestic German , so dear to [the English wit]882-the english wit . If one classed [him]879-their father at all it would be as [the countryman of [Hegel]884-hegel and [Kant]285-kant]883-the countryman of hegel and kant , as [the idealist , inclined to be dreamy , whose Imperialism was the Imperialism of the air]885-the idealist , inclined to be dreamy , whose imperialism was the imperialism of the air . Not that [his]879-their father life had been inactive . [He]879-their father had fought like blazes against [Denmark]40-denmark , [Austria]41-austria , [France]42-france . But [he]879-their father had fought without visualizing the results of victory . A hint of the truth broke on [him]879-their father after [Sedan]286-sedan , when [he]879-their father saw the dyed moustaches of [Napoleon]287-napoleon going grey ; another when [he]879-their father entered [Paris]43-paris , and saw the smashed windows of [the Tuileries]44-the tuileries . Peace came - it was all very immense , one had turned into [an Empire]886-an empire - but [he]879-their father knew that some quality had vanished for which [not all [Alsace]45-alsace - [Lorraine]46-lorraine]887-not all alsace - lorraine could compensate [him]879-their father . [Germany]3-germany [a commercial Power]888-a commercial power , [Germany]3-germany [a naval Power]889-a naval power , [[Germany]3-germany with [colonies here]891-colonies here and a Forward Policy there]890-germany with colonies here and a forward policy there , and legitimate aspirations in [the other place]892-the other place , might appeal to [others]893-others , and be fitly served by [them]893-others ; for [his]879-their father own part , [he]879-their father abstained from the fruits of victory , and naturalized [himself]879-their father in [England]35-england . [The more earnest members of [[his]879-their father family]895-his family]894-the more earnest members of his family never forgave [him]879-their father , and knew that [[his]879-their father children]896-his children , though [scarcely English of the dreadful sort]897-scarcely english of the dreadful sort , would never be German to the backbone . [He]879-their father had obtained work in [one of [[our]899-our provincial Universities]900-our provincial universities]898-one of our provincial universities , and there married [Poor Emily or Die Englanderin]275-emily as the case may be , and as [she]901-she had money , [they]902-they proceeded to [London]2-london , and came to know [a good many people]903-a good many people . But [his]879-their father gaze was always fixed beyond [the sea]904-the sea . It was [his]879-their father hope that the clouds of materialism obscuring [the Fatherland]47-the fatherland would part in time , and the mild intellectual light re - emerge . " Do [you]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew imply that [we]899-our [Germans]269-germans are stupid , [Uncle Ernst]288-uncle ernst ? "[905-a haughty and magnificent nephew] exclaimed [a haughty and magnificent nephew]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew . [Uncle Ernst]288-uncle ernst replied , " To [my]288-uncle ernst mind . [You]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew use the intellect , but [you]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew no longer care about it . That [I]288-uncle ernst call stupidity . "[288-uncle ernst] As [the haughty nephew]906-the haughty nephew did not follow , [he]288-uncle ernst continued , " [You]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew only care about the ' things that [you]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew can use , and therefore arrange them in the following order : Money , supremely useful ; intellect , rather useful ; imagination , of no use at all . No "[288-uncle ernst] - for the other had protested - " [your]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew Pan - Germanism is no more imaginative than is [[our]899-our Imperialism]4017-our imperialism over here . It is the vice of a vulgar mind to be thrilled by bigness , to think that a thousand square miles are a thousand times more wonderful than one square mile , and that a million square miles are almost the same as heaven . That is not imagination . No , it kills it . When [[their]269-germans poets]4018-their poets over here try to celebrate bigness [they]269-germans are dead at once , and naturally . [[Your]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew poets]4019-your poets too are dying , [[your]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew philosophers]4020-your philosophers , [[your]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew musicians]4021-your musicians , to whom [Europe]48-europe has listened for two hundred years . Gone . Gone with [the little courts that nurtured [them]269-germans]4022-the little courts that nurtured them - gone with [Esterhaz]49-esterhaz and [Weimar]289-weimar . What ? What 's that ? [[Your]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew Universities]4023-your universities ? Oh , yes , [you]905-a haughty and magnificent nephew have [learned men]4024-learned men , who collect more facts than do [the learned men of [England]35-england]4025-the learned men of england . [They]4024-learned men collect facts , and facts , and empires of facts . But which of [them]4024-learned men will rekindle the light within ? "[288-uncle ernst]

To all this [Margaret]278-margaret listened , sitting on [the haughty nephew]906-the haughty nephew 's knee .

It was a unique education for [the little girls]908-the little girls . [The haughty nephew]906-the haughty nephew would be at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place one day , bringing with [him]906-the haughty nephew [an even haughtier wife]910-an even haughtier wife , both convinced that [Germany]3-germany was appointed by [God]290-god to govern [the world]836-the world . [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley would come the next day , convinced that [Great Britain]50-great britain had been appointed to the same post by [the same authority]912-the same authority . Were both [these loud - voiced parties]913-these loud - voiced parties right ? On one occasion [they]913-these loud - voiced parties had met , and [Margaret]278-margaret with clasped hands had implored [them]913-these loud - voiced parties to argue the subject out in [her]278-margaret presence . Whereat [they]913-these loud - voiced parties blushed , and began to talk about the weather . " [Papa]291-papa "[278-margaret] [she]278-margaret cried - [she]278-margaret was [a most offensive child]914-a most offensive child - " why will [they]913-these loud - voiced parties not discuss this most clear question ? "[278-margaret] [[Her]278-margaret father]915-her father , surveying the parties grimly , replied that [he]915-her father did not know . Putting [her]278-margaret head on one side , [Margaret]278-margaret then remarked , " To [me]278-margaret one of two things is very clear ; either [God]290-god does not know [his]290-god own mind about [England]35-england and [Germany]3-germany , or else these do not know the mind of [God]290-god . "[278-margaret] [A hateful little girl]916-a hateful little girl , but at thirteen [she]278-margaret had grasped a dilemma that [most people]844-most people travel through life without perceiving . [Her]278-margaret brain darted up and down ; it grew pliant and strong . [Her]278-margaret conclusion was , that [any human being]918-any human being lies nearer to the unseen than [any organization]919-any organization , and from this [she]278-margaret never varied .

[Helen]268-helen advanced along the same lines , though with a more irresponsible tread . In character [she]268-helen resembled [[her]268-helen sister]566-her sister , but [she]268-helen was pretty , and so apt to have a more amusing time . [People]3893-people gathered round [her]268-helen more readily , especially when [they]3893-people were [new acquaintances]922-new acquaintances , and [she]268-helen did enjoy a little homage very much . When [[their]923-their father]879-their father died and [they]923-their ruled alone at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , [she]268-helen often absorbed [the whole of [the company]926-the company]925-the whole of the company , while [Margaret]278-margaret - both were [tremendous talkers]927-tremendous talkers - fell flat . [Neither sister]928-neither sister bothered about this . [Helen]268-helen never apologized afterwards , [Margaret]278-margaret did not feel the slightest rancour . But looks have [their]923-their influence upon character . [The sisters]864-the sisters were alike as [little girls]930-little girls , but at the time of the Wilcox episode [their]864-the sisters methods were beginning to diverge ; [the younger]3922-the younger was rather apt to entice [people]3893-people , and , in enticing [them]3893-people , to be [herself]3922-the younger enticed ; [the elder]3921-the elder went straight ahead , and accepted an occasional failure as part of the game .

Little need be premised about [Tibby]262-tibby . [He]262-tibby was now [an intelligent man of sixteen]934-an intelligent man of sixteen , but dyspeptic and difficile .

Chapter 5

It will be generally admitted that [Beethoven]292-beethoven 's Fifth Symphony is the most sublime noise that has ever penetrated into the ear of [man]3975-man . All sorts and conditions are satisfied by it . Whether [you]936-you are like [Mrs. Munt]268-helen , and tap surreptitiously when the tunes come - of course , not so as to disturb [the others]608-the others - ; or like [Helen]268-helen , who can see [heroes and shipwrecks in the music]938-heroes and shipwrecks in the music 's flood ; or like [Margaret]278-margaret , who can only see the music ; or like [Tibby]262-tibby , who is profoundly versed in counterpoint , and holds the full score open on [his]262-tibby knee ; or like [[their]864-the sisters cousin]939-their cousin , [Fraulein Mosebach]293-fraulein mosebach , who remembers all the time that [Beethoven]292-beethoven is " echt Deutsch "[292-beethoven] ; or like [[Fraulein Mosebach]293-fraulein mosebach 's young man , who can remember nothing but [Fraulein Mosebach]293-fraulein mosebach]940-fraulein mosebach 's young man , who can remember nothing but fraulein mosebach : in any case , the passion of [your]936-you life becomes more vivid , and [you]936-you are bound to admit that such a noise is cheap at two shillings . It is cheap , even if [you]936-you hear it in [the Queen 's Hall]941-the queen 's hall , [dreariest music - room in [London]2-london]942-dreariest music - room in london , though not as dreary as [the Free Trade Hall]943-the free trade hall , [Manchester]51-manchester ; and even if [you]936-you sit on the extreme left of [that hall]944-that hall , so that the brass bumps at [you]936-you before the rest of [the orchestra]945-the orchestra arrives , it is still cheap .

" Who is [Margaret]278-margaret talking to ? "[268-helen] said [Mrs. Munt]268-helen , at the conclusion of the first movement . [She]268-helen was again in [London]2-london on a visit to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place .

[Helen]268-helen looked down the long line of [[their]946-their party]947-their party , and said that [she]268-helen did not know .

" Would it be [some young man]4026-some young man or other whom [she]278-margaret takes an interest in ? "[268-helen]

" [I]268-helen expect so , "[268-helen] [Helen]268-helen replied . Music enwrapped [her]268-helen , and [she]268-helen could not enter into the distinction that divides [young men whom one takes an interest in from [young men whom one]949-young men whom one knows]948-young men whom one takes an interest in from young men whom one knows .

" [[You]4027-you girls]4028-you girls are so wonderful in always having - Oh dear ! one must n't talk . "[268-helen]

For [the Andante]294-the andante had begun - very beautiful , but bearing a family likeness to all the other beautiful Andantes that [Beethoven]292-beethoven had written , and , to [Helen]268-helen 's mind , rather disconnecting the heroes and shipwrecks of the first movement from [the heroes and goblins of the third]950-the heroes and goblins of the third . [She]268-helen heard the tune through once , and then [her]268-helen attention wandered , and [she]268-helen gazed at [the audience]951-the audience , or the organ , or the architecture . Much did [she]268-helen censure the attenuated Cupids who encircle the ceiling of [the Queen 's Hall]941-the queen 's hall , inclining each to each with vapid gesture , and clad in sallow pantaloons , on which the October sunlight struck . " How awful to marry [a man like those Cupids]4029-a man like those cupids ! "[268-helen] thought [Helen]268-helen . Here [Beethoven]292-beethoven started decorating [his]292-beethoven tune , so [she]268-helen heard [him]292-beethoven through once more , and then [she]268-helen smiled at [[her]268-helen cousin]953-her cousin [Frieda]295-frieda . But [Frieda]295-frieda , listening to Classical Music , could not respond . [Herr Liesecke]296-herr liesecke , too , looked as if wild horses could not make [him]296-herr liesecke inattentive ; there were lines across [his]296-herr liesecke forehead , [his]296-herr liesecke lips were parted , [his]296-herr liesecke pince - nez at right angles to [his]296-herr liesecke nose , and [he]296-herr liesecke had laid a thick , white hand on either knee . And next to [her]268-helen was [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley , so [British]297-british , and wanting to tap . How interesting that row of [people]3893-people was ! What diverse influences had gone to the making ! Here [Beethoven]292-beethoven , after humming and hawing with great sweetness , said " Heigho , "[292-beethoven] and the Andante came to an end . Applause , and a round of " wunderschoning "[955-the german contingent] and " prachtvolleying "[955-the german contingent] from [the German contingent]955-the german contingent . [Margaret]278-margaret started talking to [[her]278-margaret new young man]956-her new young man ; [Helen]268-helen said to [[her]268-helen aunt]635-her aunt : " Now comes the wonderful movement : first of all [the goblins]4030-the goblins , and then a trio of elephants dancing ; "[268-helen] and [Tibby]262-tibby implored [the company]926-the company generally to look out for the transitional passage on the drum .

" On the what , [dear]3903-dear ? "[268-helen]

" On the DRUM , [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley . "[959-a goblin]

" No ; look out for the part where [you]3903-dear think [you]3903-dear have done with [the goblins]4030-the goblins and [they]4030-the goblins come back , "[268-helen] breathed [Helen]268-helen , as the music started with [a goblin]959-a goblin walking quietly over [the universe]960-the universe , from end to end . [Others]893-others followed [him]959-a goblin . [They]893-others were [not aggressive creatures]962-not aggressive creatures ; it was that that made [them]893-others so terrible to [Helen]268-helen . [They]893-others merely observed in passing that there was no such thing as splendour or heroism in [the world]836-the world . After the interlude of elephants dancing , [they]893-others returned and made the observation for the second time . [Helen]268-helen could not contradict [them]893-others , for , once at all events , [she]268-helen had felt the same , and had seen the reliable walls of [youth]964-youth collapse . Panic and emptiness ! Panic and emptiness ! [The goblins]4030-the goblins were right .

[[Her]268-helen brother]665-her brother raised [his]665-her brother finger : it was the transitional passage on the drum .

For , as if things were going too far , [Beethoven]292-beethoven took hold of [the goblins]4030-the goblins and made [them]4030-the goblins do what [he]292-beethoven wanted . [He]292-beethoven appeared in person . [He]292-beethoven gave [them]4030-the goblins a little push , and [they]4030-the goblins began to walk in major key instead of in a minor , and then - [he]292-beethoven blew with [his]292-beethoven mouth and [they]4030-the goblins were scattered ! Gusts of splendour , [gods]968-gods and demigods contending with vast swords , colour and fragrance broadcast on the field of battle , magnificent victory , magnificent death ! Oh , it all burst before [the girl]969-the girl , and [she]969-the girl even stretched out [her]969-the girl gloved hands as if it was tangible . Any fate was titanic ; any contest desirable ; conqueror and conquered would alike be applauded by the angels of the utmost stars .

And [the goblins]4030-the goblins - [they]4030-the goblins had not really been there at all ? [They]4030-the goblins were only [the phantoms of cowardice and unbelief]971-the phantoms of cowardice and unbelief ? One healthy human impulse would dispel [them]4030-the goblins ? [Men like [the Wilcoxes]3880-the wilcoxes]595-men like the wilcoxes , or [President Roosevelt]298-president roosevelt , would say yes . [Beethoven]292-beethoven knew better . [The goblins]4030-the goblins really had been there . [They]4030-the goblins might return - and [they]4030-the goblins did . It was as if the splendour of life might boil over - and waste to steam and froth . In its dissolution one heard the terrible , ominous note , and [a goblin]959-a goblin , with increased malignity , walked quietly over [the universe]960-the universe from end to end . Panic and emptiness ! Panic and emptiness ! Even the flaming ramparts of [the world]836-the world might fall .

[Beethoven]292-beethoven chose to make all right in the end . [He]292-beethoven built the ramparts up . [He]292-beethoven blew with [his]292-beethoven mouth for the second time , and again [the goblins]4030-the goblins were scattered . [He]292-beethoven brought back the gusts of splendour , the heroism , [the youth]979-the youth , the magnificence of life and of death , and , amid vast roarings of a superhuman joy , [he]292-beethoven led [his]292-beethoven Fifth Symphony to its conclusion . But [the goblins]4030-the goblins were there . [They]4030-the goblins could return . [He]292-beethoven had said so bravely , and that is why [one]602-one can trust [Beethoven]292-beethoven when [he]292-beethoven says other things .

[Helen]268-helen pushed [her]268-helen way out during the applause . [She]268-helen desired to be alone . The music summed up to [her]268-helen all that had happened or could happen in [her]268-helen career . [She]268-helen read it as a tangible statement , which could never be superseded . The notes meant this and that to [her]268-helen , and they could have no other meaning , and life could have no other meaning . [She]268-helen pushed right out of [the building]982-the building , and walked slowly down [the outside staircase]983-the outside staircase , breathing the autumnal air , and then [she]268-helen strolled [home]984-home .

"[278-margaret] Getting under way , [she]278-margaret cried : " Now , does n't it seem absurd to [you]1021-you ? What is the good of the Arts if they are interchangeable ? What is the good of the ear if it tells [you]1021-you the same as the eye ? [Helen]268-helen 's one aim is to translate tunes into the language of painting , and pictures into the language of music . It 's very ingenious , and [she]268-helen says several pretty things in the process , but what 's gained , [I]278-margaret 'd like to know ? Oh , it 's all rubbish , radically false . If [Monet]306-monet 's really [Debussy]307-debussy , and [Debussy]307-debussy 's really [Monet]306-monet , [neither gentleman]4058-neither gentleman is worth [his]4058-neither gentleman salt - that 's [my]278-margaret opinion .[278-margaret]

Evidently [these sisters]1022-these sisters quarrelled .

" Now , this very symphony that [we]4057-we 've just been having - [she]268-helen wo n't let it alone . [She]268-helen labels it with meanings from start to finish ; turns it into literature . [I]278-margaret wonder if the day will ever return when music will be treated as music . Yet [I]278-margaret do n't know . There 's [[my]278-margaret brother]4059-my brother - behind [us]4057-we . [He]4059-my brother treats music as music , and oh , [my]278-margaret goodness ! [He]4059-my brother makes [me]278-margaret angrier than [anyone]4060-anyone , simply furious . With [him]4059-my brother [I]278-margaret dare n't even argue . "[278-margaret]

[An unhappy family]1023-an unhappy family , if talented .

" But , of course , [the real villain]4061-the real villain is [Wagner]308-wagner . [He]308-wagner has done more than [any man in the nineteenth century towards the muddling of arts]4062-any man in the nineteenth century towards the muddling of arts . [I]1024-i do feel that music is in a very serious state just now , though extraordinarily interesting . Every now and then in history there do come [these terrible geniuses]4063-these terrible geniuses , like [Wagner]308-wagner , who stir up all the wells of thought at once . For a moment it 's splendid . Such a splash as never was . But afterwards - such a lot of mud ; and [the wells]4064-the wells - as it were , [they]4064-the wells communicate with each other too easily now , and not one of [them]4064-the wells will run quite clear . That 's what [Wagner]308-wagner 's done . "[1024-i]

[Her]1024-i speeches fluttered away from [the young man]769-the young man like birds . If only [he]769-the young man could talk like this , [he]769-the young man would have caught [the world]836-the world . Oh to acquire culture ! Oh , to pronounce foreign names correctly ! Oh , to be well informed , discoursing at ease on every subject that [a lady]1013-a lady started ! But it would take one years . With an hour at lunch and a few shattered hours in the evening , how was it possible to catch up with [leisured women , who had been reading steadily from childhood]1028-leisured women , who had been reading steadily from childhood ? [His]769-the young man brain might be full of names , [he]769-the young man might have even heard of [Monet]306-monet and [Debussy]307-debussy ; the trouble was that [he]769-the young man could not string them together into a sentence , [he]769-the young man could not make [them]1029-them " tell , "[769-the young man] [he]769-the young man could not quite forget about [his]769-the young man stolen umbrella . Yes , the umbrella was the real trouble . Behind [Monet]306-monet and [Debussy]307-debussy the umbrella persisted , with the steady beat of a drum . " [I]769-the young man suppose [my]769-the young man umbrella will be all right , "[769-the young man] [he]769-the young man was thinking . " [I]769-the young man do n't really mind about it . [I]769-the young man will think about music instead . [I]769-the young man suppose [my]769-the young man umbrella will be all right . "[769-the young man] Earlier in the afternoon [he]769-the young man had worried about seats . Ought [he]769-the young man to have paid as much as two shillings ? Earlier still [he]769-the young man had wondered , " Shall [I]769-the young man try to do without a programme ? "[769-the young man] There had always been something to worry [him]769-the young man ever since [he]769-the young man could remember , always something that distracted [him]769-the young man in the pursuit of beauty . For [he]769-the young man did pursue beauty , and therefore , [Margaret]278-margaret 's speeches did flutter away from [him]769-the young man like birds .

[Margaret]278-margaret talked ahead , occasionally saying , " Do n't [you]769-the young man think so ? do n't [you]769-the young man feel the same ? "[278-margaret] And once [she]278-margaret stopped , and said " Oh , do interrupt [me]278-margaret ! "[278-margaret] which terrified [him]769-the young man . [She]278-margaret did not attract [him]769-the young man , though [she]278-margaret filled [him]769-the young man with awe . [Her]278-margaret figure was meagre , [her]278-margaret face seemed all teeth and eyes , [her]278-margaret references to [[her]278-margaret sister]566-her sister and [brother]1031-brother were uncharitable . For all [her]278-margaret cleverness and culture , [she]278-margaret was probably [one of [those soulless , atheistical women who have been so shown up by]1033-those soulless , atheistical women who have been so shown up by [Miss Corelli]309-miss corelli]1032-one of those soulless , atheistical women who have been so shown up by miss corelli . It was surprising and alarming that [she]278-margaret should suddenly say , " [I]278-margaret do hope that [you]769-the young man 'll come in and have some tea . "[278-margaret]

" [I]278-margaret do hope that [you]769-the young man 'll come in and have some tea . [We]1034-we should be so glad . [I]278-margaret have dragged [you]769-the young man so far out of [your]769-the young man way . "[278-margaret]

[They]1034-we had arrived at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place . The sun had set , and [the backwater]1035-the backwater , in deep shadow , was filling with a gentle haze . To the right of the fantastic skyline of [the flats]1036-the flats towered black against the hues of evening ; to the left [the older houses]650-the older houses raised a square - cut , irregular parapet against the grey . [Margaret]278-margaret fumbled for [her]278-margaret latchkey . Of course [she]278-margaret had forgotten it . " [Helen]268-helen ! Let [us]1034-we in ! "[278-margaret]

Beyond [them]1054-them [the thoroughfare]1055-the thoroughfare roared gently - a tide that could never be quiet , while in the east , invisible behind the smokes of Wapping , the moon was rising .

" That reminds [me]1056-the three women , [Margaret]278-margaret . [We]1058-we might have taken [that young man]4087-that young man into [the dining - room]3990-the dining - room , at all events . For that little incident had impressed [the three women]1056-the three women more than might be supposed . It remained as a goblin football , as a hint that all is not for the best in the best of all possible worlds , and that beneath these superstructures of wealth and art there wanders [an ill - fed boy]1057-an ill - fed boy , who has recovered [his]1057-an ill - fed boy umbrella indeed , but who has left no address behind [him]1057-an ill - fed boy , and no name .

Chapter 6

[We]1058-we are not concerned with [the very poor]1059-the very poor . [They]1059-the very poor are unthinkable , and only to be approached by [the statistician]1060-the statistician or [the poet]1061-the poet . This story deals with [gentlefolk]1062-gentlefolk , or with those who are obliged to pretend that [they]1062-gentlefolk are [gentlefolk]1062-gentlefolk .

[The boy]753-the boy , [Leonard Bast]317-leonard , stood at the extreme verge of gentility . [He]753-the boy was not in [the abyss]1065-the abyss , but [he]753-the boy could see it , and at times [people whom [he]753-the boy knew]1066-people whom he knew had dropped in , and counted no more . [He]753-the boy knew that [he]753-the boy was poor , and would admit it : [he]753-the boy would have died sooner than confess any inferiority to [the rich]1067-the rich . This may be splendid of [him]753-the boy . But [he]753-the boy was inferior to [most rich people]1068-most rich people , there is not the least doubt of it . [He]753-the boy was not as courteous as [the average rich man]1069-the average rich man , nor as intelligent , nor as healthy , nor as lovable . [His]753-the boy mind and [his]753-the boy body had been alike underfed , because [he]753-the boy was poor , and because [he]753-the boy was modern [they]1070-they were always craving better food . Had [he]753-the boy lived some centuries ago , in the brightly coloured civilizations of the past , [he]753-the boy would have had a definite status , [his]753-the boy rank and [his]753-the boy income would have corresponded . But in [his]753-the boy day [the angel of Democracy]1071-the angel of democracy had arisen , enshadowing [the classes with leathern wings]1072-the classes with leathern wings , and proclaiming , " [All men]4118-all men are equal - [all men]4118-all men , that is to say , who possess umbrellas , "[753-the boy] and so [he]753-the boy was obliged to assert gentility , lest [he]753-the boy slipped into [the abyss]1065-the abyss where nothing counts , and the statements of [Democracy]318-democracy are inaudible .

As [he]753-the boy walked away from [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , [his]753-the boy first care was to prove that [he]753-the boy was as good as [the Miss Schlegels]270-the schlegels . Obscurely wounded in [his]753-the boy pride , [he]753-the boy tried to wound [them]1074-they in return . [They]1074-they were probably not [ladies]1075-ladies . Would [real ladies]1076-real ladies have asked [him]753-the boy to tea ? [They]1074-they were certainly ill - natured and cold . At each step [his]753-the boy feeling of superiority increased . Would [a real lady]1077-a real lady have talked about stealing an umbrella ? Perhaps [they]1074-they were [thieves]1078-thieves after all , and if [he]753-the boy had gone into [the house]578-the house [they]1074-they could have clapped a chloroformed handkerchief over [his]753-the boy face . [He]753-the boy walked on complacently as far as [the Houses of Parliament]1080-the houses of parliament . There an empty stomach asserted itself , and told [him]753-the boy [he]753-the boy was [a fool]3967-a fool .

" Evening , [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast . "[320-mr. dealtry]

" Evening , [Mr. Dealtry]320-mr. dealtry . "[320-mr. dealtry]

" Nice evening . "[320-mr. dealtry]

" Evening . "[320-mr. dealtry]

[Mr. Dealtry]320-mr. dealtry , [a fellow clerk]1082-a fellow clerk , passed on , and [Leonard]317-leonard stood wondering whether [he]753-the boy would take [the tram]1083-the tram as far as a penny would take [him]753-the boy , or whether [he]753-the boy would walk . [He]753-the boy decided to walk - it is no good giving in , and [he]753-the boy had spent money enough at [Queen 's Hall]55-queen 's hall - and [he]753-the boy walked over [Westminster Bridge]60-westminster bridge , in front of [St. Thomas 's Hospital]61-st. thomas 's hospital , and through [the immense tunnel that passes under [the South - Western main line]1085-the south - western main line at [Vauxhall]62-vauxhall]1084-the immense tunnel that passes under the south - western main line at vauxhall . In [the tunnel]1086-the tunnel [he]753-the boy paused and listened to the roar of [the trains]1087-the trains . A sharp pain darted through [his]753-the boy head , and [he]753-the boy was conscious of the exact form of [his]753-the boy eye sockets . [He]753-the boy pushed on for another mile , and did not slacken speed until [he]753-the boy stood at the entrance of [a road called [Camelia Road]63-camelia road]1088-a road called camelia road , which was at present [[his]753-the boy home]1089-his home .

Here [he]753-the boy stopped again , and glanced suspiciously to right and left , like a rabbit that is going to bolt into its hole . [A block of flats]1090-a block of flats , constructed with extreme cheapness , towered on either hand . Farther down [the road]1091-the road [two more blocks]1092-two more blocks were being built , and beyond these [an old house]1093-an old house was being demolished to accommodate [another pair]1094-another pair . It was the kind of scene that may be observed all over [London]2-london , whatever the locality - bricks and mortar rising and falling with the restlessness of the water in a fountain , as [the city]1095-the city receives more and more men upon [[her]1095-the city soil]1096-her soil . [Camelia Road]63-camelia road would soon stand out like [a fortress]1097-a fortress , and command , for a little , an extensive view . Only for a little . Plans were out for the erection of [flats in [Magnolia Road]64-magnolia road]1098-flats in magnolia road also . And again a few years , and [all the flats in [either road]1100-either road]1099-all the flats in either road might be pulled down , and [new buildings]1101-new buildings , of a vastness at present unimaginable , might arise where they had fallen .

" Evening , [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast . "[321-mr. cunningham]

" Evening , [Mr. Cunningham]321-mr. cunningham . "[321-mr. cunningham]

" Very serious thing this decline of the birth - rate in [Manchester]51-manchester . "[321-mr. cunningham]

" [I]321-mr. cunningham beg [your]321-mr. cunningham pardon ? "[321-mr. cunningham]

" Very serious thing this decline of the birth - rate in [Manchester]51-manchester , "[321-mr. cunningham] repeated [Mr. Cunningham]321-mr. cunningham , tapping the Sunday paper , in which the calamity in question had just been announced to [him]321-mr. cunningham .

" Ah , yes , "[317-leonard] said [Leonard]317-leonard , who was not going to let on that [he]317-leonard had not bought a Sunday paper .

" [You]317-leonard do n't say so . "[317-leonard]

" [I]321-mr. cunningham call it a very serious thing , eh ? "[321-mr. cunningham]

" Good - evening , [Mr. Cunningham]321-mr. cunningham . "[317-leonard]

" Good - evening , [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast . "[321-mr. cunningham]

Then [Leonard]317-leonard entered [[Block B]65-block b of [the flats]1036-the flats]1102-block b of the flats , and turned , not [upstairs]664-upstairs , but down , into what is known to [house]1105-house [agents]1106-agents as [a semi - basement]1107-a semi - basement , and to [other men]1108-other men as [a cellar]1109-a cellar . [He]317-leonard opened the door , and cried " [Hullo]322-hullo ! "[317-leonard] with the pseudo - geniality of [the Cockney]323-the cockney . There was no reply . " Hullo ! "[317-leonard] [he]317-leonard repeated . [The sitting - room]1110-the sitting - room was empty , though the electric light had been left burning . A look of relief came over [his]317-leonard face , and [he]317-leonard flung [himself]317-leonard into the armchair .

[The sitting - room]1110-the sitting - room contained , besides the armchair , two other chairs , a piano , a three - legged table , and a cosy corner . Of the walls , one was occupied by the window , the other by a draped mantelshelf bristling with Cupids . Opposite the window was the door , and beside the door a bookcase , while over the piano there extended one of the masterpieces of [Maud Goodman]324-maud goodman . It was an amorous and not unpleasant little hole when the curtains were drawn , and the lights turned on , and the gas - stove unlit . But it struck that shallow makeshift note that is so often heard in [the modem dwelling - place]1112-the modem dwelling - place . It had been too easily gained , and could be relinquished too easily .

As [Leonard]317-leonard was kicking off [his]317-leonard boots [he]317-leonard jarred the three - legged table , and a photograph frame , honourably poised upon it , slid sideways , fell off into the fireplace , and smashed . [He]317-leonard swore in a colourless sort of way , and picked the photograph up . It represented [a young lady called [Jacky]325-jacky]1113-a young lady called jacky , and had been taken at the time when [young ladies called [Jacky]325-jacky]1114-young ladies called jacky were often photographed with [their]1114-young ladies called jacky mouths open . Teeth of dazzling whiteness extended along either of [Jacky]325-jacky 's jaws , and positively weighted [her]1113-a young lady called jacky head sideways , so large were they and so numerous . Take [my]0-i word for it , that smile was simply stunning , and it is only [you]1115-you and [I]0-i who will be fastidious , and complain that true joy begins in the eyes , and that the eyes of [Jacky]325-jacky did not accord with [her]1113-a young lady called jacky smile , but were anxious and hungry .

[Leonard]317-leonard tried to pull out the fragments of glass , and cut [his]317-leonard fingers and swore again . A drop of blood fell on the frame , another followed , spilling over on to the exposed photograph . [He]317-leonard swore more vigorously , and dashed to [the kitchen]1116-the kitchen , where [he]317-leonard bathed [his]317-leonard hands . [The kitchen]1116-the kitchen was the same size as [the sitting room]1118-the sitting room ; through [it]1116-the kitchen was [a bedroom]1119-a bedroom . This completed [[his]317-leonard home]1089-his home . [He]317-leonard was renting [the flat furnished]1121-the flat furnished : of all the objects that encumbered [it]1121-the flat furnished none were [his]317-leonard own except the photograph frame , the Cupids , and the books .

" Damn , damn , damnation ! "[317-leonard] [he]317-leonard murmured , together with such other words as [he]317-leonard had learnt from [older men]1122-older men . Then [he]317-leonard raised [his]317-leonard hand to [his]317-leonard forehead and said , " Oh , damn it all - "[317-leonard] which meant something different . [He]317-leonard pulled [himself]317-leonard together . [He]317-leonard drank a little tea , black and silent , that still survived upon an upper shelf . [He]317-leonard swallowed some dusty crumbs of cake . Then [he]317-leonard went back to [the sitting - room]1110-the sitting - room , settled [himself]317-leonard anew , and began to read a volume of [Ruskin]326-ruskin .

" Seven miles to [the north of [Venice]66-venice]4121-the north of venice - "[317-leonard]

How perfectly the famous chapter opens ! How supreme its command of admonition and of poetry ! [The rich man]1124-the rich man is speaking to [us]1125-us from [[his]1124-the rich man gondola]1126-his gondola .

" Seven miles to [the north of [Venice]66-venice]4121-the north of venice [the banks of sand which nearer [the city]1095-the city]4123-the banks of sand which nearer the city rise little above low - water mark attain by degrees a higher level , and knit themselves at last into [fields of salt morass]4125-fields of salt morass , raised here and [there into shapeless mounds]4126-there into shapeless mounds , and intercepted by [narrow creeks of sea]4127-narrow creeks of sea . "[1124-the rich man]

[Leonard]317-leonard was trying to form [his]317-leonard style on [Ruskin]326-ruskin : [he]317-leonard understood [him]326-ruskin to be the greatest master of English Prose . [He]317-leonard read forward steadily , occasionally making a few notes .

" Let [us]4128-us consider a little [each of these characters]4129-each of these characters in succession , and first for of the shafts enough has been said already , what is very peculiar to [this church]4130-this church - its luminousness . "[317-leonard]

Was there anything to be learnt from this fine sentence ? Could [he]317-leonard adapt it to the needs of daily life ? Could [he]317-leonard introduce it , with modifications , when [he]317-leonard next wrote a letter to [[his]317-leonard brother]845-his brother , [the lay - reader]1128-the lay - reader ? For example -

" Let [us]4128-us consider a little each of these characters in succession , and first for of the absence of ventilation enough has been said already , what is very peculiar to [this flat]4131-this flat - its obscurity . "[317-leonard]

Something told [him]317-leonard that the modifications would not do ; and that something , had [he]317-leonard known it , was the spirit of English Prose . " [[My]1129-the voice in the gondola flat]4132-my flat is dark as well as stuffy . "[1129-the voice in the gondola] Those were the words for [him]317-leonard .

And [the voice in the gondola]1129-the voice in the gondola rolled on , piping melodiously of Effort and Self - Sacrifice , full of high purpose , full of beauty , full even of sympathy and the love of [men]616-men , yet somehow eluding all that was actual and insistent in [Leonard]317-leonard 's life . For it was the voice of one who had never been dirty or hungry , and had not guessed successfully what dirt and hunger are .

[Leonard]317-leonard listened to it with reverence . [He]317-leonard felt that [he]317-leonard was being done good to , and that if [he]317-leonard kept on with [Ruskin]326-ruskin , and [the Queen]1131-the queen 's Hall Concerts , and some pictures by [Watts]327-watts , [he]317-leonard would one day push [his]317-leonard head out of [the grey waters]1132-the grey waters and see [the universe]960-the universe . [He]317-leonard believed in sudden conversion , a belief which may be right , but which is peculiarly attractive to a half - baked mind . It is the bias of much popular religion : in the domain of business it dominates [the Stock Exchange]1134-the stock exchange , and becomes that " bit of luck "[317-leonard] by which all successes and failures are explained . " If only [I]317-leonard had a bit of luck , the whole thing would come straight . . . . [He]317-leonard 's got [a most magnificent place down at [Streatham]67-streatham]4133-a most magnificent place down at streatham and [a 20 h.-p . Fiat]4134-a 20 h.-p . fiat , but then , mind [you]4135-you , [he]317-leonard 's had luck . . . . [I]317-leonard 'm sorry [the wife]3999-the wife 's so late , but [she]3999-the wife never has any luck over catching [trains]4137-trains . "[317-leonard] [Leonard]317-leonard was superior to [these people]1135-these people ; [he]317-leonard did believe in effort and in a steady preparation for the change that [he]317-leonard desired . But of a heritage that may expand gradually , [he]317-leonard had no conception : [he]317-leonard hoped to come to [Culture]68-culture suddenly , much as [the Revivalist]328-the revivalist hopes to come to [Jesus]329-jesus . [Those Miss Schlegels]270-the schlegels had come to it ; [they]1135-these people had done the trick ; [their]1135-these people hands were upon the ropes , once and for all . And meanwhile , [[his]317-leonard flat]1136-his flat was dark , as well as stuffy .

Presently there was a noise on the staircase . [He]317-leonard shut up [Margaret]278-margaret 's card in the pages of [Ruskin]326-ruskin , and opened the door . [A woman]1137-a woman entered , of whom it is simplest to say that [she]1137-a woman was not respectable . [Her]1137-a woman appearance was awesome . [She]1137-a woman seemed all strings and bell - pulls - ribbons , chains , bead necklaces that clinked and caught - and a boa of azure feathers hung round [her]1137-a woman neck , with the ends uneven . [Her]1137-a woman throat was bare , wound with a double row of pearls , [her]1137-a woman arms were bare to the elbows , and might again be detected at the shoulder , through cheap lace . [Her]1137-a woman hat , which was flowery , resembled those punnets , covered with flannel , which [we]1138-we sowed with mustard and cress in [our]1138-we childhood , and which germinated here yes , and there no . [She]1137-a woman wore it on the back of [her]1137-a woman head . As for [her]1137-a woman hair , or rather hairs , they are too complicated to describe , but one system went down [her]1137-a woman back , lying in a thick pad there , while another , created for a lighter destiny , rippled around [her]1137-a woman forehead . The face - the face does not signify . It was the face of the photograph , but older , and the teeth were not so numerous as [the photographer]1139-the photographer had suggested , and certainly not so white . Yes , [Jacky]325-jacky was past [her]1137-a woman prime , whatever that prime may have been . [She]1137-a woman was descending quicker than [most women]1140-most women into the colourless years , and the look in [her]1137-a woman eyes confessed it .

Chapter 7

" Oh , [Margaret]278-margaret , "[635-her aunt] cried [[her]1172-her aunt]635-her aunt next morning , ' such a most unfortunate thing has happened . [I]0-i could not get [you]1172-her alone . "[0-i]

The most unfortunate thing was not very serious . [One of [the flats in [the ornate block opposite]1178-the ornate block opposite]1177-the flats in the ornate block opposite]1176-one of the flats in the ornate block opposite had been taken furnished by [the Wilcox family]1179-the wilcox family , " coming up , no doubt , in the hope of getting into [London]2-london society . "[1179-the wilcox family] That [Mrs. Munt]268-helen should be the first to discover the misfortune was not remarkable , for [she]268-helen was so interested in [the flats]1036-the flats , that [she]268-helen watched [their]1036-the flats every mutation with unwearying care . In theory [she]268-helen despised [them]1036-the flats - [they]1036-the flats took away that old - world look - [they]1036-the flats cut off the [sun - flats house]1181-sun - flats house [a flashy type of person]1182-a flashy type of person . [She]268-helen would stroll across and make friends with [the porters]1185-the porters , and inquire what the rents were , exclaiming for example : " What ! a hundred and twenty for [a basement]4163-a basement ? [You]268-helen 'll never get it ! "[268-helen] And [they]1185-the porters would answer : " One can but try , [madam]4164-madam . "[1185-the porters] The passenger lifts , the provision lifts , the arrangement for coals a great temptation for [a dishonest porter]1186-a dishonest porter , were all familiar matters to [her]268-helen , and perhaps a relief from the politico - economical - aesthetic atmosphere that reigned at the Schlegels ' .

[Margaret]278-margaret received the information calmly , and did not agree that it would throw a cloud over [poor Helen]268-helen 's life .

" Oh , but [Helen]268-helen is n't [a girl with no interests]4165-a girl with no interests , "[278-margaret] [she]278-margaret explained . " [She]268-helen has plenty of other things and [other people]869-other people to think about . "[278-margaret]

" For [a clever girl]4168-a clever girl , [dear]3903-dear , how very oddly [you]3903-dear do talk . [Helen'll]332-helen'll HAVE to have something more to do with [them]263-the wilcoxes , now that [they]263-the wilcoxes 're all opposite . " Of course [she]268-helen must bow . But look here ; let 's do the flowers . [I]278-margaret was going to say , the will to be interested in [him]4170-that paul in the street has died , and what else matters ? [I]278-margaret look on that disastrous episode over which [you]3903-dear were so kind as the killing of a nerve in [Helen]268-helen . It 's dead , and [she]268-helen 'll never be troubled with it again . The only things that matter are the things that interest [one]602-one . Bowing , even calling and leaving cards , even a dinner - party - [we]4173-we can do all those things to [the Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes , if [they]263-the wilcoxes find it agreeable ; but the other thing , the one important thing - never again . Do n't [you]3903-dear see ? "[278-margaret]

[Mrs. Munt]268-helen did not see , and indeed [Margaret]278-margaret was making a most questionable statement - that any emotion , any interest once vividly aroused , can wholly die .

" [I]278-margaret also have the honour to inform [you]3903-dear that [the Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes are bored with [us]4173-we . [I]278-margaret did n't tell [you]3903-dear at the time - it might have made [you]3903-dear angry , and [you]3903-dear had enough to worry [you]3903-dear - but [I]278-margaret wrote a letter to [Mrs. W.]300-w. , and apologized for the trouble that [Helen]268-helen had given [them]263-the wilcoxes . [She]300-w. did n't answer it . "[278-margaret]

" How very rude ! "[268-helen]

" [I]278-margaret wonder . Or was it sensible ? "[278-margaret]

" No , [Margaret]278-margaret , most rude . "[268-helen]
