Chapter 8

The friendship between [Margaret]278-margaret and [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox , which was to develop so - quickly and with such strange results , may perhaps have had its beginnings at [Speyer]6-speyer , in the spring . Perhaps [the elder lady]1221-the elder lady , as [she]1221-the elder lady gazed at [the vulgar , ruddy cathedral]1222-the vulgar , ruddy cathedral , and listened to the talk of [Helen]268-helen and [[her]1221-the elder lady husband]1223-her husband , may have detected in the other and less charming of [the sisters]864-the sisters a deeper sympathy , a sounder judgment . [She]1221-the elder lady was capable of detecting such things . Perhaps it was [she]1221-the elder lady who had desired [the Miss Schlegels]270-the schlegels to be invited to [Howards End]257-helen , and [Margaret]278-margaret whose presence [she]1221-the elder lady had particularly desired . All this is speculation : [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox has left few clear indications behind [her]528-mrs. wilcox . It is certain that [she]528-mrs. wilcox came to call at [Wickham Place]11-wickham place a fortnight later , the very day that [Helen]268-helen was going with [[her]268-helen cousin]953-her cousin to [Stettin]52-stettin .

" [Helen]268-helen ! "[293-fraulein mosebach] cried [Fraulein Mosebach]293-fraulein mosebach in awestruck tones [she]293-fraulein mosebach was now in [[her]293-fraulein mosebach cousin]953-her cousin 's confidence - " [[his]953-her cousin mother]4237-his mother has forgiven [you]268-helen ! "[293-fraulein mosebach]

" Bother [the whole family]4238-the whole family ! "[278-margaret] snapped [Margaret]278-margaret . " [Helen]268-helen , stop giggling and pirouetting , and go and finish [your]268-helen packing . Why ca n't [the woman]808-the woman leave [us]4240-us alone ? "[278-margaret]

" But , [Meg]278-margaret , [Meg]278-margaret , [I]293-fraulein mosebach do n't love [the young gentleman]4241-the young gentleman ; [I]293-fraulein mosebach do n't love [the young - 0 lud]4244-the young - 0 lud , who 's that coming down the stairs ? [I]293-fraulein mosebach vow ' tis [[my]293-fraulein mosebach brother]4059-my brother . [0 crimini]4246-0 crimini ! "[293-fraulein mosebach]

[A male]1228-a male - even such a male as [Tibby]262-tibby - was enough to stop the foolery . The barrier of sex , though decreasing among [the civilized]1229-the civilized , is still high , and higher on the side of [women]615-women . [Helen]268-helen could tell [[her]268-helen sister]566-her sister all , and [[her]268-helen cousin]953-her cousin much about [Paul]259-paul ; [she]268-helen told [[her]268-helen brother]665-her brother nothing . It was not prudishness , for [she]268-helen now spoke of " [the Wilcox]342-the wilcox ideal "[268-helen] with laughter , and even with a growing brutality . Nor was it precaution , for [Tibby]262-tibby seldom repeated any news that did not concern [himself]262-tibby . It was rather the feeling that [she]268-helen betrayed a secret into [the camp of [men]616-men]1234-the camp of men , and that , however trivial it was on this side of the barrier , it would become important on that . So [she]268-helen stopped , or rather began to fool on other subjects , until [[her]268-helen long - suffering relatives]1236-her long - suffering relatives drove [her]268-helen [upstairs]664-upstairs . [Fraulein Mosebach]293-fraulein mosebach followed [her]268-helen , but lingered to say heavily over the banisters to [Margaret]278-margaret , " It is all right - [she]268-helen does not love [the young man]769-the young man - [he]769-the young man has not been worthy of [her]268-helen . "[293-fraulein mosebach]

" Yes , [I]293-fraulein mosebach know ; thanks very much . "[293-fraulein mosebach]

" [I]293-fraulein mosebach thought [I]293-fraulein mosebach did right to tell [you]278-margaret . "[293-fraulein mosebach]

" Ever so many thanks . "[293-fraulein mosebach]

" What 's that ? "[262-tibby] asked [Tibby]262-tibby . [No one]700-no one told [him]262-tibby , and [he]262-tibby proceeded into [the dining - room]3990-the dining - room , to eat Elvas plums .

That evening [Margaret]278-margaret took decisive action . [The house]578-the house was very quiet , and the fog - [we]1241-we are in [November]72-november now - pressed against the windows like an excluded ghost . [Frieda]295-frieda and [Helen]268-helen and all [their]1242-their luggage had gone . [Tibby]262-tibby , who was not feeling well , lay stretched on a sofa by the fire . [Margaret]278-margaret sat by [him]262-tibby , thinking . [Her]278-margaret mind darted from impulse to impulse , and finally marshalled [them]1243-them all in review . [The practical person]1244-the practical person , who knows what [he]1244-the practical person wants at once , and generally knows nothing else , will excuse [her]278-margaret of indecision . But this was the way [her]278-margaret mind worked . And when [she]278-margaret did act , [no one]700-no one could accuse [her]278-margaret of indecision then . [She]278-margaret hit out as lustily as if [she]278-margaret had not considered the matter at all . The letter that [she]278-margaret wrote [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox glowed with the native hue of resolution . The pale cast of thought was with [her]278-margaret a breath rather than a tarnish , a breath that leaves the colours all the more vivid when it has been wiped away .

[Dear Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox ,

[I]0-i have to write something discourteous . It would be better if [we]1246-we did not meet . Both [[my]0-i sister]4034-my sister and [[my]0-i aunt]1248-my aunt have given displeasure to [[your]528-mrs. wilcox family]1249-your family , and , in [[my]0-i sister]4034-my sister 's case , the grounds for displeasure might recur . As far as [I]0-i know , [she]4034-my sister no longer occupies [her]4034-my sister thoughts with [[your]528-mrs. wilcox son]1251-your son . But it would not be fair , either to [her]4034-my sister or to [you]528-mrs. wilcox , if [they]1246-we met , and it is therefore right that [our]1246-we acquaintance which began so pleasantly , should end .

[I]0-i fear that [you]528-mrs. wilcox will not agree with this ; indeed , [I]0-i know that [you]528-mrs. wilcox will not , since [you]528-mrs. wilcox have been good enough to call on [us]1246-we . It is only an instinct on [my]0-i part , and no doubt the instinct is wrong . [[My]0-i sister]4034-my sister would , undoubtedly , say that it is wrong . [I]0-i write without [her]4034-my sister knowledge , and [I]0-i hope that [you]528-mrs. wilcox will not associate [her]4034-my sister with [my]0-i discourtesy .

Believe [me]0-i , [Yours]528-mrs. wilcox truly , [M. J. Schlegel

Margaret]278-margaret sent this letter round by post . Next morning [she]278-margaret received the following reply by hand :

[Dear Miss Schlegel]278-margaret ,

[You]278-margaret should not have written [me]0-i such a letter . [I]0-i called to tell [you]528-mrs. wilcox that [Paul]259-paul has gone abroad .

[Ruth Wilcox

Margaret]346-margaret 's cheeks burnt . [She]278-margaret could not finish [her]278-margaret breakfast . [She]278-margaret was on fire with shame . [Helen]268-helen had told [her]278-margaret that [the youth]979-the youth was leaving [England]35-england , but other things had seemed more important , and [she]278-margaret had forgotten . All [her]278-margaret absurd anxieties fell to the ground , and in [their]1254-their place arose the certainty that [she]278-margaret had been rude to [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox . Rudeness affected [Margaret]346-margaret like a bitter taste in the mouth . It poisoned life . At times it is necessary , but woe to [those who employ it without due need]1255-those who employ it without due need . [She]346-margaret flung on a hat and shawl , just like [a poor woman]1256-a poor woman , and plunged into the fog , which still continued . [Her]346-margaret lips were compressed , the letter remained in [her]346-margaret hand , and in this state [she]346-margaret crossed [the street]1042-the street , entered [the marble vestibule of [the flats]1036-the flats]1258-the marble vestibule of the flats , eluded [the concierges]1260-the concierges , and ran up the stairs till [she]346-margaret reached [the second - floor]1261-the second - floor .

[She]346-margaret sent in [her]346-margaret name , and to [her]346-margaret surprise was shown straight into [[Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox 's bedroom]1262-mrs. wilcox 's bedroom .

" Oh , [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox , [I]346-margaret have made the baddest blunder . [I]346-margaret am more , more ashamed and sorry than [I]346-margaret can say . "[346-margaret]

[Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox bowed gravely . [She]528-mrs. wilcox was offended , and did not pretend to the contrary . [She]528-mrs. wilcox was sitting up in bed , writing letters on an invalid table that spanned [her]528-mrs. wilcox knees . A breakfast tray was on another table beside [her]528-mrs. wilcox . The conversation again shifted . At the time it seemed little more than aimless chatter . Then the curious note was struck again .

" Yes . [You]346-margaret have got it . Inexperience is the word . "[528-mrs. wilcox]

" Inexperience , "[346-margaret] repeated [Margaret]346-margaret , in serious yet buoyant tones . " Of course , [I]346-margaret have everything to learn - absolutely everything - just as much as [Helen]257-helen . Life 's very difficult and full of surprises . At all events , [I]346-margaret 've got as far as that . To be humble and kind , to go straight ahead , to love [people]3893-people rather than pity [them]3893-people , to remember the submerged - well , one ca n't do all these things at once , worse luck , because they 're so contradictory . It 's then that proportion comes in - to live by proportion . Do n't BEGIN with proportion . [Only prigs]4297-only prigs do that . Let proportion come in as a last resource , when the better things have failed , and a deadlock - Gracious [me]346-margaret , [I]346-margaret 've started preaching ! "[346-margaret]

" Indeed , [you]346-margaret put the difficulties of life splendidly , "[528-mrs. wilcox] said [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox , withdrawing [her]528-mrs. wilcox hand into the deeper shadows . " It is just what [I]528-mrs. wilcox should have liked to say about [them]4298-them [myself]528-mrs. wilcox . "[528-mrs. wilcox]

Chapter 9

[Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox can not be accused of giving [Margaret]346-margaret much information about life . And [Margaret]346-margaret , on the other hand , has made a fair show of modesty , and has pretended to an inexperience that [she]346-margaret certainly did not feel . [She]346-margaret had kept [house]1105-house for over ten years ; [she]346-margaret had entertained , almost with distinction ; [she]346-margaret had brought up [a charming sister]1281-a charming sister , and was bringing up [a brother]1282-a brother . Surely , if experience is attainable , [she]346-margaret had attained it .

Yet the little luncheon - party that [she]346-margaret gave in [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox 's honour was not a success . [The new friend]1283-the new friend did not blend with [the " one or two delightful people "[1284-the " one or two delightful people " who had been asked to meet her] who had been asked to meet [her]346-margaret]1284-the " one or two delightful people " who had been asked to meet her , and the atmosphere was one of polite bewilderment . [Her]346-margaret tastes were simple , [her]346-margaret knowledge of culture slight , and [she]346-margaret was not interested in [the New English Art Club]1285-the new english art club , nor in the dividing - line between Journalism and Literature , which was started as a conversational hare . " [You]4324-you will admit , though , that [the Continent]82-the continent - it seems silly to speak of ' [the Continent]82-the continent , ' but really it is all more like itself than any part of it is like [England]35-england . Chapter 10

Several days passed .

Was [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox [one of [the unsatisfactory people]1312-the unsatisfactory people]1311-one of the unsatisfactory people - there are many of [them]1312-the unsatisfactory people - who dangle intimacy and then withdraw it ? [They]1312-the unsatisfactory people evoke [our]1313-our interests and affections , and keep the life of the spirit dawdling round [them]1312-the unsatisfactory people . Then [they]1312-the unsatisfactory people withdraw . When physical passion is involved , there is a definite name for such behaviour - flirting - and if carried far enough it is punishable by law . But no law - not public opinion even - punishes [those who coquette with friendship]1314-those who coquette with friendship , though the dull ache that [they]1312-the unsatisfactory people inflict , the sense of misdirected effort and exhaustion , may be as intolerable . Was [she]528-mrs. wilcox one of these ?

[Margaret]346-margaret feared so at first , for , with [a Londoner]1315-a londoner 's impatience , [she]346-margaret wanted everything to be settled up immediately . [She]346-margaret mistrusted the periods of quiet that are essential to true growth . Desiring to book [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox as [a friend]1316-a friend , [she]346-margaret pressed on the ceremony , pencil , as it were , in hand , pressing the more because [the rest of [the family]4226-the family]1317-the rest of the family were away , and the opportunity seemed favourable . But [the elder woman]1319-the elder woman would not be hurried . [She]346-margaret refused to fit in with the [Wickham]84-wickham Place set , or to reopen discussion of [Helen]257-helen and [Paul]259-paul , whom [Margaret]346-margaret would have utilized as a short - cut . [She]346-margaret took [her]346-margaret time , or perhaps let time take [her]346-margaret , and when the crisis did come all was ready .

The crisis opened with a message : would [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret come shopping ? Christmas was nearing , and [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox felt behind - hand with the presents . [She]346-margaret had taken some more days in bed , and must make up for lost time . [Margaret]346-margaret accepted , and at eleven o'clock one cheerless morning [they]1320-we started out in a brougham .

" First of all , "[346-margaret] began [Margaret]346-margaret , " [we]1320-we must make a list and tick off [the people]4343-the people 's names . [[My]346-margaret aunt]1248-my aunt always does , and this fog may thicken up any moment . Have [you]346-margaret any ideas ? "[346-margaret]

" [I]528-mrs. wilcox thought [we]1320-we would go to [Harrod 's]85-harrod 's or [the Haymarket Stores]4345-the haymarket stores , "[528-mrs. wilcox] said [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox rather hopelessly . " Everything is sure to be there . [I]528-mrs. wilcox am not [a good shopper]4346-a good shopper . " Oh , hooray ! "[346-margaret] said [Margaret]346-margaret , writing it . " How very kind of [you]346-margaret to start with [me]346-margaret ! "[346-margaret] But [she]346-margaret did not want to receive anything expensive . [Their]1321-their acquaintance was singular rather than intimate , and [she]346-margaret divined that [the Wilcox clan]1322-the wilcox clan would resent any expenditure on [outsiders]768-outsiders ; [the more compact families]1324-the more compact families do . " Why ? "[346-margaret]

" Because [I]346-margaret 've odd ideas about Christmas . Because [I]346-margaret have all that money can buy . [I]346-margaret want [more people]4349-more people , but no more things . "[346-margaret]

" [I]346-margaret should like to give [you]346-margaret something worth [your]346-margaret acquaintance , [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret , in memory of [your]346-margaret kindness to [me]346-margaret during [my]346-margaret lonely fortnight . " [I]346-margaret suppose not , but [one]602-one would like to . Perhaps [I]346-margaret shall think of something as [we]1328-they go about . "[346-margaret]

[Her]1327-her name remained at the head of the list , but nothing was written opposite it . [They]1328-they drove from [shop]1329-shop to [shop]1329-shop . [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox 's vitality was low that morning , and it was [Margaret]346-margaret who decided on a horse for [this little girl]1331-this little girl , a golliwog for that , for [[the rector]1332-the rector 's wife]1333-the rector 's wife a copper warming - tray . " [We]1328-they always give [the servants]4351-the servants money . "[346-margaret] " Yes , do [you]346-margaret , yes , much easier , "[346-margaret] replied [Margaret]346-margaret , but felt the grotesque impact of the unseen upon the seen , and saw issuing from [a forgotten manger at Bethlehem this torrent of coins and toys]1334-a forgotten manger at bethlehem this torrent of coins and toys . Vulgarity reigned . [Public - houses]1335-public - houses , besides [their]1335-public - houses usual exhortation against temperance reform , invited [men]616-men to " Join [our]1328-they Christmas goose club "[1335-public - houses] - one bottle of gin , etc . , or two , according to subscription . A poster of [a woman in tights]1337-a woman in tights heralded the Christmas pantomime , and little red devils , who had come in again that year , were prevalent upon the Christmas - cards . [Margaret]346-margaret was [no morbid idealist]1338-no morbid idealist . [She]346-margaret did not wish this spate of business and self - advertisement checked . It was only the occasion of it that struck [her]346-margaret with amazement annually . How many of [these vacillating shoppers]1339-these vacillating shoppers and [tired shop - assistants]1340-tired shop - assistants realized that it was a divine event that drew [them]1341-them together ? [She]346-margaret realized it , though standing outside in the matter . [She]346-margaret was not [a Christian]1342-a christian in the accepted sense ; [she]346-margaret did not believe that [God]290-god had ever worked among [us]1343-we as [a young artisan]1344-a young artisan . [These people]1135-these people , or [most of [them]1135-these people]1346-most of them , believed it , and if pressed , would affirm it in words . But the visible signs of [their]1135-these people belief were [Regent Street]86-regent street or [Drury Lane]87-drury lane , a little mud displaced , a little money spent , a little food cooked , eaten , and forgotten . Inadequate . But in public who shall express the unseen adequately ? It is private life that holds out the mirror to infinity ; personal intercourse , and that alone , that ever hints at a personality beyond [our]1343-we daily vision .

" No , [I]346-margaret do like Christmas on the whole , "[346-margaret] [she]346-margaret announced . " In its clumsy way , it does approach Peace and Goodwill . But oh , it is clumsier every year . "[346-margaret]

" Is it ? [I]346-margaret am only used to country Christmases . "[346-margaret]

" [We]1343-we are usually in [London]2-london , and play the game with vigour - carols at [the Abbey]4352-the abbey , clumsy midday meal , clumsy dinner for [the maids]4071-the maids , followed by Christmas - tree and dancing of [poor children]4354-poor children , with songs from [Helen]257-helen . [The drawing - room]4113-the drawing - room does very well for that . [We]1343-we put the tree in [the powder - closet]4356-the powder - closet , and draw a curtain when the candles are lighted , and with the looking - glass behind [it]4356-the powder - closet looks quite pretty . [I]346-margaret wish [we]1343-we might have a powder - closet in [[our]1343-we next house]4357-our next house . Of course , the tree has to be very small , and the presents do n't hang on it . No ; the presents reside in a sort of rocky landscape made of crumpled brown paper . "[346-margaret]

" [You]346-margaret spoke of [[your]346-margaret ' next house]4358-your ' next house , ' [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret . Then are [you]346-margaret leaving [Wickham Place]11-wickham place ? "[346-margaret]

" Yes , in two or three years , when the lease expires . [We]1343-we must . "[346-margaret]

" Have [you]346-margaret been [there]4043-there long ? "[346-margaret]

" All [our]1343-we lives . "[346-margaret]

" [You]346-margaret will be very sorry to leave [it]4043-there . "[346-margaret]

" [I]1347-i suppose so . [We]1343-we scarcely realize it yet . [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox was silenced . In growing discomfort [they]1357-they drove homewards . [The city]1095-the city seemed Satanic , [the narrower streets]1359-the narrower streets oppressing like the galleries of [a mine]1360-a mine . No harm was done by the fog to trade , for it lay high , and the lighted windows of [the shops]1361-the shops were thronged with [customers]1362-customers . It was rather a darkening of the spirit which fell back upon itself , to find a more grievous darkness within . [Margaret]346-margaret nearly spoke a dozen times , but something throttled [her]346-margaret . [She]346-margaret felt petty and awkward , and [her]346-margaret meditations on Christmas grew more cynical . Peace ? The craving for excitement and for elaboration has ruined that blessing . Goodwill ? [They]1367-they parted at [the Mansions]1368-the mansions . And into what a heaven - a vault as of hell , sooty black , from which soots descended !

At lunch [[her]346-margaret brother]665-her brother , seeing [her]346-margaret inclined for silence , insisted on talking . [Tibby]262-tibby was not ill - natured , but from babyhood something drove [him]262-tibby to do the unwelcome and the unexpected . Now [he]262-tibby gave [her]346-margaret a long account of the day - school that [he]262-tibby sometimes patronized . The account was interesting , and [she]346-margaret had often pressed [him]262-tibby for it before , but [she]346-margaret could not attend now , for [her]346-margaret mind was focussed on the invisible . [She]346-margaret discerned that [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox , though [a loving wife]1375-a loving wife and [mother]3878-mother , had only one passion in life - [[her]528-mrs. wilcox house]1377-her house - and that the moment was solemn when [she]346-margaret invited [a friend]1316-a friend to share this passion with [her]346-margaret . " Another day "[346-margaret] will do for brick and mortar , but not for the Holy of Holies into which [Howards End]257-helen had been transfigured . [Her]346-margaret own curiosity was slight . [She]346-margaret had heard more than enough about it in the summer . But imagination triumphed . [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox had just gone away for the night .

[Margaret]346-margaret said that it was of no consequence , hurried [downstairs]667-downstairs , and took a hansom to [King 's Cross]15-king 's cross . [She]346-margaret was convinced that the escapade was important , though it would have puzzled [her]346-margaret to say why . Chapter 11

The funeral was over . [The carriages]1402-the carriages rolled away through the soft mud , and only [the poor]996-the poor remained . [They]1401-both of them approached to [the newly - dug shaft]1404-the newly - dug shaft and looked [their]1401-both of them last at the coffin , now almost hidden beneath the spadefuls of clay . It was [their]1401-both of them moment . [Most of [them]1401-both of them]1346-most of them were [women from [the dead woman]1407-the dead woman 's district]1406-women from the dead woman 's district , to whom black garments had been served out by [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox 's orders . Pure curiosity had brought [others]893-others . [They]1401-both of them thrilled with the excitement of a death , and of a rapid death , and stood in groups or moved between the graves , like drops of ink . [The son of one of [them]1401-both of them]1409-the son of one of them , [a wood - cutter]1410-a wood - cutter , was perched high above [their]1401-both of them heads , pollarding one of the churchyard elms . From where [he]1409-the son of one of them sat [he]1409-the son of one of them could see [the village of]1411-the village of [Hilton]33-hilton , strung upon [the North Road]1412-the north road , with [[its]1411-the village of accreting suburbs]1413-its accreting suburbs ; the sunset beyond , scarlet and orange , winking at [him]1409-the son of one of them beneath brows of grey ; [the church]1414-the church ; [the plantations]1415-the plantations ; and behind [him]1409-the son of one of them [an unspoilt country of [fields and farms]1417-fields and farms]1416-an unspoilt country of fields and farms . But [he]1409-the son of one of them , too , was rolling the event luxuriously in [his]1409-the son of one of them mouth . [He]1409-the son of one of them tried to tell [[his]1409-the son of one of them mother]4237-his mother down below all that [he]1409-the son of one of them had felt when [he]1409-the son of one of them saw the coffin approaching : how [he]1409-the son of one of them could not leave [his]1409-the son of one of them work , and yet did not like to go on with it ; how [he]1409-the son of one of them had almost slipped out of the tree , [he]1409-the son of one of them was so upset ; [the rooks]1419-the rooks had cawed , and no wonder - it was as if [rooks]1420-rooks knew too . [[His]1409-the son of one of them mother]4237-his mother claimed the prophetic power [herself]4237-his mother - [she]4237-his mother had seen a strange look about [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox for some time . [London]2-london had done the mischief , said [others]893-others . [She]4237-his mother had been [a kind lady]1423-a kind lady ; [[her]4237-his mother grandmother]1424-her grandmother had been kind , too - [a plainer person]1425-a plainer person , but very kind . Ah , [the old sort]1426-the old sort was dying out ! [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox , [he]261-mr. wilcox was [a kind gentleman]1427-a kind gentleman . [They]1428-they advanced to the topic again and again , dully , but with exaltation . The funeral of [a rich person]1429-a rich person was to [them]1428-they what the funeral of [Alcestis]361-alcestis or [Ophelia]362-ophelia is to [the educated]1430-the educated . It was Art ; though remote from life , it enhanced life 's values , and [they]1428-they witnessed it avidly .

[The grave - diggers]1431-the grave - diggers , who had kept up an undercurrent of disapproval - [they]1431-the grave - diggers disliked [Charles]261-mr. wilcox ; it was not a moment to speak of such things , but [they]1431-the grave - diggers did not like [Charles Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox - [the grave - diggers]1431-the grave - diggers finished [their]1431-the grave - diggers work and piled up the wreaths and crosses above it . The sun set over [Hilton]33-hilton : the grey brows of the evening flushed a little , and were cleft with one scarlet frown . Chattering sadly to [each other]3977-each other , [the mourners]1434-the mourners passed through the lych - gate and traversed [the chestnut avenues that led down to [the village]3940-the village]1435-the chestnut avenues that led down to the village . [The young wood - cutter]1437-the young wood - cutter stayed a little longer , poised above the silence and swaying rhythmically . At last the bough fell beneath [his]1437-the young wood - cutter saw . With a grunt , [he]1437-the young wood - cutter descended , [his]1437-the young wood - cutter thoughts dwelling no longer on death , but on love , for [he]1437-the young wood - cutter was mating . [He]1437-the young wood - cutter stopped as [he]1437-the young wood - cutter passed [the new grave]1438-the new grave ; a sheaf of tawny chrysanthemums had caught [his]1437-the young wood - cutter eye . " [They]4403-they did n't ought to have coloured flowers at buryings , "[1437-the young wood - cutter] [he]1437-the young wood - cutter reflected . Trudging on a few steps , [he]1437-the young wood - cutter stopped again , looked furtively at the dusk , turned back , wrenched a chrysanthemum from the sheaf , and hid it in [his]1437-the young wood - cutter pocket .

After [him]1437-the young wood - cutter came silence absolute . [The cottage that abutted on [the churchyard]1440-the churchyard]1439-the cottage that abutted on the churchyard was empty , and [no other house]1441-no other house stood near . Hour after hour the scene of the interment remained without an eye to witness it . Clouds drifted over [it]1442-it from the west ; or [the church]1414-the church may have been [a ship]1444-a ship , high - prowed , steering with all its company towards infinity . Towards morning the air grew colder , the sky clearer , the surface of the earth hard and sparkling above the prostrate dead . [The wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy]1445-the wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy , reflected : " [They]4403-they lilies , [they]4403-they chrysants ; it 's a pity [I]1445-the wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy did n't take [them]4403-they all . "[1445-the wood - cutter , returning after a night of joy]

Up at [Howards End]257-helen [they]1446-they were attempting breakfast . [Charles]261-mr. wilcox and [Evie]265-evie sat in [the dining - room]3990-the dining - room , with [Mrs. Charles]364-charles . [[Their]1446-they father]879-their father , who could not bear to see a face , breakfasted [upstairs]664-upstairs . [He]879-their father suffered acutely . Pain came over [him]879-their father in spasms , as if it was physical , and even while [he]879-their father was about to eat , [his]879-their father eyes would fill with tears , and [he]879-their father would lay down the morsel untasted .

[He]879-their father remembered [[his]879-their father wife]1450-his wife 's even goodness during thirty years . Not anything in detail - not courtship or early raptures - but just the unvarying virtue , that seemed to [him]879-their father a [woman]1451-woman 's noblest quality . [So many women]1452-so many women are capricious , breaking into odd flaws of passion or frivolity . Not so [[his]879-their father wife]1450-his wife . Year after year , summer and winter , as [bride]1454-bride and [mother]3878-mother , [she]1450-his wife had been the same , [he]879-their father had always trusted [her]1450-his wife . [Her]1450-his wife tenderness ! [Her]1450-his wife innocence ! The wonderful innocence that was [hers]1450-his wife by the gift of [God]290-god . [Ruth]346-margaret knew no more of worldly wickedness and wisdom than did the flowers in [[her]346-margaret garden]1456-her garden , or the grass in [[her]346-margaret field]1457-her field . [Her]346-margaret idea of business - " [Henry]360-henry , why do [people who have enough money]4404-people who have enough money try to get more money ? "[346-margaret] [Her]346-margaret idea of politics - " [I]346-margaret am sure that if [the mothers of [various nations]4406-various nations]4405-the mothers of various nations could meet , there would be no more wars . "[346-margaret] [Her]346-margaret idea of religion - ah , this had been a cloud , but a cloud that passed . [She]346-margaret came of Quaker stock , and [he]879-their father and [[his]879-their father family]895-his family , formerly [Dissenters]1459-dissenters , were now [members of [the Church of England]91-the church of england]1460-members of the church of england . [The rector]1332-the rector 's sermons had at first repelled [her]346-margaret , and [she]346-margaret had expressed a desire for " a more inward light , "[346-margaret] adding , " not so much for [myself]346-margaret as for [baby]4407-baby "[346-margaret] [Charles]364-charles . Inward light must have been granted , for [he]879-their father heard no complaints in later years . [They]1462-they brought up [[their]1462-they three children]1463-their three children without dispute . [They]1462-they had never disputed .

[She]346-margaret lay under [the earth]1464-the earth now . " Why did n't [you]879-their father tell [me]879-their father [you]879-their father knew of it ? "[879-their father] [he]879-their father had moaned , and [her]346-margaret faint voice had answered : " [I]346-margaret did n't want to , [Henry]360-henry - [I]346-margaret might have been wrong - and [every one]4408-every one hates illnesses . "[346-margaret] [He]879-their father had been told of the horror by [a strange doctor , whom [she]346-margaret had consulted during [his]879-their father absence from [town]4382-town]1465-a strange doctor , whom she had consulted during his absence from town . Was this altogether just ? Without fully explaining , [she]346-margaret had died . It was a fault on [her]346-margaret part , and - tears rushed into [his]879-their father eyes - what a little fault ! It was the only time [she]346-margaret had deceived [him]879-their father in those thirty years .

[He]879-their father rose to [his]879-their father feet and looked out of the window , for [Evie]265-evie had come in with the letters , and [he]879-their father could meet [no one]700-no one 's eye . Ah yes - [she]346-margaret had been [a good woman]1468-a good woman - [she]346-margaret had been steady . [He]879-their father chose the word deliberately . To [him]879-their father steadiness included all praise .

[He]879-their father [himself]879-their father , gazing at [the wintry garden]1469-the wintry garden , is in appearance [a steady man]1470-a steady man . [His]879-their father face was not as square as [[his]879-their father son]1471-his son 's , and , indeed , the chin , though firm enough in outline , retreated a little , and the lips , ambiguous , were curtained by a moustache . But there was no external hint of weakness . The eyes , if capable of kindness and goodfellowship , if ruddy for the moment with tears , were the eyes of [one who could not be driven]1472-one who could not be driven . The forehead , too , was like [Charles]364-charles 's . High and straight , brown and polished , merging abruptly into temples and skull , it has the effect of a bastion that protected [his]879-their father head from [the world]836-the world . At times it had the effect of a blank wall . [He]879-their father had dwelt behind [it]1474-it , intact and happy , for fifty years .

[Poor Mrs. Charles]364-charles sat between [[her]364-charles silent companions]1478-her silent companions , terrified at the course of events , and a little bored . [Brother]366-brother and [sister]1487-sister were not callous . [All Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes did . It did not seem to [them]1488-they of supreme importance . [Their]1488-they grief , though less poignant than [[their]1488-they father]879-their father 's , grew from deeper roots , for [a wife]1506-a wife may be replaced ; [a mother]1507-a mother never .

[Charles]364-charles would go back to [the office]3927-the office . There was little to do at [Howards End]257-helen . The contents of [[his]807-the man mother]4237-his mother 's will had been long known to [them]1488-they . [Charles]261-mr. wilcox thought the habit laudable , though [he]261-mr. wilcox did not intend to adopt it [himself]261-mr. wilcox , whereas [Margaret]346-margaret would have seen in it an almost culpable indifference to earthly fame . " Why , [you]261-mr. wilcox just said it was ! "[348-dolly] cried [Dolly]348-dolly .

" Never mind if [I]261-mr. wilcox did , "[261-mr. wilcox] [he]261-mr. wilcox blazed out ; " and hold [your]348-dolly tongue . "[261-mr. wilcox]

[The poor little wife]1556-the poor little wife coloured at this , and , drawing [her]1556-the poor little wife handkerchief from [her]1556-the poor little wife pocket , shed a few tears . [No one]700-no one noticed [her]1556-the poor little wife . [Evie]265-evie was scowling like [an angry boy]1558-an angry boy . [The two men]1559-the two men were gradually assuming the manner of [the committee - room]1560-the committee - room . [They]1559-the two men were both at [their]1559-the two men best when serving on committees . [They]1559-the two men did not make the mistake of handling human affairs in the bulk , but disposed of [them]1559-the two men item by item , sharply . Calligraphy was the item before [them]1559-the two men now , and on it [they]1559-the two men turned [their]1559-the two men well - trained brains . [Charles]261-mr. wilcox , after a little demur , accepted the writing as genuine , and [they]1559-the two men passed on to the next point . It is the best - perhaps the only - way of dodging emotion . [They]1559-the two men were the average human article , and had [they]1559-the two men considered the note as a whole it would have driven [them]1559-the two men miserable or mad . Considered item by item , the emotional content was minimized , and all went forward smoothly . The clock ticked , the coals blazed higher , and contended with the white radiance that poured in through the windows . Unnoticed , the sun occupied [his]261-mr. wilcox sky , and the shadows of the tree stems , extraordinarily solid , fell like trenches of purple across [the frosted lawn]1561-the frosted lawn . It was a glorious winter morning . [Evie]265-evie 's fox terrier , who had passed for white , was only a dirty grey dog now , so intense was the purity that surrounded [him]261-mr. wilcox . [He]261-mr. wilcox was discredited , but the blackbirds that [he]261-mr. wilcox was chasing glowed with Arabian darkness , for all the conventional colouring of life had been altered . Inside , the clock struck ten with a rich and confident note . Other clocks confirmed it , and the discussion moved towards its close .

To follow it is unnecessary . It is rather a moment when [the commentator]1562-the commentator should step forward . Ought [the Wilcoxes]3880-the wilcoxes to have offered [[their]3880-the wilcoxes home]1564-their home to [Margaret]278-margaret ? [I]0-i think not . The appeal was too flimsy . It was not legal ; it had been written in illness , and under the spell of a sudden friendship ; it was contrary to [the dead woman]1407-the dead woman 's intentions in the past , contrary to [her]1407-the dead woman very nature , so far as that nature was understood by [them]1559-the two men . To [them]1559-the two men [Howards End]257-helen was [a house]3920-a house : [they]1559-the two men could not know that to [her]1407-the dead woman it had been a spirit , for which [she]1407-the dead woman sought [a spiritual heir]1567-a spiritual heir . And - pushing one step farther in these mists - may [they]1559-the two men not have decided even better than [they]1559-the two men supposed ? Is it credible that the possessions of the spirit can be bequeathed at all ? Has the soul offspring ? A wych - elm tree , a vine , a wisp of hay with dew on it - can passion for such things be transmitted where there is no bond of blood ? No ; [the Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes are not to be blamed . The problem is too terrific , and [they]263-the wilcoxes could not even perceive a problem . No ; it is natural and fitting that after due debate [they]263-the wilcoxes should tear the note up and throw it on to [their]263-the wilcoxes dining - room fire . [The practical moralist]1568-the practical moralist may acquit [them]263-the wilcoxes absolutely . [He]1568-the practical moralist who strives to look deeper may acquit [them]263-the wilcoxes - almost . For one hard fact remains . [They]263-the wilcoxes did neglect a personal appeal . [The woman who had died]1569-the woman who had died did say to [them]1559-the two men , " Do this , "[1569-the woman who had died] and [they]1559-the two men answered , " [We]1559-the two men will not . "[1559-the two men]

The incident made a most painful impression on [them]1559-the two men . [Grief]370-grief mounted into the brain and worked there disquietingly . Yesterday [they]1559-the two men had lamented : " [She]1569-the woman who had died was [a dear mother]4460-a dear mother , [a true wife]4461-a true wife : in [our]1559-the two men absence [she]1569-the woman who had died neglected [her]1569-the woman who had died health and died . "[1559-the two men] Today [they]1559-the two men thought : " [She]1569-the woman who had died was not as true , as dear , as [we]1559-the two men supposed . "[1559-the two men] The desire for a more inward light had found expression at last , the unseen had impacted on the seen , and all that [they]1559-the two men could say was " Treachery . "[1559-the two men] [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox had been treacherous to [the family]4226-the family , to the laws of property , to [her]528-mrs. wilcox own written word . How did [she]528-mrs. wilcox expect [Howards End]257-helen to be conveyed to [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret ? Was [[her]528-mrs. wilcox husband]1223-her husband , to whom it legally belonged , to make it over to [her]528-mrs. wilcox as a free gift ? Was the said [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret to have a life interest in it , or to own it absolutely ? Was there to be no compensation for [the garage]1492-the garage and other improvements that [they]1559-the two men had made under the assumption that all would be theirs some day ? Treacherous ! treacherous and absurd ! When [we]1573-we think the dead both treacherous and absurd , [we]1573-we have gone far towards reconciling [ourselves]1573-we to [their]1559-the two men departure . That note , scribbled in pencil , sent through [the matron]1546-the matron , was unbusinesslike as well as cruel , and decreased at once the value of [the woman who had written it]1575-the woman who had written it .

Chapter 12

[Charles]261-mr. wilcox need not have been anxious . [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret had never heard of [[his]261-mr. wilcox mother]4237-his mother 's strange request . [She]278-margaret was to hear of it in after years , when [she]278-margaret had built up [her]278-margaret life differently , and it was to fit into position as the headstone of the corner . [Her]278-margaret mind was bent on other questions now , and by [her]278-margaret also it would have been rejected as the fantasy of [an invalid]1589-an invalid .

[She]278-margaret was parting from [these Wilcoxes]1590-these wilcoxes for the second time . [Paul]259-paul and [[his]259-paul mother]4237-his mother , ripple and great wave , had flowed into [her]278-margaret life and ebbed out of it for ever . The ripple had left no traces behind : the wave had strewn at [her]278-margaret feet fragments torn from the unknown . [A curious seeker]1592-a curious seeker , [she]278-margaret stood for a while at the verge of [the sea]904-the sea that tells so little , but tells a little , and watched the outgoing of this last tremendous tide . [[Her]278-margaret friend]1594-her friend had vanished in agony , but not , [she]278-margaret believed , in degradation . [Her]278-margaret withdrawal had hinted at other things besides disease and pain . [Some]1595-some leave [our]1596-our life with tears , others with an insane frigidity ; [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox had taken the middle course , which only rarer natures can pursue . [She]528-mrs. wilcox had kept proportion . [She]528-mrs. wilcox had told a little of [her]528-mrs. wilcox grim secret to [[her]528-mrs. wilcox friends]1301-her friends , but not too much ; [she]528-mrs. wilcox had shut up [her]528-mrs. wilcox heart - almost , but not entirely . It is thus , if there is any rule , that [we]1596-our ought to die - neither as [victim]1598-victim nor as [fanatic]1599-fanatic , but as [the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that [he]1600-the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that he is entering , and the shore that he must leave is entering , and [the shore]1601-the shore that [he]1600-the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that he is entering , and the shore that he must leave must leave]1600-the seafarer who can greet with an equal eye the deep that he is entering , and the shore that he must leave .

The last word - whatever it would be - had certainly not been said in [Hilton churchyard]1602-hilton churchyard . [She]528-mrs. wilcox had not died [there]4043-there . A funeral is not death , any more than baptism is birth or marriage union . All three are the clumsy devices , coming now too late , now too early , by which [Society]371-society would register the quick motions of [man]3975-man . In [Margaret]278-margaret 's eyes [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox had escaped registration . [She]528-mrs. wilcox had gone out of life vividly , [her]528-mrs. wilcox own way , and no dust was so truly dust as the contents of that heavy coffin , lowered with ceremonial until it rested on the dust of the earth , no flowers so utterly wasted as the chrysanthemums that the frost must have withered before morning . [Margaret]278-margaret had once said [she]278-margaret " loved superstition . "[278-margaret] It was not true . [Few women]1605-few women had tried more earnestly to pierce the accretions in which body and soul are enwrapped . The death of [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox had helped [her]278-margaret in [her]278-margaret work . [She]278-margaret saw a little more clearly than hitherto what [a human being]1606-a human being is , and to what [he]1606-a human being may aspire . Truer relationships gleamed . Perhaps the last word would be hope - hope even on this side of the grave .

Meanwhile , [she]278-margaret could take an interest in [the survivors]1607-the survivors . In spite of [her]278-margaret Christmas duties , in spite of [[her]278-margaret brother]665-her brother , [the Wilcoxes]3880-the wilcoxes continued to play a considerable part in [her]278-margaret thoughts . [She]278-margaret had seen so much of [them]3880-the wilcoxes in the final week . [They]3880-the wilcoxes were not " [her]278-margaret sort , "[3880-the wilcoxes] [they]3880-the wilcoxes were often suspicious and stupid , and deficient where [she]278-margaret excelled ; but collision with [them]3880-the wilcoxes stimulated [her]278-margaret , and [she]278-margaret felt an interest that verged into liking , even for [Charles]261-mr. wilcox . [She]278-margaret desired to protect [them]3880-the wilcoxes , and often felt that [they]3880-the wilcoxes could protect [her]278-margaret , excelling where [she]278-margaret was deficient . Once past the rocks of emotion , [they]3880-the wilcoxes knew so well what to do , whom to send for ; [their]3880-the wilcoxes hands were on all the ropes , [they]3880-the wilcoxes had grit as well as grittiness , and [she]278-margaret valued grit enormously . [They]3880-the wilcoxes led a life that [she]278-margaret could not attain to - the outer life of " telegrams and anger , "[257-helen] which had detonated when [Helen]257-helen and [Paul]259-paul had touched in June , and had detonated again the other week . To [Margaret]278-margaret this life was to remain a real force . [She]278-margaret could not despise it , as [Helen]257-helen and [Tibby]262-tibby affected to do . It fostered such virtues as neatness , decision , and obedience , virtues of the second rank , no doubt , but [they]3880-the wilcoxes have formed [our]1610-our civilization . [They]3880-the wilcoxes form character , too ; [Margaret]278-margaret could not doubt it : [they]3880-the wilcoxes keep the soul from becoming sloppy . How dare [Schlegels]270-the schlegels despise [Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes , when it takes all sorts to make [a world]1611-a world ?

" Do n't brood too much , "[1612-she] [she]1612-she wrote to [Helen]257-helen , " on the superiority of the unseen to the seen . It 's true , but to brood on it is mediaeval . [Our]1610-our business is not to contrast the two , but to reconcile [them]4479-them . "[1612-she]

[Helen]257-helen replied that [she]257-helen had no intention of brooding on such a dull subject . What did [[her]257-helen sister]566-her sister take [her]257-helen for ? The weather was magnificent . [She]257-helen and [the Mosebachs]372-the mosebachs had gone tobogganing on [the only hill that [Pomerania]373-pomerania boasted]1614-the only hill that pomerania boasted . It was fun , but overcrowded , for the rest of [Pomerania]373-pomerania had gone [there]4043-there too . [Helen]257-helen loved [the country]4234-the country , and [her]257-helen letter glowed with physical exercise and poetry . [She]257-helen spoke of the scenery , quiet , yet august ; of the snow - clad fields , with their scampering herds of deer ; of [the river]4306-the river and [[its]4306-the river quaint entrance into [the Baltic Sea]93-the baltic sea]1618-its quaint entrance into the baltic sea ; of [the Oderberge]94-the oderberge , only three hundred feet high , from which one slid all too quickly back into [the Pomeranian plains]1619-the pomeranian plains , and yet [these Oderberge]1620-these oderberge were [real mountains]1621-real mountains , with pine - forests , streams , and views complete . " It is n't size that counts so much as the way things are arranged . "[257-helen] In another paragraph [she]257-helen referred to [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox sympathetically , but the news had not bitten into [her]257-helen . [She]257-helen had not realized the accessories of death , which are in a sense more memorable than death itself . The atmosphere of precautions and recriminations , and in the midst a human body growing more vivid because it was in pain ; the end of that body in [Hilton churchyard]33-hilton ; the survival of something that suggested hope , vivid in its turn against life 's workaday cheerfulness ; - all these were lost to [Helen]257-helen , who only felt that [a pleasant lady]1622-a pleasant lady could now be pleasant no longer . [She]257-helen returned to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place full of [her]257-helen own affairs - [she]257-helen had had another proposal - and [Margaret]278-margaret , after a moment 's hesitation , was content that this should be so .

The proposal had not been a serious matter . It was the work of [Fraulein Mosebach]293-fraulein mosebach , who had conceived the large and patriotic notion of winning back [[her]293-fraulein mosebach cousins]1623-her cousins to [the Fatherland]47-the fatherland by matrimony . [England]35-england had played [Paul Wilcox]259-paul , and lost ; [Germany]3-germany played [Herr Forstmeister]374-herr forstmeister someone - [Helen]257-helen could not remember [his]374-herr forstmeister name .

[Herr Forstmeister]374-herr forstmeister lived in [a wood]1624-a wood , and standing on [the summit of [the Oderberge]94-the oderberge]1625-the summit of the oderberge , [he]374-herr forstmeister had pointed out [[his]374-herr forstmeister house]1626-his house to [Helen]257-helen , or rather , had pointed out [the wedge of pines in which]1627-the wedge of pines in which [it]1626-his house lay . [She]257-helen had exclaimed , " Oh , how lovely ! That 's the place for [me]257-helen ! "[257-helen] and in the evening [Frieda]295-frieda appeared in [[her]295-frieda bedroom]1628-her bedroom . " [I]295-frieda have a message , dear [Helen]257-helen , "[295-frieda] etc . , and so [she]295-frieda had , but had been very nice when [Helen]257-helen laughed ; quite understood - [a forest too solitary and damp]1629-a forest too solitary and damp - quite agreed , but [Herr Forstmeister]374-herr forstmeister believed [he]374-herr forstmeister had assurance to the contrary . [Germany]3-germany had lost , but with good - humour ; holding the manhood of [the world]836-the world , [she]257-helen felt bound to win . " And there will even be [someone]3985-someone for [Tibby]262-tibby , "[257-helen] concluded [Helen]257-helen . " There now , [Tibby]262-tibby , think of that ; [Frieda]295-frieda is saving up [a little girl]4481-a little girl for [you]262-tibby , in pig - tails and white worsted stockings , but the feet of the stockings are pink , as if [the little girl]4482-the little girl had trodden in strawberries . [I]257-helen 've talked too much . [My]257-helen head aches . Now [you]262-tibby talk . "[257-helen]

[Tibby]262-tibby consented to talk . [He]262-tibby too was full of [his]262-tibby own affairs , for [he]262-tibby had just been up to try for a scholarship at [Oxford]96-oxford . [The men]1631-the men were down , and [the candidates]1632-the candidates had been housed in [various colleges]1633-various colleges , and had dined in [hall]571-hall . [Tibby]262-tibby was sensitive to beauty , the experience was new , and [he]262-tibby gave a description of [his]262-tibby visit that was almost glowing . The august and mellow University , soaked with the richness of [the western counties that [it]96-oxford has served for a thousand years]1635-the western counties that it has served for a thousand years , appealed at once to [the boy]753-the boy 's taste : it was the kind of thing [he]262-tibby could understand , and [he]262-tibby understood it all the better because it was empty . [Oxford]96-oxford is - [Oxford]96-oxford : not a mere receptacle for [youth]964-youth , like [Cambridge]376-cambridge . Perhaps it wants [[its]96-oxford inmates]4108-its inmates to love [it]96-oxford rather than to love [one another]3949-one another : such at all events was to be its effect on [Tibby]262-tibby . [[His]262-tibby sisters]1640-his sisters sent [him]262-tibby [there]4043-there that [he]262-tibby might make [friends]611-friends , for [they]1640-his sisters knew that [his]262-tibby education had been cranky , and had severed [him]262-tibby from [other boys]1643-other boys and [men]616-men . [He]262-tibby made [no friends]1645-no friends . [[His]262-tibby [Oxford]96-oxford]1646-his oxford remained [Oxford]96-oxford empty , and [he]262-tibby took into life with [him]262-tibby , not the memory of a radiance , but the memory of a colour scheme .

It pleased [Margaret]278-margaret to hear [[her]278-margaret brother]665-her brother and [sister]1487-sister talking . [They]1649-they did not get on overwell as a rule . For a few moments [she]278-margaret listened to [them]1649-they , feeling elderly and benign . Then something occurred to [her]278-margaret , and [she]278-margaret interrupted :

" [Helen]257-helen , [I]278-margaret told [you]257-helen about poor [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox ; that sad business ? "[278-margaret]

" Yes . "[278-margaret]

" [I]278-margaret have had a correspondence with [[her]528-mrs. wilcox son]4483-her son . [He]4483-her son was winding up [the estate]4484-the estate , and wrote to ask [me]278-margaret whether [[his]4483-her son mother]4237-his mother had wanted [me]278-margaret to have anything . [I]278-margaret thought it good of [him]4483-her son , considering [I]278-margaret knew [her]528-mrs. wilcox so little . [Helen]257-helen , after a decent pause , continued [her]257-helen account of [Stettin]52-stettin . How quickly a situation changes ! In June [she]52-stettin had been in a crisis ; even in November [she]52-stettin could blush and be unnatural ; now it was January , and the whole affair lay forgotten . Looking back on the past six months , [Margaret]278-margaret realized the chaotic nature of [our]1650-our daily life , and its difference from the orderly sequence that has been fabricated by [historians]1651-historians . Actual life is full of false clues and sign - posts that lead nowhere . With infinite effort [we]1650-our nerve [ourselves]1650-our for a crisis that never comes . The most successful career must show a waste of strength that might have removed mountains , and the most unsuccessful is not that of [the man who is taken unprepared , but of [him]1653-him who has prepared and is never taken]1652-the man who is taken unprepared , but of him who has prepared and is never taken . On a tragedy of that kind [our]1650-our national morality is duly silent . It assumes that preparation against danger is in itself a good , and that [men]616-men , like [nations]1655-nations , are the better for staggering through life fully armed . The tragedy of preparedness has scarcely been handled , save by [the Greeks]378-the greeks . Life is indeed dangerous , but not in the way morality would have [us]1650-our believe . It is indeed unmanageable , but the essence of it is not a battle . It is unmanageable because it is a romance , and its essence is romantic beauty .

[Margaret]278-margaret hoped that for the future [she]278-margaret would be less cautious , not more cautious , than [she]278-margaret had been in the past .

Chapter 13

Over two years passed , and [the Schlegel household]1656-the schlegel household continued to lead [its]1656-the schlegel household life of cultured but not ignoble ease , still swimming gracefully on the grey tides of [London]2-london . Concerts and plays swept past [them]1656-the schlegel household , money had been spent and renewed , reputations won and lost , and [the city]1095-the city herself , emblematic of [their]1656-the schlegel household lives , rose and fell in a continual flux , while [her]1095-the city shallows washed more widely against [the hills of [Surrey]88-surrey]1658-the hills of surrey and over [the fields of [Hertfordshire]77-hertfordshire]1659-the fields of hertfordshire . [This famous building]1660-this famous building had arisen , that was doomed . Today [Whitehall]97-whitehall had been transformed : it would be the turn of [Regent Street]86-regent street tomorrow . And month by month [the roads]3943-the roads smelt more strongly of petrol , and were more difficult to cross , and [human beings]852-human beings heard [each other]3977-each other speak with greater difficulty , breathed less of the air , and saw less of the sky . Nature withdrew : the leaves were falling by midsummer ; the sun shone through dirt with an admired obscurity .

To speak against [London]2-london is no longer fashionable . The Earth as [an artistic cult]1664-an artistic cult has had its day , and the literature of the near future will probably ignore [the country]4234-the country and seek inspiration from [the town]4305-the town . [One]602-one can understand the reaction . Of [Pan]379-pan and the elemental forces , [the public]1668-the public has heard a little too much - [they]1668-the public seem [Victorian]380-victorian , while [London]2-london is [Georgian]98-georgian - and those who care for [the earth]1464-the earth with sincerity may wait long ere the pendulum swings back to [her]1464-the earth again . Certainly [London]2-london fascinates . [One]602-one visualizes it as a tract of quivering grey , intelligent without purpose , and excitable without love ; as a spirit that has altered before it can be chronicled ; as a heart that certainly beats , but with no pulsation of humanity . It lies beyond everything : [Nature]381-nature , with all [her]381-nature cruelty , comes nearer to [us]1671-we than do [these crowds of men]1672-these crowds of men . [A friend]1316-a friend explains [himself]1316-a friend : [the earth]1464-the earth is explicable - from [her]381-nature [we]1671-we came , and [we]1671-we must return to [her]381-nature . But who can explain [Westminster Bridge Road]99-westminster bridge road or [Liverpool Street]18-liverpool street in the morning - [the city]1095-the city inhaling - or [the same thoroughfares]1676-the same thoroughfares in the evening - [the city]1095-the city exhaling [her]1095-the city exhausted air ? [We]1671-we reach in desperation beyond the fog , beyond the very stars , the voids of [the universe]960-the universe are ransacked to justify [the monster]1679-the monster , and stamped with a human face . [London]2-london is religion 's opportunity - not the decorous religion of [theologians]1680-theologians , but anthropomorphic , crude . Yes , the continuous flow would be tolerable if [a man of [our]1671-we own sort]1681-a man of our own sort - not [anyone pompous or tearful]1682-anyone pompous or tearful - were caring for [us]1671-we up in the sky .

[The Londoner]382-the londoner seldom understands [[his]382-the londoner city]1683-his city until it sweeps [him]382-the londoner , too , away from [his]382-the londoner moorings , and [Margaret]278-margaret 's eyes were not opened until the lease of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place expired . [She]278-margaret had always known that it must expire , but the knowledge only became vivid about nine months before the event . Then [the house]578-the house was suddenly ringed with pathos . [It]578-the house had seen so much happiness . Why had it to be swept away ? In [the streets of [the city]1095-the city]1685-the streets of the city [she]278-margaret noted for the first time the architecture of hurry , and heard the language of hurry on the mouths of [[its]1095-the city inhabitants]1687-its inhabitants - clipped words , formless sentences , potted expressions of approval or disgust . Month by month things were stepping livelier , but to what goal ? [The population]1688-the population still rose , but what was the quality of [the men born]1689-the men born ? [The particular millionaire who owned [the freehold of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place]1691-the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect [Babylonian flats]1692-babylonian flats upon [it]1691-the freehold of wickham place]1690-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it - what right had [he]1690-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it to stir so large a portion of the quivering jelly ? [He]1690-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it was not [a fool]3967-a fool - [she]278-margaret had heard [him]1690-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it expose [Socialism]383-socialism - but true insight began just where [his]1690-the particular millionaire who owned the freehold of wickham place , and desired to erect babylonian flats upon it intelligence ended , and one gathered that this was the case with [most millionaires]1694-most millionaires . What right had [such men]1695-such men - But [Margaret]278-margaret checked [herself]278-margaret . That way lies madness . Thank goodness [she]278-margaret , too , had some money , and could purchase [a new home]1696-a new home .

[Tibby]262-tibby , now in [his]262-tibby second year at [Oxford]96-oxford , was down for the Easter vacation , and [Margaret]278-margaret took the opportunity of having a serious talk with [him]262-tibby . " Then [you]278-margaret do n't think [I]317-leonard was foolish ? "[317-leonard] [he]317-leonard asked , becoming again [the naive and sweet - tempered boy for whom [Nature]381-nature had intended [him]317-leonard]1741-the naive and sweet - tempered boy for whom nature had intended him .

" Heavens , no ! "[278-margaret] replied [Margaret]278-margaret .

" [Heaven]403-heaven help [us]4593-we if [we]4593-we do ! "[257-helen] replied [Helen]257-helen .

" [I]381-nature 'm very glad [you]317-leonard say that . Now , [[my]381-nature wife]4152-my wife would never understand - not if [I]381-nature explained for days . "[381-nature]

" No , it was n't foolish ! "[257-helen] cried [Helen]257-helen , [her]257-helen eyes aflame . " [You]317-leonard 've pushed back the boundaries ; [I]257-helen think it splendid of [you]317-leonard . "[257-helen]

" [You]317-leonard 've not been content to dream as [we]4593-we have - "[381-nature]

" Though [we]4593-we have walked , too - "[257-helen]

" [I]381-nature must show [you]317-leonard a picture [upstairs]664-upstairs - "[381-nature]

Here the door - bell rang . [The hansom]1742-the hansom had come to take [them]1743-them to [their]1743-them evening party .

" Oh , bother , not to say dash - [I]1742-the hansom had forgotten [we]4593-we were dining out ; but do , do , come round again and have a talk . "[1742-the hansom]

" Yes , [you]317-leonard must - do , "[278-margaret] echoed [Margaret]278-margaret .

[Leonard]317-leonard , with extreme sentiment , replied : " No , [I]317-leonard shall not . It 's better like this . "[317-leonard]

" Why better ? "[278-margaret] asked [Margaret]278-margaret .

" No , it is better not to risk a second interview . [I]1742-the hansom shall always look back on this talk with [you]317-leonard as one of the finest things in [my]1742-the hansom life . Really . [I]1742-the hansom mean this . [We]4593-we can never repeat . It has done [me]1742-the hansom real good , and there [we]4593-we had better leave it . "[1742-the hansom]

" That 's rather a sad view of life , surely . "[317-leonard]

" Things so often get spoiled . "[1742-the hansom]

" [I]257-helen know , "[257-helen] flashed [Helen]257-helen , " but [people]3893-people do n't . "[257-helen]

[He]317-leonard could not understand this . [He]317-leonard continued in a vein which mingled true imagination and false . What [he]317-leonard said was n't wrong , but it was n't right , and a false note jarred . One little twist , [they]1744-they felt , and the instrument might be in tune . One little strain , and it might be silent for ever . [He]317-leonard thanked [the ladies]1048-the ladies very much , but [he]317-leonard would not call again . There was a moment 's awkwardness , and then [Helen]257-helen said : " Go , then ; perhaps [you]317-leonard know best ; but never forget [you]317-leonard 're better than [Jefferies]400-jefferies . "[257-helen] And [he]317-leonard went . [Their]1744-they hansom caught [him]317-leonard up at the corner , passed with a waving of hands , and vanished with [its]1746-its accomplished load into the evening .

[London]2-london was beginning to illuminate [herself]257-helen against the night . Electric lights sizzled and jagged in [the main thoroughfares]1747-the main thoroughfares , gas - lamps in [the side streets]1748-the side streets glimmered a canary gold or green . The sky was a crimson battlefield of spring , but [London]2-london was not afraid . [Her]257-helen smoke mitigated the splendour , and the clouds down [Oxford Street]115-oxford street were a delicately painted ceiling , which adorned while it did not distract . [She]257-helen has never known the clear - cut armies of the purer air . [Leonard]317-leonard hurried through [her]257-helen tinted wonders , very much part of the picture . [His]317-leonard was a grey life , and to brighten it [he]317-leonard had ruled off a few corners for romance . [The Miss Schlegels]270-the schlegels - or , to speak more accurately , [his]317-leonard interview with [them]1749-them - were to fill such a corner , nor was it by any means the first time that [he]317-leonard had talked intimately to [strangers]4077-strangers . The habit was analogous to a debauch , an outlet , though the worst of outlets , for instincts that would not be denied . Terrifying [him]317-leonard , it would beat down [his]317-leonard suspicions and prudence until [he]317-leonard was confiding secrets to [people whom [he]317-leonard had scarcely seen]1751-people whom he had scarcely seen . It brought [him]317-leonard many fears and some pleasant memories . Perhaps the keenest happiness [he]317-leonard had ever known was during a railway journey to [Cambridge]376-cambridge , where [a decent - mannered undergraduate]1752-a decent - mannered undergraduate had spoken to [him]317-leonard . [They]1753-they had got into conversation , and gradually [Leonard]317-leonard flung reticence aside , told some of [his]317-leonard domestic troubles , and hinted at the rest . [The undergraduate]1754-the undergraduate , supposing [they]1753-they could start a friendship , asked [him]317-leonard to " coffee after [hall]571-hall , "[1754-the undergraduate] which [he]317-leonard accepted , but afterwards grew shy , and took care not to stir from [the commercial hotel where [he]317-leonard lodged]1755-the commercial hotel where he lodged . [He]317-leonard did not want Romance to collide with [the Porphyrion]404-the porphyrion , still less with [Jacky]325-jacky , and [people with fuller , happier lives]1756-people with fuller , happier lives are slow to understand this . To [the Schlegels]270-the schlegels , as to [the undergraduate]1754-the undergraduate , [he]1754-the undergraduate was an interesting creature , of whom [they]1753-they wanted to see more . But [they]1753-they to [him]1754-the undergraduate were [denizens of Romance , who must keep to the corner [he]1754-the undergraduate had assigned [them]1753-they , pictures that must not walk out of [their]1753-they frames]1758-denizens of romance , who must keep to the corner he had assigned them , pictures that must not walk out of their frames .

[His]1754-the undergraduate behaviour over [Margaret]278-margaret 's visiting - card had been typical . [His]1754-the undergraduate had scarcely been a tragic marriage . Where there is no money and no inclination to violence tragedy can not be generated . [He]317-leonard could not leave [[his]317-leonard wife]1450-his wife , and [he]317-leonard did not want to hit [her]1450-his wife . Petulance and squalor were enough . Here " that card "[317-leonard] had come in . [Leonard]317-leonard , though furtive , was untidy , and left it lying about . [Jacky]325-jacky found it , and then began , " What 's that card , eh ? "[325-jacky] " Yes , do n't [you]325-jacky wish [you]325-jacky knew what that card was ? "[325-jacky] " [Len]317-leonard , who 's [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret ? "[325-jacky] etc . Months passed , and the card , now as a joke , now as a grievance , was handed about , getting dirtier and dirtier . It followed [them]1753-they when [they]1753-they moved from [Cornelia Road]117-cornelia road to [Tulse Hill]118-tulse hill . It was submitted to [third parties]1760-third parties . A few inches of pasteboard , it became the battlefield on which the souls of [Leonard]317-leonard and [[his]317-leonard wife]1450-his wife contended . Why did [he]317-leonard not say , " [A lady]1013-a lady took [my]317-leonard umbrella , [another]4599-another gave [me]317-leonard this that [I]317-leonard might call for [my]317-leonard umbrella "[317-leonard] ? Because [Jacky]325-jacky would have disbelieved [him]317-leonard ? Partly , but chiefly because [he]317-leonard was sentimental . No affection gathered round the card , but it symbolized the life of culture , that [Jacky]325-jacky should never spoil . At night [he]317-leonard would say to [himself]317-leonard , " Well , at all events , [she]1450-his wife does n't know about that card . [Yah]4600-yah ! done [her]1450-his wife there ! "[317-leonard]

[Poor Jacky]325-jacky ! [she]1450-his wife was not a bad sort , and had a great deal to bear . [She]1450-his wife drew [her]1450-his wife own conclusion - [she]1450-his wife was only capable of drawing one conclusion - and in the fulness of time [she]1450-his wife acted upon it . All the Friday [Leonard]317-leonard had refused to speak to [her]1450-his wife , and had spent the evening observing the stars . On the Saturday [he]317-leonard went up , as usual , to [town]4382-town , but [he]317-leonard came not back Saturday night nor Sunday morning , nor Sunday afternoon . The inconvenience grew intolerable , and though [she]1450-his wife was now of a retiring habit , and shy of [women]615-women , [she]1450-his wife went up to [Wickham Place]11-wickham place . [Leonard]317-leonard returned in [her]1450-his wife absence . The card , the fatal card , was gone from the pages of [Ruskin]326-ruskin , and [he]317-leonard guessed what had happened .

" Well ? "[317-leonard] [he]317-leonard had exclaimed , greeting [her]1450-his wife with peals of laughter . " [I]317-leonard know where [you]1450-his wife 've been , but [you]1450-his wife do n't know where [I]317-leonard 've been . "[317-leonard]

[Jacky]325-jacky sighed , said , " [Len]317-leonard , [I]325-jacky do think [you]317-leonard might explain , "[325-jacky] and resumed domesticity .

Explanations were difficult at this stage , and [Leonard]317-leonard was too silly - or it is tempting to write , too sound [a chap]1764-a chap to attempt them . [His]317-leonard reticence was not entirely the shoddy article that [a business life]1765-a business life promotes , the reticence that pretends that nothing is something , and hides behind the DAILY TELEGRAPH . [The adventurer]1766-the adventurer , also , is reticent , and it is an adventure for [a clerk]1767-a clerk to walk for a few hours in darkness . [You]1768-you may laugh at [him]1766-the adventurer , [you]1768-you who have slept nights on the veldt , with [your]1768-you rifle beside [you]1768-you and all the atmosphere of adventure past . And [you]1768-you also may laugh who think adventures silly . But do not be surprised if [Leonard]317-leonard is shy whenever [he]317-leonard meets [you]1768-you , and if [the Schlegels]270-the schlegels rather than [Jacky]325-jacky hear about the dawn .

That [the Schlegels]270-the schlegels had not thought [him]317-leonard foolish became a permanent joy . [He]317-leonard was at [his]317-leonard best when [he]317-leonard thought of [them]1769-them . It buoyed [him]317-leonard as [he]317-leonard journeyed home beneath fading heavens . Somehow the barriers of wealth had fallen , and there had been - [he]317-leonard could not phrase it - a general assertion of the wonder of [the world]836-the world . " [My]1771-the mystic conviction , "[1771-the mystic] says [the mystic]1771-the mystic , " gains infinitely the moment another soul will believe in it , "[1771-the mystic] and [they]1772-they had agreed that there was something beyond life 's daily grey . [He]317-leonard took off [his]317-leonard top - hat and smoothed it thoughtfully . [He]317-leonard had hitherto supposed the unknown to be books , literature , clever conversation , culture . [One]602-one raised [oneself]602-one by study , and got upsides with [the world]836-the world . But in that quick interchange a new light dawned . Was that something " walking in the dark among [the surburban hills]4601-the surburban hills ?[317-leonard]

[He]317-leonard discovered that [he]317-leonard was going bareheaded down [Regent Street]86-regent street . [London]2-london came back with a rush . [Few]1775-few were about at this hour , but [all whom [he]317-leonard passed]1776-all whom he passed looked at [him]317-leonard with a hostility that was the more impressive because it was unconscious . [He]317-leonard put [his]317-leonard hat on . It was too big ; [his]317-leonard head disappeared like a pudding into a basin , the ears bending outwards at the touch of the curly brim . [He]317-leonard wore it a little backwards , and its effect was greatly to elongate the face and to bring out the distance between the eyes and the moustache . Thus equipped , [he]317-leonard escaped criticism . [No one]700-no one felt uneasy as [he]317-leonard titupped along [the pavements]1778-the pavements , the heart of [a man]658-a man ticking fast in [his]317-leonard chest .

Chapter 15

[The sisters]864-the sisters went out to dinner full of [their]864-the sisters adventure , and when [they]864-the sisters were both full of the same subject , there were few dinner - parties that could stand up against [them]864-the sisters . This particular one , which was [all ladies]1781-all ladies , had more kick in it than most , but succumbed after a struggle . [Helen]257-helen at one part of the table , [Margaret]278-margaret at the other , would talk of [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast and of [no one else]1782-no one else , and somewhere about the entree [their]864-the sisters monologues collided , fell ruining , and became common property . Nor was this all . The dinner - party was really an informal discussion club ; there was a paper after it , read amid coffee - cups and laughter in [the drawing - room]4113-the drawing - room , but dealing more or less thoughtfully with some topic of general interest . After the paper came a debate , and in this debate [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast also figured , appearing now as a bright spot in civilization , now as a dark spot , according to the temperament of [the speaker]1784-the speaker . The subject of the paper had been , " How ought [I]691-the reader to dispose of [my]691-the reader money ? "[691-the reader] [the reader]691-the reader professing to be [a millionaire]1786-a millionaire on the point of death , inclined to bequeath [her]691-the reader fortune for the foundation of local art galleries , but open to conviction from other sources . The various parts had been assigned beforehand , and some of the speeches were amusing . [The hostess]1787-the hostess assumed the ungrateful role of " [[the millionaire]4602-the millionaire 's eldest son]4603-the millionaire 's eldest son , "[1787-the hostess] and implored [[her]1787-the hostess expiring parent]1788-her expiring parent not to dislocate Society by allowing such vast sums to pass out of [the family]4226-the family . Money was the fruit of self - denial , and [the second generation]1790-the second generation had a right to profit by the self - denial of the first . What right had " [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast "[1792-the various philanthropists] to profit ? [The National Gallery]1791-the national gallery was good enough for the likes of [him]319-mr. bast . After property had had its say - a saying that is necessarily ungracious - [the various philanthropists]1792-the various philanthropists stepped forward . Something must be done for " [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast "[1792-the various philanthropists] : [his]319-mr. bast conditions must be improved without impairing [his]319-mr. bast independence ; [he]319-mr. bast must have [a free library]1793-a free library , or free tennis - courts ; [his]319-mr. bast rent must be paid in such a way that [he]319-mr. bast did not know it was being paid ; it must be made worth [his]319-mr. bast while to join [the Territorials]1794-the territorials ; [he]319-mr. bast must be forcibly parted from [[his]319-mr. bast uninspiring wife]1795-his uninspiring wife , the money going to [her]1795-his uninspiring wife as compensation ; [he]319-mr. bast must be assigned [a Twin Star]1796-a twin star , [some member of the leisured classes who would watch over [him]319-mr. bast ceaselessly groans from [Helen]257-helen]1797-some member of the leisured classes who would watch over him ceaselessly groans from helen ; [he]319-mr. bast must be given food but no clothes , clothes but no food , a third - return ticket to [Venice]66-venice , without either food or clothes when [he]319-mr. bast arrived [there]4043-there . In short , [he]319-mr. bast might be given anything and everything so long as it was not the money itself .

And here [Margaret]278-margaret interrupted .

" Order , order , [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret ! "[1799-the reader of the paper] said [the reader of the paper]1799-the reader of the paper . " [You]278-margaret are here , [I]1799-the reader of the paper understand , to advise [me]1799-the reader of the paper in the interests of [the Society for the Preservation of [Places of Historic Interest]4605-places of historic interest]4604-the society for the preservation of places of historic interest or Natural Beauty . [I]1799-the reader of the paper can not have [you]278-margaret speaking out of [your]278-margaret role .
