"[1799-the reader of the paper]

" [Your]278-margaret head wo n't go round if only [you]278-margaret 'll listen to [my]278-margaret argument , "[278-margaret] said [Margaret]278-margaret . " Why not give [him]319-mr. bast the money itself . [You]278-margaret 're supposed to have about thirty thousand a year . "[278-margaret]

" Have [I]1799-the reader of the paper ? [I]1799-the reader of the paper thought [I]1799-the reader of the paper had a million . "[1799-the reader of the paper]

" Was n't a million [your]278-margaret capital ? Dear [me]278-margaret ! [we]4606-we ought to have settled that . Still , it does n't matter . Whatever [you]278-margaret 've got , [I]278-margaret order [you]278-margaret to give as many poor men as [you]278-margaret can three hundred a year each . "[278-margaret]

" But that would be pauperizing [them]1801-them , "[1800-an earnest girl] said [an earnest girl]1800-an earnest girl , who liked [the Schlegels]270-the schlegels , but thought [them]1801-them a little unspiritual at times .

" Not if [you]278-margaret gave [them]1801-them so much . A big windfall would not pauperize [a man]658-a man . It is these little driblets , distributed among [too many]4608-too many , that do the harm . Money 's educational . It 's far more educational than the things it buys . "[1799-the reader of the paper] There was a protest . " In a sense , "[278-margaret] added [Margaret]278-margaret , but the protest continued . " Well , is n't the most civilized thing going , [the man who has learnt to wear [his]4609-the man who has learnt to wear his income properly income properly]4609-the man who has learnt to wear his income properly ? "[278-margaret]

" Exactly what [your]278-margaret [Mr. Basts]405-the basts wo n't do . "[278-margaret]

" Give [them]1801-them a chance . Give [them]1801-them money . Do n't dole [them]1801-them out poetry - books and railway - tickets like [babies]699-babies . Give [them]1801-them the wherewithal to buy these things . When [your]278-margaret Socialism comes it may be different , and [we]4611-we may think in terms of commodities instead of cash . Till it comes give [people]3893-people cash , for it is the warp of civilization , whatever the woof may be . The imagination ought to play upon money and realize it vividly , for it 's the - the second most important thing in [the world]836-the world . It is so sluffed over and hushed up , there is so little clear thinking - oh , political economy , of course , but so few of [us]4611-we think clearly about [our]4611-we own private incomes , and admit that independent thoughts are in nine cases out of ten the result of independent means . Money : give [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast money , and do n't bother about [his]319-mr. bast ideals . [He]319-mr. bast 'll pick up those for [himself]319-mr. bast . "[278-margaret]

[She]278-margaret leant back while [the more earnest members of the club]1802-the more earnest members of the club began to misconstrue [her]278-margaret . [The female mind]1803-the female mind , though cruelly practical in daily life , can not bear to hear ideals belittled in conversation , and [Miss Schlegel]278-margaret was asked however [she]278-margaret could say such dreadful things , and what it would profit [Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast if [he]319-mr. bast gained [the whole world]4155-the whole world and lost [his]319-mr. bast own soul . [She]278-margaret answered , " Nothing , but [he]319-mr. bast would not gain [his]319-mr. bast soul until [he]319-mr. bast had gained a little of [the world]836-the world . "[278-margaret] Then [they]1802-the more earnest members of the club said , " No [they]1802-the more earnest members of the club did not believe it , "[278-margaret] and [she]278-margaret admitted that [an overworked clerk]1805-an overworked clerk may save [his]1805-an overworked clerk soul in the superterrestrial sense , where the effort will be taken for the deed , but [she]278-margaret denied that [he]1805-an overworked clerk will ever explore the spiritual resources of [this world]1806-this world , will ever know the rarer joys of the body , or attain to clear and passionate intercourse with [[his]1805-an overworked clerk fellows]1807-his fellows . [Others]893-others had attacked the fabric of Society - Property , Interest , etc . ; [she]278-margaret only fixed [her]278-margaret eyes on [a few human beings]1809-a few human beings , to see how , under present conditions , [they]1809-a few human beings could be made happier . Doing good to humanity was useless : the many - coloured efforts thereto spreading over [the vast area]1810-the vast area like films and resulting in an universal grey . To do good to one , or , as in this case , to a few , was the utmost [she]278-margaret dare hope for .

Between [the idealists]1811-the idealists , and [the political economists]1812-the political economists , [Margaret]278-margaret had a bad time . Disagreeing elsewhere , [they]1802-the more earnest members of the club agreed in disowning [her]278-margaret , and in keeping the administration of [the millionaire]4602-the millionaire 's money in [their]1802-the more earnest members of the club own hands . [The earnest girl]1814-the earnest girl brought forward a scheme of " personal supervision and mutual help , "[1814-the earnest girl] the effect of which was to alter [poor people]4204-poor people until [they]4204-poor people became exactly like [people who were not so poor]1816-people who were not so poor . [The hostess]1787-the hostess pertinently remarked that [she]278-margaret , as [eldest son]1818-eldest son , might surely rank among [the millionaire 's legatees]1819-the millionaire 's legatees . [Margaret]278-margaret weakly admitted the claim , and another claim was at once set up by [Helen]257-helen , who declared that [she]257-helen had been [[the millionaire]4602-the millionaire 's housemaid]1821-the millionaire 's housemaid for over forty years , overfed and underpaid ; was nothing to be done for [her]257-helen , so corpulent and poor ? [The millionaire]4602-the millionaire then read out [her]4602-the millionaire last will and testament , in which [she]4602-the millionaire left the whole of [her]4602-the millionaire fortune to [the Chancellor of the Exchequer]1823-the chancellor of the exchequer . Then [she]4602-the millionaire died . The serious parts of the discussion had been of higher merit than the playful - in a [men]616-men 's debate is the reverse more general ? - but the meeting broke up hilariously enough , and [a dozen happy ladies]1825-a dozen happy ladies dispersed to [[their]1825-a dozen happy ladies homes]687-their homes .

[Helen]257-helen and [Margaret]278-margaret walked [the earnest girl]1814-the earnest girl as far as [Battersea Bridge Station]119-battersea bridge station , arguing copiously all the way . When [she]1814-the earnest girl had gone [they]1828-we were conscious of an alleviation , and of the great beauty of the evening . [They]1828-we turned back towards [Oakley Street]120-oakley street . The lamps and the plane - trees , following the line of [the embankment]1829-the embankment , struck a note of dignity that is rare in [English cities]1830-english cities . The seats , almost deserted , were here and there occupied by gentlefolk in evening dress , who had strolled out from [the houses]1831-the houses [behind to enjoy fresh air and the whisper of the rising tide]1832-behind to enjoy fresh air and the whisper of the rising tide . There is something continental about [Chelsea Embankment]121-chelsea embankment . It is [an open space]1833-an open space used rightly , a blessing more frequent in [Germany]3-germany than here . As [Margaret]278-margaret and [Helen]257-helen sat down , [the city]1095-the city behind [them]1828-we seemed to be [a vast theatre]1835-a vast theatre , [an opera - house in which some endless trilogy]1836-an opera - house in which some endless trilogy was performing , and [they]1828-we [themselves]1828-we [a pair of satisfied subscribers , who did not mind losing a little of the second act]1837-a pair of satisfied subscribers , who did not mind losing a little of the second act .

Chapter 16

[Leonard]317-leonard accepted the invitation to tea next Saturday . But [he]317-leonard was right ; the visit proved a conspicuous failure .

" Sugar ? "[278-margaret] said [Margaret]278-margaret .

" Cake ? "[257-helen] said [Helen]257-helen . " The big cake or [the little deadlies]4712-the little deadlies ? [I]257-helen 'm afraid [you]317-leonard thought [my]257-helen letter rather odd , but [we]4710-we 'll explain - [we]4710-we are n't odd , really - not affected , really . As [a lady]1013-a lady 's lap - dog [Leonard]317-leonard did not excel . Chapter 17

[The Age of Property]1963-the age of property holds bitter moments even for [a proprietor]1964-a proprietor . When a move is imminent , furniture becomes ridiculous , and [Margaret]278-margaret now lay awake at nights wondering where , where on [earth]701-earth [they]1966-their and all [their]1966-their belongings would be deposited in September next . Chairs , tables , pictures , books , that had rumbled down to [them]1966-their through the generations , must rumble forward again like a slide of rubbish to which [she]278-margaret longed to give the final push , and send toppling into [the sea]904-the sea . But there were all [[their]1966-their father]879-their father 's books - [they]1966-their never read them , but they were [[their]1966-their father]879-their father 's , and must be kept . There was the marble - topped chiffonier - [[their]1966-their mother]1489-their mother had set store by it , [they]1966-their could not remember why . Round every knob and cushion in [the house]578-the house sentiment gathered , a sentiment that was at times personal , but more often a faint piety to the dead , a prolongation of rites that might have ended at the grave .

It was absurd , if [you]1972-you came to think of it ; [Helen]268-helen and [Tibby]262-tibby came to think of it : [Margaret]278-margaret was too busy with [the house - agents]1973-the house - agents . The feudal ownership of [land]1974-land did bring dignity , whereas the modern ownership of movables is reducing [us]1975-us again to [a nomadic horde]1976-a nomadic horde . [We]1975-us are reverting to the civilization of luggage , and [historians of the future]1977-historians of the future will note how [the middle classes]1978-the middle classes accreted possessions without taking root in [the earth]1464-the earth , and may find in this the secret of [their]1978-the middle classes imaginative poverty . [The Schlegels]270-the schlegels were certainly the poorer for the loss of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place . It had helped to balance [their]1966-their lives , and almost to counsel [them]1966-their . Nor is [[their]1966-their ground - landlord]1980-their ground - landlord spiritually the richer . [He]1980-their ground - landlord has built [[flats]647-flats on [its]1980-their ground - landlord site]1982-flats on its site , [[his]1980-their ground - landlord motor - cars]1983-his motor - cars grow swifter , [his]1980-their ground - landlord exposures of [Socialism]383-socialism more trenchant . But [he]1980-their ground - landlord has spilt the precious distillation of the years , and no chemistry of [his]1980-their ground - landlord can give it back to society again .

[Margaret]278-margaret grew depressed ; [she]278-margaret was anxious to settle on [a house]3920-a house before [they]1966-their left [town]4382-town to pay [their]1966-their annual visit to [Mrs. Munt]268-helen . [She]278-margaret enjoyed this visit , and wanted to have [her]278-margaret mind at ease for it . [Swanage]12-swanage , though dull , was stable , and this year [she]278-margaret longed more than usual for [its]12-swanage fresh air and for [the magnificent downs that guard [it]12-swanage on [the north]1987-the north]1986-the magnificent downs that guard it on the north . But [London]2-london thwarted [her]278-margaret ; in [its]2-london atmosphere [she]278-margaret could not concentrate . [London]2-london only stimulates , it can not sustain ; and [Margaret]278-margaret , hurrying over [its]2-london surface for [a house]3920-a house without knowing what sort of [a house]3920-a house [she]278-margaret wanted , was paying for many a thrilling sensation in the past . [She]278-margaret could not even break loose from culture , and [her]278-margaret time was wasted by concerts which it would be a sin to miss , and invitations which it would never do to refuse . At last [she]278-margaret grew desperate ; [she]278-margaret resolved that [she]278-margaret would go nowhere and be at [home]984-home to [no one]700-no one until [she]278-margaret found [a house]3920-a house , and broke the resolution in half an hour .

Once [she]278-margaret had humorously lamented that [she]278-margaret had never been to [[Simpson]420-simpson 's restaurant in [the Strand]140-the strand]1993-simpson 's restaurant in the strand . Now a note arrived from [Miss Wilcox]413-miss wilcox , asking [her]278-margaret to lunch [there]4043-there . [Mr. Cahill]419-mr. cahill was coming , and [the three]1712-the three would have such a jolly chat , and perhaps end up at [the Hippodrome]1996-the hippodrome . [Margaret]278-margaret had no strong regard for [Evie]265-evie , and no desire to meet [[her]278-margaret fiance]1997-her fiance , and [she]278-margaret was surprised that [Helen]268-helen , who had been far funnier about [Simpson]420-simpson 's , had not been asked instead . But the invitation touched [her]278-margaret by its intimate tone . [She]278-margaret must know [Evie Wilcox]265-evie better than [she]278-margaret supposed , and declaring that [she]278-margaret ' simply must , " [she]278-margaret accepted .[278-margaret]

But when [she]278-margaret saw [Evie]265-evie at the entrance of [the restaurant]1998-the restaurant , staring fiercely at nothing after the fashion of [athletic women]1999-athletic women , [her]278-margaret heart failed [her]278-margaret anew . [Miss Wilcox]413-miss wilcox had changed perceptibly since [her]413-miss wilcox engagement . [Her]413-miss wilcox voice was gruffer , [her]413-miss wilcox manner more downright , and [she]413-miss wilcox was inclined to patronize [the more foolish virgin]2000-the more foolish virgin . Then came a little surprise . " [Father]359-father might be of the party - yes , [Father]359-father was . "[278-margaret] With a smile of pleasure [she]278-margaret moved forward to greet [him]2011-i , and [her]278-margaret feeling of loneliness vanished .

The torrent of [their]2016-their love , having splashed these drops at [Margaret]278-margaret , swept away on its habitual course . [She]278-margaret sympathized with it now , for a little comfort had restored [her]278-margaret geniality . Chapter 18

It was a businesslike letter , and stated frankly what [he]261-mr. wilcox would do for [them]2028-they and what [he]261-mr. wilcox would not do . Also the rent . Yet [she]278-margaret thrilled with happiness ere [she]278-margaret reached [[her]278-margaret own house]2101-her own house . Chapter 19

If [one]602-one wanted to show [a foreigner]2116-a foreigner [England]35-england , perhaps the wisest course would be to take [him]261-mr. wilcox to [the final section of [the Purbeck Hills]151-the purbeck hills]2117-the final section of the purbeck hills , and stand [him]261-mr. wilcox on [their]151-the purbeck hills summit , a few miles to [the east of [Corfe]152-corfe]2118-the east of corfe . [[Bournemouth]102-bournemouth 's ignoble coast]2132-bournemouth 's ignoble coast cowers to the right , heralding the pine - trees that mean , for all [their]2133-their beauty , red houses , and the Stock Exchange , and extend to the gates of [London]2-london itself . But [the cliffs of [Freshwater]166-freshwater]2136-the cliffs of freshwater [it]2137-it shall never touch , and [the island]2138-the island will guard [the Island]2138-the island 's purity till the end of time . How [many villages]2144-many villages appear in this view ! How many [castles]2145-castles ! How many [churches]2146-churches , vanished or triumphant ! How many [ships]2147-ships , [railways]4205-railways , and [roads]2149-roads ! What incredible variety of men working beneath that lucent sky to what final end ! The reason fails , like a wave on [the Swanage beach]2150-the swanage beach ; the imagination swells , spreads , and deepens , until it becomes geographic and encircles [England]35-england .

So [Frieda Mosebach]295-frieda , now [Frau Architect Liesecke]440-frau liesecke , and [mother to [[her]295-frieda husband]1223-her husband 's baby]2151-mother to her husband 's baby , was brought up to [these heights]2153-these heights to be impressed , and , after a prolonged gaze , [she]295-frieda said that [the hills]2154-the hills were more swelling here than in [Pomerania]373-pomerania , which was true , but did not seem to [Mrs. Munt]268-helen apposite . " [One]602-one would lose something , "[268-helen] murmured [Helen]268-helen , apparently to [herself]268-helen . Chapter 20

[Margaret]278-margaret had often wondered at the disturbance that takes place in [[the world]836-the world 's waters]2214-the world 's waters , when [Love]444-love , who seems so tiny a pebble , slips in . Whom does [Love]444-love concern beyond [the beloved]2215-the beloved and [the lover]2216-the lover ? Yet [his]444-love impact deluges [a hundred shores]2217-a hundred shores . No doubt the disturbance is really the spirit of [the generations]2218-the generations , welcoming [the new generation]2219-the new generation , and chafing against the ultimate Fate , who holds [all the seas]2220-all the seas in the palm of [her]35-england hand . But [Love]444-love can not understand this . [He]444-love can not comprehend another 's infinity ; [he]444-love is conscious only of [his]444-love own - flying sunbeam , falling rose , pebble that asks for one quiet plunge below the fretting interplay of space and time . [He]444-love knows that [he]444-love will survive at the end of things , and be gathered by [Fate]445-fate as a jewel from the slime , and be handed with admiration round the assembly of [the gods]1899-the gods . " [Men]616-men did produce this , "[2222-they] [they]2222-they will say , and , saying , [they]2222-they will give [men]616-men immortality . But meanwhile - what agitations meanwhile ! The foundations of Property and Propriety are laid bare , twin rocks ; [Family Pride]2224-family pride flounders to the surface , puffing and blowing , and refusing to be comforted ; [Theology]446-theology , vaguely ascetic , gets up a nasty ground swell . Then [the lawyers]2225-the lawyers are aroused - cold brood - and creep out of [their]2225-the lawyers holes . [They]2225-the lawyers do what [they]2225-the lawyers can ; [they]2225-the lawyers tidy up Property and Propriety , reassure [Theology]446-theology and [Family Pride]2224-family pride . Half - guineas are poured on [the troubled waters]2227-the troubled waters , [the lawyers]2225-the lawyers creep back , and , if all has gone well , [Love]444-love joins [one man]2229-one man and [woman]1451-woman together in Matrimony .

[Margaret]278-margaret had expected the disturbance , and was not irritated by it . For [a sensitive woman]2231-a sensitive woman [she]278-margaret had steady nerves , and could bear with the incongruous and the grotesque ; and , besides , there was nothing excessive about [her]278-margaret love - affair . Good - humour was the dominant note of [her]278-margaret relations with [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox , or , as [I]0-i must now call [him]261-mr. wilcox , [Henry]360-henry . [Henry]360-henry did not encourage romance , and [she]278-margaret was [no girl]2232-no girl to fidget for it . [An acquaintance]2233-an acquaintance had become [a lover]2234-a lover , might become [a husband]4545-a husband , but would retain all that [she]278-margaret had noted in the acquaintance ; and love must confirm an old relation rather than reveal a new one .

In this spirit [she]278-margaret promised to marry [him]360-henry .

[He]360-henry was in [Swanage]12-swanage on the morrow , bearing the engagement - ring . [They]2236-they greeted [one another]3949-one another with a hearty cordiality that impressed [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley . [Henry]360-henry dined at [The Bays]2038-the bays , but [he]360-henry had engaged [a bedroom in [the principal hotel]2240-the principal hotel]2239-a bedroom in the principal hotel : [he]360-henry was [one of [those men who knew [the principal hotel]2240-the principal hotel]2242-those men who knew the principal hotel by instinct]2241-one of those men who knew the principal hotel by instinct . After dinner [he]360-henry asked [Margaret]278-margaret if [she]278-margaret would n't care for a turn on [the Parade]2244-the parade . [She]278-margaret accepted , and could not repress a little tremor ; it would be [her]278-margaret first real love scene . But as [she]278-margaret put on [her]278-margaret hat [she]278-margaret burst out laughing . Love was so unlike the article served up in books : the joy , though genuine , was different ; the mystery an unexpected mystery . For one thing , [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox still seemed [a stranger]2245-a stranger .

[A younger woman]2268-a younger woman might have resented [his]261-mr. wilcox masterly ways , but [Margaret]278-margaret had too firm a grip of life to make a fuss . [They]2273-they walked ahead briskly . [She]278-margaret was startled , and nearly screamed , but recovered [herself]278-margaret at once , and kissed with genuine love the lips that were pressed against [her]278-margaret own . It was [their]2273-they first kiss , and when it was over [he]261-mr. wilcox saw [her]278-margaret safely to the door and rang the bell for [her]278-margaret , but disappeared into the night before [the maid]1264-the maid answered it . On looking back , the incident displeased [her]278-margaret . It was so isolated . Nothing in [their]2273-they previous conversation had heralded it , and , worse still , no tenderness had ensued . If [a man]658-a man can not lead up to passion [he]658-a man can at all events lead down from it , and [she]278-margaret had hoped , after [her]278-margaret complaisance , for some interchange of gentle words . But [he]261-mr. wilcox had hurried away as if ashamed , and for an instant [she]278-margaret was reminded of [Helen]268-helen and [Paul]259-paul .

Chapter 21

[Charles]261-mr. wilcox had just been scolding [[his]261-mr. wilcox Dolly]2280-his dolly . " [We]5063-we 're in a bad hole , and must make the best of it . [I]348-dolly shall answer [the pater]5064-the pater 's letter civilly . But if [I]348-dolly find [them]5065-their giving [themselves]5065-their airs , or monopolizing [[my]348-dolly father]3929-my father , or at all ill - treating [him]3929-my father , or worrying [him]3929-my father with [their]5065-their artistic beastliness , [I]348-dolly intend to put [my]348-dolly foot down , yes , firmly . Taking [[my]348-dolly mother]4446-my mother 's place ! [Heaven]403-heaven knows what poor old [Paul]259-paul will say when the news reaches [him]3929-my father . "[348-dolly]

The interlude closes . It has taken place in [[Charles]261-mr. wilcox 's garden]2282-charles 's garden at [Hilton]33-hilton . [He]261-mr. wilcox and [Dolly]348-dolly are sitting in deck - chairs , and [their]2283-them motor is regarding [them]2283-them placidly from [[its]2284-its garage]2285-its garage across [the lawn]598-the lawn . A short - frocked edition of [Charles]261-mr. wilcox also regards [them]2283-them placidly ; a perambulator edition is squeaking ; a third edition is expected shortly . Nature is turning out [Wilcoxes]263-the wilcoxes in [this peaceful abode]2287-this peaceful abode , so that [they]2283-them may inherit [the earth]1464-the earth .

Chapter 22

[Margaret]278-margaret greeted [[her]278-margaret lord]2289-her lord with peculiar tenderness on the morrow . Mature as [he]2289-her lord was , [she]278-margaret might yet be able to help [him]2289-her lord to the building of [the rainbow bridge that should connect the prose in [us]2291-us with the passion]2290-the rainbow bridge that should connect the prose in us with the passion . Without it [we]2291-us are meaningless fragments , [half monks]2292-half monks , half beasts , unconnected arches that have never joined into [a man]658-a man . With it love is born , and alights on the highest curve , glowing against the grey , sober against the fire . Happy [the man who sees from either aspect the glory of these outspread wings]2294-the man who sees from either aspect the glory of these outspread wings . The roads of [his]2289-her lord soul lie clear , and [he]2289-her lord and [[his]2289-her lord friends]1866-his friends shall find easy - going .

It was hard - going in [the roads of [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox 's soul]2296-the roads of mr. wilcox 's soul . From boyhood [he]2289-her lord had neglected [them]2296-the roads of mr. wilcox 's soul . " [I]2289-her lord am not [a fellow who bothers about [my]2289-her lord own inside]5068-a fellow who bothers about my own inside . "[2289-her lord] Outwardly [he]2289-her lord was cheerful , reliable , and brave ; but within , all had reverted to chaos , ruled , so far as it was ruled at all , by an incomplete asceticism . Whether as [boy]2297-boy , [husband]1288-husband , or [widower]2299-widower , [he]2289-her lord had always the sneaking belief that bodily passion is bad , a belief that is desirable only when held passionately . Religion had confirmed [him]2289-her lord . The words that were read aloud on Sunday to [him]2289-her lord and to [other respectable men]2300-other respectable men were the words that had once kindled the souls of [St. Catharine]453-st. catharine and [St. Francis]454-st. francis into a white - hot hatred of the carnal . [He]2289-her lord could - not be as [the saints]2301-the saints and love [the Infinite]455-the infinite with a seraphic ardour , but [he]2289-her lord could be a little ashamed of loving [a wife]1506-a wife . " [Amabat]456-amabat , amare timebat . "[2289-her lord] And it was here that [Margaret]278-margaret hoped to help [him]2289-her lord .

It did not seem so difficult . [She]278-margaret need trouble [him]2289-her lord with no gift of [her]278-margaret own . [She]278-margaret would only point out the salvation that was latent in [his]2289-her lord own soul , and in the soul of [every man]2111-every man . Only connect ! That was the whole of [her]278-margaret sermon . Only connect the prose and the passion , and both will be exalted , and human love will be seen at its height . Live in fragments no longer . Only connect , and the beast and [the monk , robbed of the isolation that is life to either]2304-the monk , robbed of the isolation that is life to either , will die .

Nor was the message difficult to give . It need not take the form of a good " talking . "[278-margaret] By quiet indications [the bridge]1839-the bridge would be built and span [their]2306-their lives with beauty .

But [she]278-margaret failed . For there was one quality in [Henry]360-henry for which [she]278-margaret was never prepared , however much [she]278-margaret reminded [herself]278-margaret of it : [his]360-henry obtuseness . [He]360-henry simply did not notice things , and there was no more to be said . [He]360-henry never noticed that [Helen]268-helen and [Frieda]295-frieda were hostile , or that [Tibby]262-tibby was not interested in currant plantations ; [he]360-henry never noticed the lights and shades that exist in the grayest conversation , the finger - posts , the milestones , the collisions , the illimitable views . Once - on another occasion - [she]278-margaret scolded [him]360-henry about it . [He]360-henry was puzzled , but replied with a laugh : " [My]360-henry motto is Concentrate . [I]360-henry 've no intention of frittering away [my]360-henry strength on that sort of thing . "[360-henry] " It is n't frittering away the strength , "[278-margaret] [she]278-margaret protested . " It 's enlarging the space in which [you]278-margaret may be strong . "[360-henry] [He]360-henry answered : " [You]268-helen 're [a clever little woman]5069-a clever little woman , but [my]360-henry motto 's Concentrate . "[360-henry] And this morning [he]360-henry concentrated with a vengeance .

[They]2307-we met in the rhododendrons of yesterday . In the daylight the bushes were inconsiderable and the path was bright in the morning sun . Chapter 23

[Margaret]278-margaret had no intention of letting things slide , and the evening before [she]278-margaret left [Swanage]12-swanage [she]278-margaret gave [[her]278-margaret sister]566-her sister a thorough scolding . [She]278-margaret censured [her]566-her sister , not for disapproving of the engagement , but for throwing over [her]278-margaret disapproval a veil of mystery . [Helen]268-helen was equally frank . " Yes , "[268-helen] [she]268-helen said , with the air of [one looking inwards]2335-one looking inwards , " there is a mystery . [I]268-helen ca n't help it . It 's not [my]268-helen fault . It 's the way life has been made . "[268-helen] [Helen]268-helen in those days was over - interested in the subconscious self . [She]268-helen exaggerated the Punch and Judy aspect of life , and spoke of [mankind]2336-mankind as puppets , whom [an invisible showman]2337-an invisible showman twitches into love and war . [Margaret]278-margaret pointed out that if [she]278-margaret dwelt on this [she]278-margaret , too , would eliminate the personal . [Helen]268-helen was silent for a minute , and then burst into a queer speech , which cleared the air . " Go on and marry [him]5127-him . [I]278-margaret think [you]268-helen 're splendid ; and if [anyone]4060-anyone can pull it off , [you]268-helen will . "[278-margaret] [Margaret]278-margaret denied that there was anything to " pull off , "[278-margaret] but [she]278-margaret continued : " Yes , there is , and [I]278-margaret was n't up to it with [Paul]259-paul . " Oh , [Helen]268-helen ! Am [I]278-margaret ? Will it be as dreadful for poor [Henry]360-henry as all that ? "[278-margaret]

" [You]268-helen mean to keep proportion , and that 's heroic , it 's [Greek]462-greek , and [I]278-margaret do n't see why it should n't succeed with [you]268-helen . [Margaret]278-margaret was grateful for this expression of affection , and answered , " Perhaps . "[278-margaret] All vistas close in the unseen - [no one]700-no one doubts it - but [Helen]268-helen closed them rather too quickly for [her]268-helen taste . No ; truth , being alive , was not halfway between anything . It was only to be found by continuous excursions into [either realm]2343-either realm , and though proportion is the final secret , to espouse it at the outset is to insure sterility .

[Helen]268-helen , agreeing here , disagreeing there , would have talked till midnight , but [Margaret]278-margaret , with [her]278-margaret packing to do , focussed the conversation on [Henry]360-henry . Then [the car]1528-the car turned away , and it was as if a curtain had risen . For the second time that day [she]278-margaret saw the appearance of [the earth]1464-the earth .

There were the greengage - trees that [Helen]268-helen had once described , there [the tennis lawn]2395-the tennis lawn , there the hedge that would be glorious with dog - roses in June , but the vision now was of black and palest green . Down by [the dell - hole]2396-the dell - hole more vivid colours were awakening , and Lent Lilies stood sentinel on its margin , or advanced in battalions over the grass . Tulips were a tray of jewels . [She]278-margaret could not see the wych - elm tree , but a branch of the celebrated vine , studded with velvet knobs , had covered [the porch]1545-the porch . " [Naughty cow]5153-naughty cow ! Go away ! "[278-margaret] cried [Margaret]278-margaret to the cow , but without indignation .

Desolation greeted [her]278-margaret . Dirty finger - prints were on [the hall]1039-the hall - windows , flue and rubbish on [its]1039-the hall unwashed boards . The civilization of luggage had been [here]4094-here for a month , and then decamped . Then [she]2431-she opened one of the doors opposite - there were two - and exchanged wall - papers for whitewash . [The garden at the back]2435-the garden at the back was full of flowering cherries and plums . Penned in by the desolate weather , [she]2431-she recaptured the sense of space which the motor had tried to rob from [her]2431-she . [She]2431-she remembered again that ten square miles are not ten times as wonderful as one square mile , that a thousand square miles are not practically the same as [heaven]4518-heaven . The phantom of bigness , which [London]2-london encourages , was laid for ever when [she]2431-she paced from [the hall]1039-the hall at [Howards End]257-helen to [[its]1039-the hall kitchen]2441-its kitchen and heard the rains run this way and that where the watershed of the roof divided [them]2442-them .

Now [Helen]268-helen came to [her]268-helen mind , scrutinizing half [Wessex]21-wessex from [the ridge of [the Purbeck Downs]202-the purbeck downs]2443-the ridge of the purbeck downs , and saying : " [You]5154-you will have to lose something . "[268-helen] [She]268-helen was not so sure . For instance , [she]268-helen would double [[her]268-helen kingdom]2444-her kingdom by opening the door that concealed the stairs .

Now [she]268-helen thought of the map of [Africa]74-africa ; of [empires]2445-empires ; of [[her]268-helen father]915-her father ; of [the two supreme nations]2447-the two supreme nations , streams of whose life warmed [her]268-helen blood , but , mingling , had cooled [her]268-helen brain . [She]268-helen paced back into [the hall]1039-the hall , and as [she]268-helen did so [the house]578-the house reverberated .

" Is that [you]5155-you , [Henry]360-henry ? "[268-helen] [she]268-helen called .

There was no answer , but [the house]578-the house reverberated again .

" [Henry]360-henry , have [you]5155-you got in ? "[268-helen]

But it was the heart of [the house]578-the house beating , faintly at first , then loudly , martially . It dominated the rain .

It is the starved imagination , not the well - nourished , that is afraid . [Margaret]278-margaret flung open the door to the stairs . A noise as of drums seemed to deafen [her]278-margaret . [A woman]1137-a woman , [an old woman]2453-an old woman , was descending , with figure erect , with face impassive , with lips that parted and said dryly :

[Her]2470-she evening was pleasant . The sense of flux which had haunted [her]2470-she all the year disappeared for a time . "[2485-two women] But [Henry]360-henry had saved it ; without fine feelings or deep insight , but [he]360-henry had saved it , and [she]2489-she loved [him]360-henry for the deed . " When [I]360-henry had more control [I]360-henry did what [I]360-henry could : sold off the two and a half animals , and the mangy pony , and the superannuated tools ; pulled down [the outhouses]5204-the outhouses ; drained ; thinned out [I]360-henry do n't know how many guelder - roses and elder - trees ; and inside [the house]578-the house [I]360-henry turned [the old kitchen]5206-the old kitchen into [a hall]5207-a hall , and made [a kitchen behind where [the dairy]5209-the dairy was]5208-a kitchen behind where the dairy was . "[360-henry] No , it was n't ; and if [he]360-henry did not quite understand it , [the artistic crew]2490-the artistic crew would still less : it was English , and the wych - elm that [she]2491-she saw from the window was an English tree . Chapter 25

[Evie]265-evie heard of [[her]265-evie father]915-her father 's engagement when [she]265-evie was in for a tennis tournament , and [her]265-evie play went simply to pot . [Margaret]278-margaret found that [she]278-margaret was expected to figure at this function , and to figure largely ; it would be such an opportunity , said [Henry]360-henry , for [her]278-margaret to get to know [his]360-henry set . [Evie]265-evie was not to be married from [Ducie Street]128-ducie street . [She]265-evie had a fancy for something rural , and , besides , [no one]700-no one would be in [London]2-london then , so [she]265-evie left [her]265-evie boxes for a few weeks at [Oniton Grange]204-oniton grange , and [her]265-evie banns were duly published in [the parish church]2519-the parish church , and for a couple of days [the little town]2520-the little town , dreaming between [the ruddy hills]2521-the ruddy hills , was roused by the clang of [our]2522-our civilization , and drew up by the roadside to let [the motors]2523-the motors pass . [Oniton]278-margaret had been a discovery of [[Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox 's]2524-mr. wilcox 's - a discovery of which [he]261-mr. wilcox was not altogether proud . [It]2525-it was up towards [the Welsh border]2526-the welsh border , and so difficult of access that [he]261-mr. wilcox had concluded [it]2525-it must be something special . [A ruined castle]2527-a ruined castle stood in [the grounds]2528-the grounds . But having got [there]4043-there , what was one to do ? [The place]5142-the place turned out to be in [the wrong part of [Shropshire]130-shropshire]2532-the wrong part of shropshire , damn it , and though [he]261-mr. wilcox never damned [[his]261-mr. wilcox own property]2533-his own property aloud , [he]261-mr. wilcox was only waiting to get it off [his]261-mr. wilcox hands , and then to let fly . [Evie]265-evie 's marriage was [its]2534-its last appearance in public . As soon as [a tenant]2535-a tenant was found , [it]2534-its became [a house for which [he]2535-a tenant never had had much use , and had less now , and , like [Howards End]257-helen]2536-a house for which he never had had much use , and had less now , and , like howards end , faded into Limbo .

But on [Margaret Oniton]278-margaret was destined to make a lasting impression . [She]278-margaret regarded [it]278-margaret as [[her]278-margaret future [home]984-home]2537-her future home , and was anxious to start straight with [the clergy]2539-the clergy , etc . , and , if possible , to see something of the local life . [It]278-margaret was [a market - town]2540-a market - town - as tiny a one as [England]35-england possesses - and had for ages served [that lonely valley]2541-that lonely valley , and guarded [our]2542-our marches against [the Kelt]492-the kelt . In spite of the occasion , in spite of the numbing hilarity that greeted [her]278-margaret as soon as [she]278-margaret got into [the reserved saloon at [Paddington]16-paddington]2543-the reserved saloon at paddington , [her]278-margaret senses were awake and watching , and though [Oniton]278-margaret was to prove one of [her]278-margaret innumerable false starts , [she]278-margaret never forgot it , nor the things that happened there .

The [London]2-london party only numbered eight - [the Fussells]350-the fussells , [father]788-father and [son]787-son , [two Anglo - Indian ladies named [Mrs. Plynlimmon]477-mrs. plynlimmon and [Lady Edser]478-lady edser , [Mrs. Warrington Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox and [[her]528-mrs. wilcox daughter]1400-her daughter]2546-two anglo - indian ladies named mrs. plynlimmon and lady edser , mrs. warrington wilcox and her daughter , and lastly , [the little girl]4482-the little girl , very smart and quiet , who figures at so many weddings , and who kept a watchful eye on [Margaret]278-margaret , [the bride - elect]2549-the bride - elect , [Dolly]348-dolly was absent - a domestic event detained [her]278-margaret at [Hilton]33-hilton ; [Paul]259-paul had cabled a humorous message ; [Charles]261-mr. wilcox was to meet [them]2550-they with a trio of motors at [Shrewsbury]206-shrewsbury . [Helen]268-helen had refused [her]268-helen invitation ; [Tibby]262-tibby had never answered [his]262-tibby . The management was excellent , as was to be expected with anything that [Henry]360-henry undertook ; [one]602-one was conscious of [his]360-henry sensible and generous brain in the background . [They]2550-they were [[his]360-henry guests]2552-his guests as soon as [they]2550-they reached [the train]3884-the train ; a special label for [their]2550-they luggage ; [a courier]2554-a courier ; a special lunch ; [they]2550-they had only to look pleasant and , where possible , pretty . [Margaret]278-margaret thought with dismay of [her]278-margaret own nuptials - presumably under the management of [Tibby]262-tibby . " [Mr. Theobald Schlegel]276-mr. schlegel and [Miss Helen Schlegel]479-helen request the pleasure of [Mrs. Plynlimmon]477-mrs. plynlimmon 's company on the occasion of the marriage of [[their]2550-they sister]5218-their sister [Margaret]278-margaret . "[262-tibby] The formula was incredible , but it must soon be printed and sent , and though [Wickham Place]11-wickham place need not compete with [Oniton]278-margaret , [it]11-wickham place must feed [[its]11-wickham place guests]2555-its guests properly , and provide [them]2555-its guests with sufficient chairs . [Her]278-margaret wedding would either be ramshackly or bourgeois - [she]278-margaret hoped the latter . Such an affair as the present , staged with a deftness that was almost beautiful , lay beyond [her]278-margaret powers and those of [[her]278-margaret friends]1301-her friends .

The low rich purr of [a Great Western express]2557-a great western express is not the worst background for conversation , and the journey passed pleasantly enough . Nothing could have exceeded the kindness of [the two men]1559-the two men . [They]1559-the two men raised windows for [some ladies]5012-some ladies , and lowered [them]2560-them for [others]893-others , [they]1559-the two men rang the bell for [the servant]2562-the servant , [they]1559-the two men identified [the colleges]2563-the colleges as [the train]3884-the train slipped past [Oxford]96-oxford , [they]1559-the two men caught books or bag - purses in the act of tumbling on to the floor . Yet there was nothing finicky about [their]1559-the two men politeness : it had the Public School touch , and , though sedulous , was virile . More battles than [Waterloo]22-waterloo have been won on [[our]2565-our playing - fields]2566-our playing - fields , and [Margaret]278-margaret bowed to a charm of which [she]278-margaret did not wholly approve , and said nothing when [the Oxford colleges]2567-the oxford colleges were identified wrongly . " [Male and female]5219-male and female created [He]5220-he [them]2567-the oxford colleges "[278-margaret] ; the journey to [Shrewsbury]206-shrewsbury confirmed this questionable statement , and [the long glass saloon]2568-the long glass saloon , that moved so easily and felt so comfortable , became [a forcing - house]2569-a forcing - house for the idea of sex .

At [Shrewsbury]206-shrewsbury came fresh air . [Shropshire]130-shropshire had not the reticence of [Hertfordshire]77-hertfordshire . Though robbed of half its magic by swift movement , it still conveyed the sense of [hills]2473-hills . Quiet mysteries were in progress behind those tossing horizons : [the West]195-the west , as ever , was retreating with some secret which may not be worth the discovery , but which [no practical man]2596-no practical man will ever discover .

[They]1631-the men spoke of [Tariff Reform]484-tariff reform .

[Charles]261-mr. wilcox was absolutely honest . [He]261-mr. wilcox described what [he]261-mr. wilcox believed to have happened . [Charles]261-mr. wilcox believed in temptresses , who are indeed [the strong man]2684-the strong man 's necessary complement , and having no sense of humour , [he]261-mr. wilcox could not purge [himself]261-mr. wilcox of the thought by a smile . [[Margaret]278-margaret , who was engaged to [[his]2655-the colonel father]4006-his father , and [[his]2655-the colonel sister 's wedding - guest]2687-his sister 's wedding - guest]2685-margaret , who was engaged to his father , and his sister 's wedding - guest , kept on [her]278-margaret way without noticing [him]2655-the colonel , and [he]2655-the colonel admitted that [he]2655-the colonel had wronged [her]2679-one of the ladies on this point . " [That woman]5062-that woman means mischief , "[261-mr. wilcox] thought [Charles]261-mr. wilcox , and compressed [his]261-mr. wilcox lips . In a few minutes [he]261-mr. wilcox followed [her]2679-one of the ladies indoors , as the ground was getting damp . Mists were rising from [the river]4306-the river , and presently it became invisible , though it whispered more loudly . There had been a heavy downpour in [the Welsh hills]211-the welsh hills .

Chapter 26

Next morning a fine mist covered [the peninsula]2608-the peninsula . The weather promised well , and the outline of [the castle mound]2664-the castle mound grew clearer each moment that [Margaret]278-margaret watched it . Presently [she]278-margaret saw [the keep]2688-the keep , and the sun painted the rubble gold , and charged the white sky with blue . The shadow of [the house]578-the house gathered itself together and fell over [the garden]581-the garden . A cat looked up at [her]278-margaret window and mewed . Lastly [the river]4306-the river appeared , still holding the mists between [its]4306-the river banks and [its]4306-the river overhanging alders , and only visible as far as [a hill]2697-a hill , which cut off [its]4306-the river upper reaches .

[Margaret]278-margaret was fascinated by [Oniton]278-margaret . [She]278-margaret had said that [she]278-margaret loved it , but it was rather its romantic tension that held [her]278-margaret . [The rounded Druids of whom [she]278-margaret had caught glimpses in [her]278-margaret drive]2698-the rounded druids of whom she had caught glimpses in her drive , the rivers hurrying down from [them]2698-the rounded druids of whom she had caught glimpses in her drive to [England]35-england , [the carelessly modelled masses of [the lower hills]2700-the lower hills]2699-the carelessly modelled masses of the lower hills , thrilled [her]278-margaret with poetry . [The house]578-the house was insignificant , but the prospect from [it]578-the house would be an eternal joy , and [she]278-margaret thought of all [the friends [she]278-margaret would have to stop in [it]578-the house]2702-the friends she would have to stop in it , and of the conversion of [Henry]360-henry [himself]360-henry to a rural life . [The rector of [the parish]2704-the parish]2703-the rector of the parish had dined with [them]2705-them last night , and [she]278-margaret found that [he]2703-the rector of the parish was [a friend of [[her]278-margaret father]915-her father 's]2706-a friend of her father 's , and so knew what to find in [her]278-margaret . [Charles]261-mr. wilcox and [Albert Fussell]349-albert fussell now crossed [the lawn]598-the lawn . [She]278-margaret had meant to take a stroll [herself]278-margaret before breakfast , but saw that the day was still sacred to [men]616-men , and amused [herself]278-margaret by watching [their]2713-their contretemps . "[360-henry] [he]360-henry said bitingly . " [I]360-henry do . Allow [me]360-henry to congratulate [you]278-margaret on the success of [your]278-margaret plan . "[360-henry]

" [I]360-henry now understand [your]278-margaret interest in [the Basts]405-the basts . Very well thought out . [I]360-henry am amused at [your]278-margaret caution , [Margaret]278-margaret . Still [she]2875-she could not understand . [She]2875-she knew of life 's seamy side as a theory ; [she]2875-she could not grasp it as a fact . More words from [Jacky]325-jacky were necessary - words unequivocal , undenied .

" So that - "[2875-she] burst from [her]2875-she , and [she]2875-she went indoors . [She]2875-she stopped [herself]2875-she from saying more .

" So what ? "[481-colonel fussell] asked [Colonel Fussell]481-colonel fussell , who was getting ready to start in [the hall]1039-the hall .

" [We]5351-we were saying - [Henry]360-henry and [I]2875-she were just having the fiercest argument , [my]2875-she point being - "[2875-she] Seizing [his]325-jacky fur coat from [a footman]2877-a footman , [she]2875-she offered to help [him]325-jacky on . [She]278-margaret left [him]325-jacky without a word . For it was not [her]278-margaret tragedy : it was [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox 's .

Chapter 27

[Helen]479-helen began to wonder why [she]479-helen had spent a matter of eight pounds in making [some people]4051-some people ill and [others]893-others angry . " [You]479-helen 're still wrong . [You]479-helen 've forgotten [Death]495-death . "[479-helen]

" If [we]5403-we lived for ever what [you]479-helen say would be true . But [we]5403-we have to die , [we]5403-we have to leave life presently . [I]479-helen love [Death]495-death - not morbidly , but because [He]317-leonard explains . [He]317-leonard shows [me]479-helen the emptiness of Money . " [I]479-helen wonder . "[479-helen]

[Sane , sound Englishmen]5409-sane , sound englishmen ! building up empires , levelling [all the world]5410-all the world into what [they]5409-sane , sound englishmen call common sense . "[479-helen]

" [I]479-helen am as afraid of [Death]495-death as [any one]4139-any one . "[479-helen]

" But what is the difference ? "[479-helen]

" Infinite difference , "[479-helen] said [Helen]479-helen , more gravely than before .

[Leonard]317-leonard looked at [her]479-helen wondering , and had the sense of great things sweeping out of the shrouded night . But [he]317-leonard could not receive them , because [his]317-leonard heart was still full of little things . As the lost umbrella had spoilt the concert at [Queen 's Hall]55-queen 's hall , so the lost situation was obscuring the diviner harmonies now . [Death]495-death , Life and Materialism were fine words , but would [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox take [him]317-leonard on as [a clerk]1767-a clerk ? Talk as [one]602-one would , [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox was king of [this world]1806-this world , [the superman]2920-the superman , with [his]261-mr. wilcox own morality , whose head remained in the clouds .

" [I]317-leonard must be stupid , "[317-leonard] [he]317-leonard said apologetically .

While to [Helen]479-helen the paradox became clearer and clearer . " [Death]495-death destroys [a man]658-a man : the idea of [Death]495-death saves [him]658-a man . "[479-helen] Behind the coffins and the skeletons that stay the vulgar mind lies something so immense that all that is great in [us]2921-us responds to it . [Men of [the world]836-the world]2922-men of the world may recoil from [the charnel - house that [they]2922-men of the world will one day enter]2924-the charnel - house that they will one day enter , but [Love]444-love knows better . " So never give in , "[969-the girl] continued [the girl]969-the girl , and restated again and again the vague yet convincing plea that [the Invisible]512-the invisible lodges against [the Visible]513-the visible . Chapter 28

For many hours [Margaret]278-margaret did nothing ; then [she]278-margaret controlled [herself]278-margaret , and wrote some letters . [She]278-margaret was too bruised to speak to [Henry]360-henry ; [she]278-margaret could pity [him]360-henry , and even determine to marry [him]360-henry , but as yet all lay too deep in [her]278-margaret heart for speech . On the surface the sense of [his]360-henry degradation was too strong . [She]278-margaret could not command voice or look , and the gentle words that [she]278-margaret forced out through [her]278-margaret pen seemed to proceed from [some other person]2933-some other person .

" [[My]278-margaret dearest boy]5413-my dearest boy , "[278-margaret] [she]278-margaret began , " this is not to part [us]5414-us . It is everything or nothing , and [I]278-margaret mean it to be nothing . It happened long before [we]5414-us ever met , and even if it had happened since , [I]278-margaret should be writing the same , [I]278-margaret hope . [I]278-margaret do understand . "[278-margaret]

But [she]278-margaret crossed out " [I]278-margaret do understand "[278-margaret] ; it struck a false note . [Henry]360-henry could not bear to be understood . [She]278-margaret also crossed out , " It is everything or nothing . "[278-margaret] [Henry]360-henry would resent so strong a grasp of the situation . [She]278-margaret must not comment ; comment is unfeminine .

" [I]278-margaret think that 'll about do , "[278-margaret] [she]278-margaret thought .

Then the sense of [his]360-henry degradation choked [her]278-margaret . Was [he]360-henry worth all this bother ? To have yielded to [a woman of that sort]2934-a woman of that sort was everything , yes , it was , and [she]278-margaret could not be [[his]360-henry wife]1450-his wife . [She]278-margaret tried to translate [his]360-henry temptation into [her]278-margaret own language , and [her]278-margaret brain reeled . [Men]616-men must be different , even to want to yield to such a temptation . [Her]278-margaret belief in comradeship was stifled , and [she]278-margaret saw life as from that glass saloon on [the Great Western]217-the great western , which sheltered male and female alike from the fresh air . Are the sexes really races , each with its own code of morality , and [their]616-men mutual love a mere device of Nature to keep things going ? Strip human intercourse of the proprieties , and is it reduced to this ? [Her]278-margaret judgment told [her]278-margaret no . [She]278-margaret knew that out of [Nature]381-nature 's device [we]2937-we have built a magic that will win [us]2937-we immortality . " [Men]616-men did produce one jewel , "[1899-the gods] [the gods]1899-the gods will say , and , saying , will give [us]2937-we immortality . [Dear Mr. Bast]319-mr. bast ,

And yet - what could an explanation tell [her]278-margaret ? A date , a place , a few details , which [she]278-margaret could imagine all too clearly . When [[men]616-men like [us]2968-us]2967-men like us , it is for [our]2968-us better qualities , and however tender [their]616-men liking , [we]2968-us dare not be unworthy of it , or [they]616-men will quietly let [us]2968-us go . But unworthiness stimulates [woman]1451-woman . It brings out [her]1451-woman deeper nature , for good or for evil .

Here was the core of the question . [Henry]360-henry must be forgiven , and made better by love ; nothing else mattered . [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox , [that unquiet yet kindly ghost]2970-that unquiet yet kindly ghost , must be left to [her]528-mrs. wilcox own wrong . Glancing at these , [he]3007-he saw that [the car]1528-the car would be round during the next five , and plunged into action . Gongs were tapped , orders issued , [Margaret]278-margaret was sent to dress , and [the housemaid]3016-the housemaid to sweep up the long trickle of grass that [she]278-margaret had left across [the hall]1039-the hall . As is [Man]3975-man to the Universe , so was the mind of [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox to the minds of [some men]3019-some men - a concentrated light upon a tiny spot , a little Ten Minutes moving self - contained through its appointed years . No Pagan [he]3007-he , who lives for the Now , and may be wiser than [all philosophers]3020-all philosophers . [He]3007-he lived for the five minutes that have past , and the five to come ; [he]3007-he had the business mind .

How did [he]3007-he stand now , as [his]3007-he motor slipped out of [Oniton]278-margaret and breasted [the great round hills]3021-the great round hills ? [Margaret]278-margaret had heard a certain rumour , but was all right . [She]278-margaret had forgiven [him]3007-he , God bless [her]278-margaret , and [he]3007-he felt [the manlier for it]3022-the manlier for it . [Charles]261-mr. wilcox and [Evie]265-evie had not heard it , and never must hear . No more must [Paul]259-paul . Over [[his]259-paul children]896-his children [he]259-paul felt great tenderness , which [he]259-paul did not try to track to a cause : [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox was too far back in [his]259-paul life . [He]259-paul did not connect [her]528-mrs. wilcox with the sudden aching love that [he]259-paul felt for [Evie]265-evie . [Poor little Evie]265-evie ! [he]259-paul trusted that [Cahill]419-mr. cahill would make [her]265-evie [a decent husband]3024-a decent husband .

And [Margaret]278-margaret ? How did [she]278-margaret stand ?

[She]278-margaret had several minor worries . Clearly [[her]278-margaret sister]566-her sister had heard something . [She]278-margaret dreaded meeting [her]566-her sister in [town]4382-town . And [she]278-margaret was anxious about [Leonard]317-leonard , for whom [they]3027-they certainly were responsible . Nor ought [Mrs. Bast]395-mrs. bast to starve . But the main situation had not altered . [She]278-margaret still loved [Henry]360-henry . [His]360-henry actions , not [his]360-henry disposition , had disappointed [her]278-margaret , and [she]278-margaret could bear that . And [she]278-margaret loved [[her]278-margaret future [home]984-home]2537-her future home . Standing up in [the car]1528-the car , just where [she]278-margaret had leapt from [it]1528-the car two days before , [she]278-margaret gazed back with deep emotion upon [Oniton]278-margaret . Besides [the Grange]3031-the grange and [the Castle keep]3032-the castle keep , [she]278-margaret could now pick out [the church]1414-the church and the black - and - white gables of [the George]5316-the george . There was [the bridge]1839-the bridge , and [the river]4306-the river nibbling [[its]4306-the river green peninsula]3037-its green peninsula . [She]278-margaret could even see [the bathing - shed]2716-the bathing - shed , but while [she]278-margaret was looking for [Charles]261-mr. wilcox 's new springboard , [the forehead of [the hill]2623-the hill]3039-the forehead of the hill rose up and hid the whole scene .

[She]278-margaret never saw it again . Day and night [the river]4306-the river flows down into [England]35-england , day after day the sun retreats into [the Welsh mountains]3042-the welsh mountains , and [the tower]3043-the tower chimes , " See [the Conquering Hero]5456-the conquering hero . "[3880-the wilcoxes] But [the Wilcoxes]3880-the wilcoxes have no part in [the place]5142-the place , nor in any place . It is not [their]3880-the wilcoxes names that recur in [the parish register]3046-the parish register . It is not [their]3880-the wilcoxes ghosts that sigh among the alders at evening . [They]3880-the wilcoxes have swept into [the valley]3047-the valley and swept out of [it]3047-the valley , leaving a little dust and a little money behind .

Chapter 30

[Tibby]262-tibby was now approaching [his]262-tibby last year at [Oxford]96-oxford . [He]262-tibby had moved out of college , and was contemplating [the Universe]219-the universe , or such portions of it as concerned [him]262-tibby , from [[his]262-tibby comfortable lodgings in [Long Wall]220-long wall]3048-his comfortable lodgings in long wall . [He]262-tibby was not concerned with much . When [a young man]4012-a young man is untroubled by passions and sincerely indifferent to public opinion , [his]4012-a young man outlook is necessarily limited . [Tibby]262-tibby neither wished to strengthen the position of [the rich]1067-the rich nor to improve that of [the poor]996-the poor , and so was well content to watch the elms nodding behind [the mildly embattled parapets of [Magdalen]221-magdalen]3052-the mildly embattled parapets of magdalen . There are worse lives . Though selfish , [he]262-tibby was never cruel ; though affected in manner , [he]262-tibby never posed . Like [Margaret]278-margaret , [he]262-tibby disdained the heroic equipment , and it was only after many visits that [men]616-men discovered [Schlegel]278-margaret to possess a character and a brain . [He]262-tibby had done well in Mods , much to the surprise of [those who attended lectures and took proper exercise]3054-those who attended lectures and took proper exercise , and was now glancing disdainfully at [Chinese]519-chinese in case [he]262-tibby should some day consent to qualify as [a Student Interpreter]3055-a student interpreter . [He]262-tibby noticed , in a distant way , that [[his]262-tibby sister]1485-his sister had altered . " Good God alive ! "[262-tibby] said [Tibby]262-tibby , and went crimson .

" Now , what is the good of [driblets]5480-driblets ? [He]262-tibby walked with [her]3077-i to [the station]671-the station , passing through [those streets whose serried beauty]3079-those streets whose serried beauty never bewildered [him]262-tibby and never fatigued . [The lovely creature]3080-the lovely creature raised domes and spires into the cloudless blue , and only the ganglion of vulgarity round [Carfax]524-carfax showed how evanescent was the phantom , how faint its claim to represent [England]35-england . [Helen]479-helen , rehearsing [her]479-helen commission , noticed nothing : the Basts were in [her]479-helen brain , and [she]479-helen retold the crisis in a meditative way , which might have made [other men]1108-other men curious . [She]479-helen was seeing whether it would hold . [He]262-tibby asked [her]479-helen once why [she]479-helen had taken [the Basts]405-the basts right into the heart of [Evie]265-evie 's wedding . It is convenient to follow [him]262-tibby in the discharge of [his]262-tibby duties . [Margaret]278-margaret summoned [him]262-tibby the next day . [She]278-margaret was terrified at [Helen]479-helen 's flight , and [he]262-tibby had to say that [she]278-margaret had called in at [Oxford]96-oxford . Then [she]278-margaret said : " Did [she]278-margaret seem worried at any rumour about [Henry]360-henry ? "[278-margaret] [He]262-tibby answered , " Yes . "[278-margaret] " [I]278-margaret knew it was that ! "[278-margaret] [she]278-margaret exclaimed . " [I]278-margaret 'll write to [her]278-margaret . "[278-margaret] [Tibby]262-tibby was relieved .

[He]262-tibby then sent the cheque to the address that [Helen]479-helen gave [him]262-tibby , and stated that later on [he]262-tibby was instructed to forward five thousand pounds . An answer came back , very civil and quiet in tone - such an answer as [Tibby]262-tibby [himself]262-tibby would have given . The cheque was returned , the legacy refused , [the writer]3083-the writer being in no need of money . [Tibby]262-tibby forwarded this to [Helen]479-helen , adding in the fulness of [his]262-tibby heart that [Leonard Bast]317-leonard seemed somewhat [a monumental person after all]3084-a monumental person after all . [Helen]479-helen 's reply was frantic . [He]262-tibby was to take no notice . [He]262-tibby was to go down at once and say that [she]479-helen commanded acceptance . [He]262-tibby went . A scurf of books and china ornaments awaited [them]3085-them . [The Basts]405-the basts had just been evicted for not paying [their]3085-them rent , and had wandered [no one]700-no one knew whither . [Helen]479-helen had begun bungling with [her]479-helen money by this time , and had even sold out [her]479-helen shares in [the Nottingham and Derby Railway]711-the nottingham and derby railway . For some weeks [she]479-helen did nothing . Then [she]479-helen reinvested , and , owing to the good advice of [[her]479-helen stockbrokers]3088-her stockbrokers , became rather richer than [she]479-helen had been before .

Chapter 31

[Houses]4053-houses have [their]4053-houses own ways of dying , falling as variously as the generations of [men]616-men , some with a tragic roar , some quietly , but to an after - life in [the city of ghosts]3091-the city of ghosts , while from [others]893-others - and thus was the death of [Wickham Place]11-wickham place - the spirit slips before the body perishes . [It]11-wickham place had decayed in the spring , disintegrating [the girls]716-the girls more than [they]716-the girls knew , and causing either to accost [unfamiliar regions]3094-unfamiliar regions . By [September]145-september [it]11-wickham place was a corpse , void of emotion , and scarcely hallowed by the memories of thirty years of happiness . Through [its]11-wickham place round - topped doorway passed furniture , and pictures , and books , until [the last room]3095-the last room was gutted and [the last van]3096-the last van had rumbled away . [It]11-wickham place stood for a week or two longer , open - eyed , as if astonished at [its]11-wickham place own emptiness . Then it fell . [Navvies]3097-navvies came , and spilt it back into the grey . With [their]3097-navvies muscles and [their]3097-navvies beery good temper , [they]3097-navvies were not [the worst of undertakers for [a house which had always been human , and had not mistaken culture for an end]3099-a house which had always been human , and had not mistaken culture for an end]3098-the worst of undertakers for a house which had always been human , and had not mistaken culture for an end .

The furniture , with a few exceptions , went down into [Hertfordshire]77-hertfordshire , [Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox having most kindly offered [Howards End]257-helen as [a warehouse]3100-a warehouse . [Mr. Bryce]457-mr. bryce had died abroad - an unsatisfactory affair - and as there seemed little guarantee that the rent would be paid regularly , [he]457-mr. bryce cancelled the agreement , and resumed possession [himself]457-mr. bryce . Until [he]457-mr. bryce relet [the house]578-the house , [the Schlegels]270-the schlegels were welcome to stack [their]3097-navvies furniture in [the garage]1492-the garage and [lower rooms]3103-lower rooms . [Margaret]278-margaret demurred , but [Tibby]262-tibby accepted the offer gladly ; it saved [him]262-tibby from coming to any decision about the future . The plate and the more valuable pictures found [a safer home in [London]2-london]3104-a safer home in london , but the bulk of the things went country - ways , and were entrusted to the guardianship of [Miss Avery]469-miss avery .

Shortly before the move , [[our]3105-our hero]3106-our hero and [heroine]3107-heroine were married . [They]3108-they have weathered the storm , and may reasonably expect peace . [To have no illusions]3109-to have no illusions and yet to love - what stronger surety can [a woman]1137-a woman find ? [She]278-margaret had seen [[her]278-margaret husband]1223-her husband 's past as well as [his]1223-her husband heart . [She]278-margaret knew [her]278-margaret own heart with a thoroughness that [commonplace people]3112-commonplace people believe impossible . The heart of [Mrs. Wilcox]528-mrs. wilcox was alone hidden , and perhaps it is superstitious to speculate on the feelings of the dead . [They]3108-they were married quietly - really quietly , for as the day approached [she]278-margaret refused to go through another Oniton . [[Her]278-margaret brother]665-her brother gave [her]278-margaret away , [[her]278-margaret aunt]635-her aunt , who was out of health , presided over a few colourless refreshments . [The Wilcoxes]3880-the wilcoxes were represented by [Charles]261-mr. wilcox , who witnessed the marriage settlement , and by [Mr. Cahill]419-mr. cahill . [Paul]259-paul did send a cablegram . In a few minutes , and without the aid of music , [the clergyman]5396-the clergyman made [them]3108-they [man]3975-man and [wife]4777-wife , and soon the glass shade had fallen that cuts off [married couples from [the world]836-the world]3119-married couples from the world . [She]278-margaret , [a monogamist]3121-a monogamist , regretted the cessation of some of life 's innocent odours ; [he]3975-man , whose instincts were polygamous , felt morally braced by the change , and less liable to the temptations that had assailed [him]3975-man in the past .

[They]3108-they spent [their]3108-they honeymoon near [Innsbruck]225-innsbruck . [Henry]360-henry knew of [a reliable hotel]3122-a reliable hotel [there]4043-there , and [Margaret]278-margaret hoped for a meeting with [[her]278-margaret sister]566-her sister . In this [she]278-margaret was disappointed . Two months are surely enough to accustom [an outsider]3127-an outsider to a situation which [a wife]1506-a wife has accepted in two days , and [Margaret]278-margaret had again to regret [[her]278-margaret sister]566-her sister 's lack of self - control . In a long letter [she]278-margaret pointed out the need of charity in sexual matters : so little is known about [them]3130-them ; it is hard enough for [those who are personally touched to judge]3131-those who are personally touched to judge ; then how futile must be the verdict of [Society]371-society . " [I]479-helen do n't say there is no standard , for that would destroy morality ; only that there can be no standard until [our]5489-our impulses are classified and better understood . "[479-helen] [Helen]479-helen thanked [her]278-margaret for [her]278-margaret kind letter - rather a curious reply . [She]479-helen moved south again , and spoke of wintering in [Naples]75-naples .

[Mr. Wilcox]261-mr. wilcox was not sorry that the meeting failed . [Helen]479-helen left [him]261-mr. wilcox time to grow skin over [his]261-mr. wilcox wound . Incapable of grouping the past , [he]261-mr. wilcox confused the episode of [Jacky]325-jacky with another episode that had taken place in the days of [his]261-mr. wilcox bachelorhood . [His]261-mr. wilcox affection for [[his]261-mr. wilcox present wife]3136-his present wife grew steadily . [Man]3975-man is for war , [woman]1451-woman for the recreation of [the warrior]3142-the warrior , but [he]261-mr. wilcox does not dislike it if [she]3136-his present wife makes a show of fight . [Margaret]346-margaret had a bad attack of these nerves during the honeymoon . [Margaret]346-margaret was silent . Marriage had not saved [her]346-margaret from the sense of flux . [London]2-london was but a foretaste of this nomadic civilization which is altering human nature so profoundly , and throws upon personal relations a stress greater than [they]3151-they have ever borne before . Under cosmopolitanism , if it comes , [we]3152-we shall receive no help from [the earth]1464-the earth . Trees and [meadows and mountains]3154-meadows and mountains will only be a spectacle , and the binding force that [they]3151-they once exercised on character must be entrusted to Love alone . May Love be equal to the task !

So [Ducie Street]128-ducie street was [her]346-margaret first fate - a pleasant enough fate . [The house]578-the house , being only a little larger than [Wickham Place]11-wickham place , trained [her]346-margaret for [the immense establishment that was promised in the spring]3156-the immense establishment that was promised in the spring . [They]3157-they were frequently away , but at [home]984-home life ran fairly regularly . In the morning [Henry]360-henry went to [the business]3159-the business , and [his]360-henry sandwich - a relic this of some prehistoric craving - was always cut by [her]346-margaret own hand . Yet the main cause lay deeper still ; [she]346-margaret had outgrown stimulants , and was passing from words to things . It was doubtless a pity not to keep up with [Wedekind]527-wedekind or [John]325-jacky , but some closing of the gates is inevitable after thirty , if the mind itself is to become a creative power .

[Margaret]346-margaret judged it better to settle the little trouble [herself]346-margaret . [Parties]530-parties were evidently ruffled . Chapter 33

The day of [her]346-margaret visit was exquisite , and the last of unclouded happiness that [she]346-margaret was to have for many months . [Her]346-margaret anxiety about [Helen]479-helen 's extraordinary absence was still dormant , and as for a possible brush with [Miss Avery]469-miss avery - that only gave zest to the expedition . [She]346-margaret had also eluded [Dolly]348-dolly 's invitation to luncheon . Walking straight up from [the station]671-the station , [she]346-margaret crossed [the village green]3191-the village green and entered [the long chestnut avenue]3192-the long chestnut avenue that connects [it]3191-the village green with [the church]1414-the church . [The church]1414-the church itself stood in [the village]3940-the village once . But [it]1414-the church there attracted [so many worshippers]3196-so many worshippers that [the devil , in a pet]3197-the devil , in a pet , snatched it from its foundations , and poised it on [an inconvenient knoll]3198-an inconvenient knoll , three - quarters of a mile away . If this story is true , [the chestnut avenue]3199-the chestnut avenue must have been planted by [the angels]3200-the angels . No more tempting approach could be imagined for [the luke - warm Christian]3201-the luke - warm christian , and if [he]3201-the luke - warm christian still finds the walk too long , [the devil]3202-the devil is defeated all the same , [Science]531-science having built [Holy Trinity]235-holy trinity , [a Chapel of Ease]3203-a chapel of ease , near [the Charles ']261-mr. wilcox , and roofed [it]235-holy trinity with tin .

Up [the avenue]3204-the avenue [Margaret]346-margaret strolled slowly , stopping to watch the sky that gleamed through the upper branches of the chestnuts , or to finger the little horseshoes on the lower branches . Why has not [England]35-england a great mythology ? [Our]3205-our folklore has never advanced beyond daintiness , and the greater melodies about [[our]3205-our country - side]3206-our country - side have all issued through the pipes of [Greece]142-greece . Deep and true as the native imagination can be , it seems to have failed [here]4094-here . It has stopped with [the witches]3208-the witches and the fairies . It can not vivify one fraction of a summer field , or give names to half a dozen stars . [England]35-england still waits for the supreme moment of [her]35-england literature - for [the great poet]3209-the great poet who shall voice [her]35-england , or , better still , for [the thousand little poets whose voices shall pass into]3210-the thousand little poets whose voices shall pass into [our]3205-our common talk .

At [the church]1414-the church the scenery changed . [The chestnut avenue]3199-the chestnut avenue opened into [a road]4584-a road , smooth but narrow , which led into [the untouched country]3214-the untouched country . [She]346-margaret followed [it]3199-the chestnut avenue for over a mile . Its little hesitations pleased [her]346-margaret . Having no urgent destiny , [it]3199-the chestnut avenue strolled downhill or up as [it]3199-the chestnut avenue wished , taking no trouble about the gradients , nor about the view , which nevertheless expanded . [The great estates that throttle [the south of [Hertfordshire]77-hertfordshire]3216-the south of hertfordshire]3215-the great estates that throttle the south of hertfordshire were less obtrusive [here]4094-here , and the appearance of [the land]5187-the land was neither aristocratic nor suburban . To define it was difficult , but [Margaret]346-margaret knew what it was not : it was not snobbish . Though its contours were slight , there was a touch of freedom in their sweep to which [Surrey]88-surrey will never attain , and [the distant brow of [the Chilterns]237-the chilterns]3219-the distant brow of the chilterns towered like [a mountain]3220-a mountain . " Left to itself , "[346-margaret] was [Margaret]346-margaret 's opinion , " [this county]5540-this county would vote [Liberal]533-liberal . Chapter 34

It was not unexpected entirely . [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley 's health had been bad all the winter . [She]267-aunt juley had had a long series of colds and coughs , and had been too busy to get rid of them . [She]267-aunt juley had scarcely promised [[her]267-aunt juley niece]710-her niece " to really take [my]267-aunt juley tiresome chest in hand , "[267-aunt juley] when [she]267-aunt juley caught a chill and developed acute pneumonia . [Margaret]278-margaret and [Tibby]262-tibby went down to [Swanage]12-swanage . [Helen]479-helen was telegraphed for , and that spring party that after all gathered in [that hospitable house]3305-that hospitable house had all the pathos of fair memories . On a perfect day , when the sky seemed blue porcelain , and the waves of [the discreet little bay]3306-the discreet little bay beat gentlest of tattoos upon the sand , [Margaret]278-margaret hurried up through the rhododendrons , confronted again by the senselessness of [Death]495-death . One death may explain itself , but it throws no light upon another : the groping inquiry must begin anew . [Preachers]3307-preachers or [scientists]3308-scientists may generalize , but [we]3309-we know that no generality is possible about [those whom [we]3309-we love]3310-those whom we love ; not one heaven awaits [them]3310-those whom we love , not even one oblivion . [Aunt Juley]267-aunt juley , incapable of tragedy , slipped out of life with odd little laughs and apologies for having stopped in it so long . [She]267-aunt juley was very weak ; [she]267-aunt juley could not rise to the occasion , or realize the great mystery which all agree must await [her]267-aunt juley ; it only seemed to [her]267-aunt juley that [she]267-aunt juley was quite done up - more done up than ever before ; that [she]267-aunt juley saw and heard and felt less every moment ; and that , unless something changed , [she]267-aunt juley would soon feel nothing . [Her]278-margaret spare strength [she]278-margaret devoted to plans : could not [Margaret]278-margaret take some steamer expeditions ? were mackerel cooked as [Tibby]262-tibby liked them ? [She]278-margaret worried [herself]278-margaret about [Helen]479-helen 's absence , and also that [she]278-margaret could be the cause of [Helen]479-helen 's return . [The nurses]3311-the nurses seemed to think such interests quite natural , and perhaps [hers]278-margaret was an average approach to the Great Gate . But [Margaret]278-margaret saw [Death]495-death stripped of any false romance ; whatever the idea of Death may contain , the process can be trivial and hideous .

That was the stock criticism about [Helen]268-helen , but [Margaret]278-margaret 's voice trembled as [she]278-margaret made it . Well , it is odd and sad that [our]3322-our minds should be such seed - beds , and [we]3322-our without power to choose the seed . Chapter 35

One speaks of the moods of spring , but the days that are [[her]3375-her true children]3376-her true children have only one mood ; they are all full of the rising and dropping of winds , and the whistling of birds . Chapter 38

The tragedy began quietly enough , and like many another talk , by [the man]807-the man 's deft assertion of [his]807-the man superiority . It was the crisis of [his]360-henry life . Again [she]278-margaret would have recalled the words as soon as they were uttered . [She]278-margaret had not led up to them with sufficient care . " [I]3504-you do n't agree there , [[my]3504-you dear]3898-my dear ! Associations and so on . Now [Helen]257-helen has no associations with [Howards End]257-helen , though [I]3504-you and [Charles]528-mrs. wilcox and [Evie]265-evie have . Then [he]3504-you surprised [her]278-margaret - a rare occurrence . [He]3504-you shot an unexpected bolt . " If [she]257-helen wants to sleep one night , [she]257-helen may want to sleep two . [We]5792-we shall never get [her]257-helen out of [the house]578-the house , perhaps . "[3504-you]
